original: gcig la rdo rje ba btang ste /
analyzed: gcig la rdo rje ba btang ste /
translated: The vajra base is placed on one of them.

original: kha khyer gcig la sems dpa' bcu drug / gcig la bskal bzang rgyal sras bcu drug / gru chad kyi nang gnyis la mchod pa'i lha mo brgyang /
analyzed: kha khyer gcig la sems dpa' bcu drug / gcig la bskal bzang rgyal sras bcu drug / gru chad kyi nang gnyis la mchod pa'i lha mo brgyang /
translated: On one of the ledges there are sixteen bodhisattvas, on the other the sixteen conquerors of the fortunate eon. On the two inner corners there are eight offering goddesses.

original: bzhi cha gcig la mchod pa rnams dang / dri reg dang / p'a nytsa re ga dang / sgo bzhi mu khyud dang bcas pa'i sa bcad do //
analyzed: bzhi cha gcig la mchod pa rnams dang / dri reg dang / p'a nytsa re ga dang / sgo bzhi mu khyud dang bcas pa'i sa bcad do //
translated: On one of the four parts there are the offerings, smell, touch, taste, and sight, and the four doors with the surrounding rim.

original: de'i sum cha gcig phyir bcad do //
analyzed: de'i sum cha gcig phyir bcad do //
translated: One third of that is cut away.🔽The trees are left.

original: shing rnams gzhag / bzhi'i cha thab lhag kha gnyis su 'chad de /
analyzed: shing rnams gzhag / bzhi'i cha thab lhag kha gnyis su 'chad de /
translated: The remaining two parts of the four parts are explained as the hearth.

original: gong ma'i sum cha la phyed po de yar bsnan la /
analyzed: gong ma'i sum cha la phyed po de yar bsnan la /
translated: The upper third is added to the half.

original: shing gi snam bu la gzhag //
analyzed: shing gi snam bu la gzhag //
translated: It is placed on the tree ledge.

original: phyed po de sum cha sum gnyis su btang la /
analyzed: phyed po de sum cha sum gnyis su btang la /
translated: That half is divided into three and two thirds.

original: shing snam dang / nye ba'i sum cha gcig / mchod snam sum gnyis /
analyzed: shing snam dang / nye ba'i sum cha gcig / mchod snam sum gnyis /
translated: One third of the tree ledge, one third of the near ledge, and two thirds of the offering ledge.

original: 'jig rten ba'i snam bu bzhi cha phyed ni kha gnyis su btang ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ba'i snam bu bzhi cha phyed ni kha gnyis su btang ste /
translated: The worldly ledge is divided into two parts.

original: gza' dang rgyu skar gyi snam bu'o //
analyzed: gza' dang rgyu skar gyi snam bu'o //
translated: The ledge of the planets and stars.

original: phyi ma sgo sna ma mo //
analyzed: phyi ma sgo sna ma mo //
translated: The latter is the door ledge.

original: dbus kyi thab khung thig bzhi btab pa'i re'u mig dgur byas la /
analyzed: dbus kyi thab khung thig bzhi btab pa'i re'u mig dgur byas la /
translated: In the central hearth, make a grid of nine squares by drawing four lines.

original: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya 'khor lo 'joms ba la 'bur du @184a * //🔽btod nas bri /
analyzed: dbus su rnam par snang mdzad kyi phyag rgya 'khor lo 'joms ba la 'bur du @184a * // btod nas bri /
translated: In the center, draw the wheel, the mudra of Vairochana, in relief.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snam bu gnyis ni sems dpa' bskal bzang shing snam bar du bcug pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i snam bu gnyis ni sems dpa' bskal bzang shing snam bar du bcug pa ni /
translated: The two transcendent platforms are the bodhisattvas of the fortunate eon, placed in the middle of the tree platforms.

original: 'jig rten pa phrag dog che ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa phrag dog che ba'i phyir ram /
translated: This is because the worldly ones are very jealous,🔽or because the worldly and transcendent ones are recognized.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ngo shes pa'i phyir gzhag /'jig rten pa'i snam bu gnyis ni ;
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ngo shes pa'i phyir gzhag /'jig rten pa'i snam bu gnyis ni ;
translated: The two worldly platforms are

original: bar ma phyogs skyong bcu dang bkra shis brgyang /
analyzed: bar ma phyogs skyong bcu dang bkra shis brgyang /
translated: the ten direction protectors and the eight auspicious symbols in the middle,

original: tha ma gtsug lag khang gi srung ma dang / gza' dang rgyu skar dang / rgyal po bzhi /
analyzed: tha ma gtsug lag khang gi srung ma dang / gza' dang rgyu skar dang / rgyal po bzhi /
translated: and the four kings, the planets, the lunar mansions, and the protectors of the temple on the outer edge.

original: de rnams bri ba'i dgos ched ni /
analyzed: de rnams bri ba'i dgos ched ni /
translated: The purpose of drawing them is

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' srung dang / rang gi 'khor gyi gdug pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i mngon rtogs ston pa'i phyir bri /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' srung dang / rang gi 'khor gyi gdug pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa'i mngon rtogs ston pa'i phyir bri /
translated: to protect the teachings of the Bhagavat, to pacify the harm of one's own retinue, and to demonstrate the worldly realizations.

original: da ni mchod pa'i rgyan chas ston te /
analyzed: da ni mchod pa'i rgyan chas ston te /
translated: Now the ornaments and articles of offering are shown.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽The full bird and vase are placed,

original: bya dang bum pa gang ba gzhag / ces pa dang / khung bu'i dbus su gzhag bar bya //🔽zhes pa'i bar ni /🔽'khor ba'i nye gnas la phan 'dogs pa'i rtags dngul gyi bya po bcu drug dang ; chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rtags gser gyi bum pa lnga dang / thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i rtags gtor ma dang / khams gsum tshim par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya dang bum pa gang ba gzhag / ces pa dang / khung bu'i dbus su gzhag bar bya // zhes pa'i bar ni / 'khor ba'i nye gnas la phan 'dogs pa'i rtags dngul gyi bya po bcu drug dang ; chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rtags gser gyi bum pa lnga dang / thabs dang shes rab zung du 'brel pa'i rtags gtor ma dang / khams gsum tshim par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and in the center of the hole, one should place.🔽The sixteen silver birds are the sign of benefiting the retinue of samsara; the five golden vases are the sign of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu; the torma is the sign of the union of method and wisdom; and the various foods and edibles are for the sake of satisfying the three realms.

original: bza' ba dang bca' sna tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag lam tog sna tshogs pa dang / thugs rje rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phreng ba dang / khams gsum gyi bla mar gyur pas bla re dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal ba'i rtags rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' sna tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag lam tog sna tshogs pa dang / thugs rje rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phreng ba dang / khams gsum gyi bla mar gyur pas bla re dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal ba'i rtags rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: The various lamps of the branches of enlightenment, the garland of uninterrupted compassion, the canopy of becoming the guru of the three realms, the victory banner that is the sign of victory over the demon of afflictions, the banner of the victory of the three realms, the parasol of the three realms, the various incense of the three realms, the various lamps of the three realms, the various scents of the three realms, the various tastes of the three realms, the various tangibles of the three realms, the various sounds of the three realms, and the various objects of the three realms are for the sake of satisfying the three realms.

original: ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rtags dar sna tshogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i tsha bas gdung ba las bsil ba'i gdugs dang / ting nge 'dzin la shes pa rtsal sbyong ba dang / dam rdzas dang ldan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rtags dar sna tshogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i tsha bas gdung ba las bsil ba'i gdugs dang / ting nge 'dzin la shes pa rtsal sbyong ba dang / dam rdzas dang ldan par bya ba ste /
translated: The consecration of the pledge substances is the training of the power of wisdom in samadhi.

original: sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab cing /🔽ye shes kyi 'od zer dmigs nas bsreg rdzas dang / mchod rdzas la sogs pa kun ni /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgyas byin gyis brlab cing / ye shes kyi 'od zer dmigs nas bsreg rdzas dang / mchod rdzas la sogs pa kun ni /
translated: Consecrate with mantra and mudra.🔽The sign of pleasing the aryas and attaining siddhi is placing all the burnt offerings, offering substances, and so on in the center of the pit.

original: 'phags pa mnyes par bya ba dang / dngos grub thob pa'i rtags su khung bu'i dbus su gzhag / da ni ro byin gyis brlab cing rgyas gdab pa ston te /
analyzed: 'phags pa mnyes par bya ba dang / dngos grub thob pa'i rtags su khung bu'i dbus su gzhag / da ni ro byin gyis brlab cing rgyas gdab pa ston te /
translated: Now, the consecration and sealing of the corpse will be explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ro la sngags kyis btab nas kyang //
analyzed: ro la sngags kyis btab nas kyang //
translated: Having applied mantra to the corpse,

original: chu mchog gis ni bkru bar bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chu mchog gis ni bkru bar bya // zhes pa ni /
translated: it should be washed with the supreme water.

original: ro ni rgyu 'bras kyi tshul gong du smos pa'o //
analyzed: ro ni rgyu 'bras kyi tshul gong du smos pa'o //
translated: That being so, the corpse is the cause and the result, as mentioned above.

original: sngags ni rigs rnam pa lnga'i sku bskyed pa dang / @184b snying po dang / nye ba'i snying po dang lnga ste bco lnga'o //
analyzed: sngags ni rigs rnam pa lnga'i sku bskyed pa dang / @184b snying po dang / nye ba'i snying po dang lnga ste bco lnga'o //
translated: The mantras are the generation of the bodies of the five families, the essence, and the quintessence, making fifteen.

original: stong par bsgom pa dang / rdo rje bsgom pa gnyis te bcu bcun no //
analyzed: stong par bsgom pa dang / rdo rje bsgom pa gnyis te bcu bcun no //
translated: There are two meditations: the meditation on emptiness and the meditation on the vajra.

original: btab nas kyang ni /
analyzed: btab nas kyang ni /
translated: Having sealed,

original: phyi'i btab pa ni lus la btab pa dang / nang gi btab pa ni yig 'bru ste /
analyzed: phyi'i btab pa ni lus la btab pa dang / nang gi btab pa ni yig 'bru ste /
translated: the external sealing is sealing the body, and the internal sealing is the seed syllables.

original: de rnams sprul pa rol ba stims nas dngos po med par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sprul pa rol ba stims nas dngos po med par bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having emanated those, one should meditate on the play of emanations dissolving and becoming nothing.

original: chu ni bum pa'i nang gi chu ste /
analyzed: chu ni bum pa'i nang gi chu ste /
translated: The water is the water in the vase.

original: dri zhim po la sogs pa gzhung nas 'byung ba rnams spyar ro //
analyzed: dri zhim po la sogs pa gzhung nas 'byung ba rnams spyar ro //
translated: One should add the pleasant smells and so on that appear in the treatise.

original: mchog ni snying po bcu bdun gyis byang chub sems zla ba'i mandala du gyur par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni snying po bcu bdun gyis byang chub sems zla ba'i mandala du gyur par bsgom pa'o //
translated: The supreme is meditating on the bodhicitta as a moon maṇḍala with the seventeen essences.

original: bkru bar bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bkru bar bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of washing:

original: phyi'i bkru ba bum pa'i chus 'khru ba dang / nang gi bkrus ting nge 'dzin gyi 'phro 'dus dag par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi'i bkru ba bum pa'i chus 'khru ba dang / nang gi bkrus ting nge 'dzin gyi 'phro 'dus dag par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: the external washing is washing with the water of the vase, and the internal washing is purifying with the emanation and reabsorbing of samādhi.

original: bzlas pa dri yis byug par bya //
analyzed: bzlas pa dri yis byug par bya //
translated: One should anoint with the scent of mantra recitation.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bzlas pa dang / yig 'bru dang 'phro 'du'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bzlas pa dang / yig 'bru dang 'phro 'du'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: the recitation of meditative concentration, the recitation of syllables, and the recitation of emanation and reabsorption.

original: dri gur gum la sogs pas lus la byug pa dang / tshul khrims kyi dris byin gyis brlabs pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri gur gum la sogs pas lus la byug pa dang / tshul khrims kyi dris byin gyis brlabs pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Anointing with the scent of saffron and so forth means blessing with the scent of ethical discipline.

original: gos dang rgyan gyis klubs nas kyang //
analyzed: gos dang rgyan gyis klubs nas kyang //
translated: Having adorned with clothes and ornaments,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: this means

original: gos ni sngags mkhan gyi chas gos dang / ro'i gos ni phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i las gang byed pa'i tshul du byas la /
analyzed: gos ni sngags mkhan gyi chas gos dang / ro'i gos ni phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i las gang byed pa'i tshul du byas la /
translated: the clothes of the mantra practitioner and the clothes of the corpse, which are done in the manner of the four types of activity.

original: rgyan ni sku bre'u ldir gyi cod ban gyi rgyan la sogs pa btags pa dang ; klu bas ni mang ba dang mdzes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyan ni sku bre'u ldir gyi cod ban gyi rgyan la sogs pa btags pa dang ; klu bas ni mang ba dang mdzes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ornaments are the ornaments of the caṇḍālī fire and so forth, which are attached to the body, and the adornments are the many beautiful ornaments.

original: da ni rol sngags kyis byin gyis brlab cing gdags pa'i don te /
analyzed: da ni rol sngags kyis byin gyis brlab cing gdags pa'i don te /
translated: Now, the meaning of blessing and placing the corpse with the mantra is

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why?

original: sngags bris pa ni gdags par bya //
analyzed: sngags bris pa ni gdags par bya //
translated: The written mantra should be placed.

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is stated.

original: sngags ni lha so so'i yig 'bru'o //
analyzed: sngags ni lha so so'i yig 'bru'o //
translated: The mantra is the syllable of each deity.

original: bris pa'i ni grogs 'am shog shog la bri'o //
analyzed: bris pa'i ni grogs 'am shog shog la bri'o //
translated: The written ones are written on paper or cloth.

original: gdags pa ni lus la gdags pa'o //
analyzed: gdags pa ni lus la gdags pa'o //
translated: The placed ones are placed on the body.

original: de'i gnas gnag yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gnas gnag yin zhe na /
translated: What are their locations?

original: snying ga lkog ma kha phyogs dang // dpral ba mdzod sbu rna ba gnyis //
analyzed: snying ga lkog ma kha phyogs dang // dpral ba mdzod sbu rna ba gnyis //
translated: The heart, throat, mouth, forehead, top of the head, ears,

original: mgo bo gtsug phud dpung pa gnyis //
analyzed: mgo bo gtsug phud dpung pa gnyis //
translated: head, top of the head, shoulders,

original: sna dang rked pa pus mo phol //
analyzed: sna dang rked pa pus mo phol //
translated: nose, waist, knees, and ankles,

original: long bu sna yi rtse mo dang // mi gnyis dang ni gsang ba'i gnas //🔽dbang po rnams kyi gnas dag tu //
analyzed: long bu sna yi rtse mo dang // mi gnyis dang ni gsang ba'i gnas // dbang po rnams kyi gnas dag tu //
translated: the tip of the nose, the two eyes, and the secret place.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: These are the locations of the sense organs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis /
translated: The perfect pristine consciousness of the tathāgatas

original: mtshan ma rnams gzhom par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma rnams gzhom par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: is the location of the destruction of signs.

original: de'i gnas ni bcu bdun yod de /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni bcu bdun yod de /
translated: There are seventeen locations of that.

original: rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang / de las byung ba lnga ste /
analyzed: rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang / de las byung ba lnga ste /
translated: There are twelve dependent originations and five that arise from that.

original: de rnams ni thugs kyi ngo bor spyar @185a * //🔽ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni thugs kyi ngo bor spyar @185a * // ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those are the locations of the body.

original: de mtshon ba'i gnas ni lus te /
analyzed: de mtshon ba'i gnas ni lus te /
translated: The locations that illustrate those are the body.

original: zi'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zi'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon gyi bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas sems rten pa'i gzhi byed bas /
analyzed: sngon gyi bag chags kyis bskyed pa'i rang bzhin yin pas sems rten pa'i gzhi byed bas /
translated: Since it is the nature generated by previous latent propensities, it serves as the basis for the mind to rest.

original: lus thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni mgo po ste /
analyzed: lus thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni mgo po ste /
translated: The nature of the entire body is the head.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: In the same way, ignorance is the nature of all afflictions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma rig pa mi shes pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la mgo rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa mi shes pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la mgo rmongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of ignorance, one is confused about suchness, the limit of reality, and cause and effect.

original: de 'joms pa'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de 'joms pa'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra that conquers that is

original: rin che me tog gi nye ba'i snying po ste /
analyzed: rin che me tog gi nye ba'i snying po ste /
translated: the essence of the precious flower.

original: aom sarba bid h'um phat /
analyzed: aom sarba bid h'um phat /
translated: Om sarva vid hum phat.

original: de mgo la gdags shing byin gyis brlabs pa tshul bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: de mgo la gdags shing byin gyis brlabs pa tshul bzhin bya'o //
translated: One should properly place and bless that on the head.

original: dpung pa ni las kyi 'du byed la rtsol bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na /
analyzed: dpung pa ni las kyi 'du byed la rtsol bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pas na /
translated: Since the shoulder is the cause for the exertion of the formation of karma,

original: dpe de dang 'dra bar ma rig pa mgo rmongs pas na /
analyzed: dpe de dang 'dra bar ma rig pa mgo rmongs pas na /
translated: in the same way, because of the confusion of ignorance,

original: phyi'i yul rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs ba skye ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir na 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i yul rnams la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs ba skye ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir na 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Since the afflictions such as desire arise in relation to external objects through the formation of mental imprints, it is the formation.

original: de sbyong  ba'i phyir sh'akya thub pa'i nye ba'i snying po ste /
analyzed: de sbyong  ba'i phyir sh'akya thub pa'i nye ba'i snying po ste /
translated: In order to purify that, the essence mantra of Śākyamuni is

original: aom sarba bid aa: dpung pa la gdags te gnyis su med par byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //
analyzed: aom sarba bid aa: dpung pa la gdags te gnyis su med par byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //
translated: oṃ sarva pīṭha aḥ.

original: snying ni khyad par du yang shes pa'i rang bzhin gnas pa'i yin te /
analyzed: snying ni khyad par du yang shes pa'i rang bzhin gnas pa'i yin te /
translated: The heart is especially the abode of the nature of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Likewise, consciousness

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis so so'i sprul pa rnam par rig cing ma 'dres par mchod pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis so so'i sprul pa rnam par rig cing ma 'dres par mchod pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: is the individual awareness of emanations through the condition of formation, and it is the apprehender of the self and what is mine.

original: de 'joms pa'i phrag rgyan ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis nying po ste /🔽aom sho dha ni sho dha ni sarba p'a pam bi sho dha ni /
analyzed: de 'joms pa'i phrag rgyan ni rnam par snang mdzad kyis nying po ste / aom sho dha ni sho dha ni sarba p'a pam bi sho dha ni /
translated: The armor of the heart is the essence mantra of Vairocana:🔽oṃ śodhani śodhani sarva pāpaṃ viśodhani

original: shuddhe bi shddhe sarba karma a'a ba ra na bi shuddhe sv'ah'a /
analyzed: shuddhe bi shddhe sarba karma a'a ba ra na bi shuddhe sv'ah'a /
translated: śuddhe viśuddhe sarva karmapāpaṃ viśodhani svāhā.

original: snying gar btags nas byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //
analyzed: snying gar btags nas byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is placed at the heart and blessed.

original: rkyen pa ni dang po phung po skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i rten lte ba'i thad ka nas ma zos pa'i drod kyis reg pas 'tsho bar bye dpas na lus byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: rkyen pa ni dang po phung po skye ba'i rgyu byed pa'i rten lte ba'i thad ka nas ma zos pa'i drod kyis reg pas 'tsho bar bye dpas na lus byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: The reason is that first, the cause of the arising of the aggregates is the support of the navel, which is touched by the heat that does not burn, and since it is made to live, it is the blessing of the body.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin la las kyi bcag zhags bsgos shing smon pas lhan cig skyes pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po ni ming dang gzugs 'di 'grub ste /

translated: Likewise, the nature of consciousness is moistened by the noose of karma and moistened by aspiration, and the coemergent appropriated aggregates are accomplished as name and form.

analyzed: de 'joms pa'i phyag rgya ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku bskyed pa'i sa bon te /

original: aom sarba bid aom /
analyzed: aom sarba bid aom /

analyzed: rked par byin gyis brlab cing gdags pa'i don to //

analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po gro ga gcus te bcad pa 'dra ba ni rnam @185b par shes pa skye zhing 'byung ba'i gzhi byed la /

analyzed: dper na rgyu ming dang gzugs la brten pa'i dbang po rnams ni skye mched drug ste / de 'joms pa ni /

analyzed: kun rig gi nye ba'i snying po ste /

analyzed: rna ba gnyis la gdags shing gnyis su med par byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //

analyzed: sna'i dbang po zangs ma'i mo khab gshibs pa dang 'dra ba ste /

analyzed: yul la brten nas rnam par shes pa byung nas yul nyams su myong ba'i don te /

analyzed: de bzhin du yul dang dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus nas /
translated: Likewise, when the three—the object, the faculty, and the consciousness—are combined,

analyzed: nyams su myangs nas phrad pa ni reg pa'o //

analyzed: de 'joms pa ni me tog cher rgyas kyi nye ba'i snying po ste /
translated: The destruction of that is the essence of the concise mantra of Mahasukhasamayavajra.

original: aom sarba bid tra tha /
analyzed: aom sarba bid tra tha /
translated: Om sarva-avidya-agni-vishuddhaya hana hum phat.

analyzed: sna la btags la byin gyis brlabs nas gnyis su med par bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is for the purpose of blessing the nose as nondual.

analyzed: dpral ba'i ngo bo ni bkrag mdangs 'byung pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhi ste /

original: de bzhin du reg pas yul dang phrad par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pas yul dang phrad par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: In the same way, when the object is contacted by touch,

analyzed: tsher bas yul gyi bde sdug nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba ste /
translated: the experience of the pleasure and pain of the object is feeling.

analyzed: de 'joms pa'i phyag rgya ni /
translated: The mudra that conquers that is

analyzed: me tog cher rgyas kyi snying pos te /

original: aom sarba bid tra tha /
analyzed: aom sarba bid tra tha /

analyzed: dpral bar btags nas byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //

analyzed: kha ni zas la sogs pa la sred pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu byed pas na /

analyzed: de bzhin du tshor bas yul gyi bde sdug nyams su myong nas phung po lnga la mngon par zhen pas ni sreg pa'o //
translated: In the same way, after the object is experienced as pleasure and pain by feeling, the craving for the five aggregates burns.

analyzed: de 'joms pa'i phyag rgya ni sh'akya thub pa'i snying po ste /

analyzed: sh'akya thub pa'i snying po snying gar btags la byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //

analyzed: pus mo ni brkyang ba dang / bskum pa'i rgyu byed de /

analyzed: pus tshigs te /

analyzed: de bzhin du sred pas yum gyi rnam par shes pa la shes pa la 'phel zhing 'byung ba'i rkyen gyis len pa ste /

analyzed: yul la bdag tu zhen pa'i don to //

analyzed: de 'joms pa ni ngan song sbyong ba'i sku bskyed pa'i snying po ste /
translated: The destroyer of that is the essence that generates the body of purifying the lower realms.🔽Om sarva-vid sva.

analyzed: aom sarba bid sva' bus mo gnyis la gtags la gnyis su med pa byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //

analyzed: de 'joms pa ni rin chen me tog gi sku bskyed pa'i snying po ste /

original: aom sarba bid aa /
analyzed: aom sarba bid aa /

analyzed: rkang pa'i bol gnyis la btags nas gnyis su med par byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //

analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas ni sems can skye ba'i rgyu sa bon 'byung ba'i gnas te /

analyzed: de bzhin du srid pas srid cing rtas par byed pas phung po smin cing ma'i mngal nas byung nas phyir 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Similarly, birth is the ripening of the aggregates, which are nourished and increased by existence, and the emergence from the mother's womb.

analyzed: de 'joms pa ni rdo rje'i bsgom pa ste / aom bha gsang ba'i gnas su gdags te /

analyzed: gnyis su med par byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //

analyzed: gtsug phud ni rgas pa'i rtags te /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: skra dkar por gyur pa'i rtags so //

analyzed: gtsug phud du btags te gnyis su med par byin gyis brlab bo //

original: // / da ni gtsug tor chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor ston te /🔽gtsug tor zhes bya ba ni dper na /
analyzed: // / da ni gtsug tor chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor ston te / gtsug tor zhes bya ba ni dper na /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala of the great uṣṇīṣa is shown.🔽“Uṣṇīṣa” is like the uṣṇīṣa of the head, the nature of the body.

original: lus kyi rang bzhin mgo'i gtsug yin la de bzhin du chos rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin mgo'i gtsug yin la de bzhin du chos rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: In the same way, the nature of phenomena is the pure dhātu,

original: chos kyi dbyings te dbus kyi pho brang zlum por ston te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings te dbus kyi pho brang zlum por ston te /
translated: shown as the round palace in the center.

original: sh'akya thub pa dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i don to //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa dkyil 'khor na bzhugs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of Śākyamuni residing in the maṇḍala is shown.

original: 'thor ni 'khor te sh'akya thub pa chos kyi sku las /
analyzed: 'thor ni 'khor te sh'akya thub pa chos kyi sku las /
translated: “Scattered” means the retinue. From the dharmakāya of Śākyamuni,

original: ye shes rnam pa bzhi dang phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i rtags /
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa bzhi dang phrin las rnam pa bzhi'i rtags /
translated: the signs of the four kinds of pristine consciousness and the four kinds of activities

original: gtsug tor brgyang 'khor du phyung pa ni 'thor ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gtsug tor brgyang 'khor du phyung pa ni 'thor ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: are extracted into the uṣṇīṣa maṇḍala. The meaning of “scattered” is the same.

original: thugs rjes 'gro ba'i las 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rjes 'gro ba'i las 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since compassion arises from the activities of migrating beings,

original: de'i don ba stan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i don ba stan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of that,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos te /
translated: it says “then the Bhagavān” and so on.

original: de ni gong gi cho ga'i don bsdus la /
analyzed: de ni gong gi cho ga'i don bsdus la /
translated: That is a summary of the meaning of the above ritual.

original: nas ni 'og ma'i dkyil 'khor mgo 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas ni 'og ma'i dkyil 'khor mgo 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Then” is for the sake of introducing the following maṇḍala.

original: bcom pa ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa phyin ci log pa'i skyon bcom pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom pa ni yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa phyin ci log pa'i skyon bcom pa yin la /
translated: “ Bhagavān” means that the faults of the afflictions of error are destroyed by means of perfect wisdom.

original: ldan pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: ldan pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs dang ldan pa la /
translated: “ Endowed” means endowed with the power of the perfections.

original: 'das ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: 'das ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “ Passed beyond” means free from the two extremes.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi.”

original: byang ba ni gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: byang ba ni gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis spangs pa yin la /
translated: “ Awakened” means free from the two aspects of grasped and grasper.

original: chub pa ni shes bya la ye shes kyis chub cing gnas la /
analyzed: chub pa ni shes bya la ye shes kyis chub cing gnas la /
translated: “ Realized” means that gnosis is realized and abides in the object of knowledge.

original: sems ni gnyis su med pa'i don la sems la /
analyzed: sems ni gnyis su med pa'i don la sems la /
translated: “ Mind” means the mind of nonduality.

original: dpa' ni de'i don la sran 'dzugs te /
analyzed: dpa' ni de'i don la sran 'dzugs te /
translated: “ Courageous” means the mind is firm in that meaning.

original: sems ni thugs rjes 'gro pa'i sems la /
analyzed: sems ni thugs rjes 'gro pa'i sems la /
translated: “ Mind” means the mind of compassion for migrating beings.

original: dpa' ni 'gro pa'i don la mi ldog pa ste //
analyzed: dpa' ni 'gro pa'i don la mi ldog pa ste //
translated: Heroic means not turning back from the purpose of going.

original: de ni gzhan dpa' ba'i phyir na chen po'o /
analyzed: de ni gzhan dpa' ba'i phyir na chen po'o /
translated: Since it is the great hero of others, it is great.

original: phyag na rdo rje ni dus gsum gyi rgyal pa thams cad kyi thugs las skyes pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje sku gsung thugs kyi gsang pa'i mdzod 'dzin pa'i bdud dang dregs byed 'dul pa'i rtags su rdo rje bsnams @192a * //🔽pas kyang rdo rje /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mid gi dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje ni dus gsum gyi rgyal pa thams cad kyi thugs las skyes pa'i phyir phyag na rdo rje sku gsung thugs kyi gsang pa'i mdzod 'dzin pa'i bdud dang dregs byed 'dul pa'i rtags su rdo rje bsnams @192a * // pas kyang rdo rje / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mid gi dbang bskur zhing /
translated: Since Vajrapani was born from the mind of all the Victorious Ones of the three times, he holds the treasury of the secrets of body, speech, and mind. As a sign of taming demons and arrogant ones, he holds a vajra.🔽Since he was given the name Vajrapani by the Tathagatas,

original: rdo rje lag tu byin pas kyang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lag tu byin pas kyang rdo rje'o //
translated: and since the Tathagatas placed a vajra in his hand, he is also Vajrapani.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus cho ga zhib mo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus cho ga zhib mo zhes pa ni /
translated: By the power of the Blessed One, it is called the extensive ritual.

original: dper na bon po lha bka' 'bebs pa ni /
analyzed: dper na bon po lha bka' 'bebs pa ni /
translated: For example, it is like when a Bönpo invokes a deity,

original: lha'i bka' zer ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: lha'i bka' zer ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: saying, The deity's words.

original: phyag na rdo rje bshad pa 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje bshad pa 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, this explanation of Vajrapani is also said to be by the power of the Blessed One.

original: cho ga sgrub par byed pa'i thabs la bya ste /
analyzed: cho ga sgrub par byed pa'i thabs la bya ste /
translated: It refers to the means of accomplishing the ritual.

original: zhib mo ni ma grub na sbogs pa'i cho ga byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhib mo ni ma grub na sbogs pa'i cho ga byed pa'o //
translated: If the subtle one is not accomplished, one should perform the enhancement ritual.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi ma 'di bshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi ma 'di bshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: This latter one is explained.

original: gong gi rtsa ba'i mandala gyi don 'dir 'dus pa'i phyir ram /🔽'di bsdu pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gong gi rtsa ba'i mandala gyi don 'dir 'dus pa'i phyir ram / 'di bsdu pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because the meaning of the above root maṇḍala is included here,🔽because it is included in this,

original: 'di dang 'brel pa'i phyir ni smos so //
analyzed: 'di dang 'brel pa'i phyir ni smos so //
translated: or because it is connected with this, it is mentioned.

original: dpa' bo gdan la bzhengs nas ni //
analyzed: dpa' bo gdan la bzhengs nas ni //
translated: The hero, having arisen on the seat,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: means

original: lta bas mtshan ma 'joms pa dang / thugs rjes 'khor pa 'joms pas dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: lta bas mtshan ma 'joms pa dang / thugs rjes 'khor pa 'joms pas dpa' ba'o //
translated: the hero who conquers signs with the view and conquers saṃsāra with compassion.

original: gdan ni ye shes te chos nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir na gdan /
analyzed: gdan ni ye shes te chos nyid dang 'brel pa'i phyir na gdan /
translated: The seat is wisdom, because it is connected with dharmatā.

original: thugs rjes 'khor pa las 'brel pa'i rtags su padmar ba stan pas na gdan /🔽bzhengs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka nas /🔽phyag na rdo rje'i sku phyung ba bzhengs nas /
analyzed: thugs rjes 'khor pa las 'brel pa'i rtags su padmar ba stan pas na gdan / bzhengs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka nas / phyag na rdo rje'i sku phyung ba bzhengs nas /
translated: The seat is taught as a lotus because it is a sign of being connected with saṃsāra through compassion.🔽Having arisen means🔽having extracted the form of Vajrapāṇi from the heart of the tathāgata.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i thugs ka nas ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i thugs ka nas ni /
translated: Having extracted the form of Vajrapāṇi from the heart of Vajrapāṇi,

original: gtsug tor brgyang 'byin pa'i phyir ni bzhengs pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor brgyang 'byin pa'i phyir ni bzhengs pa'o //
translated: having extracted the uṣṇīṣa, he arose.

original: dgyes shing rdo rje gsor nas ni //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dgyes shing rdo rje gsor nas ni // zhes pa ni /
translated: Having rejoiced and brandished the vajra,

original: dgyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: dgyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: means having rejoiced is the consecration by the Tathagata.

original: rgyud kyi don ston par dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don ston par dgyes pa'o //
translated: It is the delight in teaching the meaning of the tantra.

original: rdo rje ni rigs pas te /🔽mi 'gyur pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni rigs pas te / mi 'gyur pa'i don la'o //
translated: The vajra is the reasoning,

original: gsor pa ni phrin las te rgyud kyi don ston par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsor pa ni phrin las te rgyud kyi don ston par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning of brandished is the activity, the meaning of the tantra is taught.

original: sh'akya ni rgyal po sh'akya nyi ma dmar po'i rigs yin la /
analyzed: sh'akya ni rgyal po sh'akya nyi ma dmar po'i rigs yin la /
translated: The Shakya is the Shakya king, the lineage of the red sun.

original: gtso bo ni khams gsum gyi gtso bo'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtso bo ni khams gsum gyi gtso bo'i tha tshig go //
translated: The chief is the meaning of the chief of the three realms.

original: dgyes mdzad ni rgyud kyi don ston pa'i phyir na dgyes mdzad do //
analyzed: dgyes mdzad ni rgyud kyi don ston pa'i phyir na dgyes mdzad do //
translated: The delighted is the delighted one because of teaching the meaning of the tantra.

original: thub pa'i gtso la phyag 'tshal nas //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: thub pa'i gtso la phyag 'tshal nas // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having bowed to the chief of the sages,

original: thub pa ni sku gsung thugs thub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thub pa ni sku gsung thugs thub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means sage is because of the silence of body, speech, and mind.

original: gtso bo ni rkang gnyis kyi gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: gtso bo ni rkang gnyis kyi gtso bo yin la /
translated: The chief is the chief of the two-legged beings.

original: phyag 'tshal ni ya rabs bla ma'i tshul gzung pa'i phyir dang / sku gsung thugs nan tan bskyed pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ni ya rabs bla ma'i tshul gzung pa'i phyir dang / sku gsung thugs nan tan bskyed pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: The having bowed is because of upholding the way of the respectable guru, and because of generating the earnest intention of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yan chad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis //
analyzed: de yan chad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis //
translated: From this point on, it is through the blessings of the tathagatas that🔽

original: phyag na rdo rjes bshad pa ba stan zin to //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rjes bshad pa ba stan zin to //
translated: Up to this point, it has been explained by Vajrapāṇi through the blessings of the Tathāgata.

original: da ni rtsa ba'i snying po 'byung pa'i phyed du bshad pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i snying po 'byung pa'i phyed du bshad pa'i don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the explanation of the source of the root essence is shown.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting @192b de 'dzin la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ting @192b de 'dzin la zhes pa ni /
translated: It is said, in the samādhi called the vajra of the complete purification of all obscurations.

original: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa rnam par byang pa'i bag chags rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa rnam par byang pa'i bag chags rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Obscurations are the latent tendencies of the purification of afflictions, which are concepts.

original: rnam pa lngar ba stan te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngar ba stan te /
translated: They are explained in five ways:

original: las kyi sgrib pa dang / chos kyi sgrib pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang // skye ba'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa lnga ni thams cad do //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa dang / chos kyi sgrib pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa dang // skye ba'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa lnga ni thams cad do //
translated: the five obscurations of karma, the obscurations of phenomena, the obscurations of ripening, the obscurations of birth, and the obscurations of objects of knowledge are all.

original: rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: Complete purification

original: gnyen po'i ye shes kyis mi mthun pa dag zil gyis gnon pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po'i ye shes kyis mi mthun pa dag zil gyis gnon pa ste /
translated: is the suppression of the discordant factors by the wisdom of the antidote.

original: ci'i phyir rdo rje zhes smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdo rje zhes smos te /
translated: Why is it called vajra?

original: rdo rjes thams cad 'joms pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rdo rjes thams cad 'joms pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like a vajra that destroys everything.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it destroys the signs of afflictions.

original: ting nges 'dzin ni de'i ngang las mi 'da' zhing 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nges 'dzin ni de'i ngang las mi 'da' zhing 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Samādhi is so called because it does not pass beyond that state and holds it.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa ni gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pa dang / mi 'da' bar snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa ni gnyis su med par snyoms par zhugs pa dang / mi 'da' bar snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: Absorption is twofold: absorption in nonduality and absorption in nontransgression.

original: ngan 'gro thams cad ni /
analyzed: ngan 'gro thams cad ni /
translated: All lower realms

original: ngan ni ngan song gsum mo //
analyzed: ngan ni ngan song gsum mo //
translated: are the three lower realms.

original: 'gro ba ni las kyi bag chags kyis der 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni las kyi bag chags kyis der 'gro ba'o //
translated: The realms are so called because one goes there through the latent tendencies of karma.

original: thams cad ni de rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni de rnams la bya'o //
translated: All refers to those.

original: rnam par sbyong pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par sbyong pa ni /
translated: Purification is

original: thugs rjes rdo rje lta bus rgyu spyod pa dang / gtsug tor brgyang kyi snying po phyung bas 'bras bu sbyong pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rjes rdo rje lta bus rgyu spyod pa dang / gtsug tor brgyang kyi snying po phyung bas 'bras bu sbyong pa'o //
translated: purification by the vajra of compassion, which is the cause, and by the essence of the uṣṇīṣa, which is the result.

original: rang gi snying po ni /
analyzed: rang gi snying po ni /
translated: One’s essence

original: rang ni phyag na rdo rje'i snying po ni rig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rang ni phyag na rdo rje'i snying po ni rig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: one’s is Vajrapāṇi’s, and essence is the gnosis of the knowledge consort.

original: 'di nyid thugs ka nas ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid thugs ka nas ni /
translated: This itself is from the heart.

original: 'di nyid ni snying po 'og nas 'byung pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni snying po 'og nas 'byung pa nyid do //
translated: This itself is the essence that will be explained below.

original: thugs ka nas ni ye shes pa'i rgyud la gnas pa zhal du 'byin pa'i don to //
analyzed: thugs ka nas ni ye shes pa'i rgyud la gnas pa zhal du 'byin pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that from his heart he emits the mantra that resides in the continuum of the gnosis being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyung zhes smos pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyung zhes smos pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of emit is stated.

original: sngags ni snying po yin pa'i phyir nam bshad do //
analyzed: sngags ni snying po yin pa'i phyir nam bshad do //
translated: The mantra is explained because it is the essence.

original: de yan chad du sngags kyi don 'byung pa'i dgos ched dang bcas pa'i don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: de yan chad du sngags kyi don 'byung pa'i dgos ched dang bcas pa'i don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
translated: Up to this point, the meaning of the origin of the mantra along with the purpose has been explained.

original: // / da ni dkyil 'khor gyi lhar gong pa'i thabs ston te //
analyzed: // / da ni dkyil 'khor gyi lhar gong pa'i thabs ston te //
translated: Now, the method of worshiping the mandala deities is taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: 'khor lo 'dra pa'i dkyil 'khor la / zhes bya ba ni //
translated: In the mandala that is like a wheel,

analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur pa'i gser gyi 'khor lo ni lte ba dang mu khyud dang rtsibs dang ldan pa ni /

analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir na //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: rtsibs ni @193a * //

analyzed: rtsibs brgyang ni 'khor lo'i rtsibs brgyang do //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / lte bar bcas shing mu khyung bcas //
translated: Why is this?

analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /

analyzed: de la sbus kyi lte ba zlum po ni chos kyi sku'o //
