original: rin po che'i phreng ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rtags so //
translated: The garland of jewels is the sign of the enjoyment body.

original: 'khor lo'i rtsibs ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rtsibs ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The spokes are the emanation body.

original: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis 'khor pa 'joms pas 'khor lo'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis 'khor pa 'joms pas 'khor lo'o ;
translated: The wheel is so called because it conquers cyclic existence with right wisdom.

original: / che ba'i yon tan sna tshogs la mnga' brnyes pas na rin po che'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: / che ba'i yon tan sna tshogs la mnga' brnyes pas na rin po che'i phreng ba'o //
translated: The garland of jewels is so called because it has mastery over various great qualities.

original: thugs rje'i phreng las kyis skye shi rtsad nas bcas pas na rtsibs so //
analyzed: thugs rje'i phreng las kyis skye shi rtsad nas bcas pas na rtsibs so //
translated: The spokes are so called because they cut the root of birth and death with the garland of compassion.

original: ting nge 'dzin mi 'gyur pa'i rtags su ni rdo rjer rab ba stan to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi 'gyur pa'i rtags su ni rdo rjer rab ba stan to //
translated: The vajra is taught as the sign of unchanging meditative concentration.

original: dus rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'gro pa'i don mdzad pa'i rtags su ni gru chad bzhir ba stan to //
analyzed: dus rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas 'gro pa'i don mdzad pa'i rtags su ni gru chad bzhir ba stan to //
translated: The four corners are taught as the sign of acting for the welfare of transmigrating beings in terms of the four times.🔽The three doors of body, speech, and mind are taught as the sign of the unchanging three vajras.

original: sku gsung thugs mi 'gyur pa'i rtags su ni tri r'a ga dang ye shes rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i rtags su ni panytsa re gar ba stan /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs mi 'gyur pa'i rtags su ni tri r'a ga dang ye shes rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'i rtags su ni panytsa re gar ba stan /
translated: The five wisdoms are taught as the sign of the five wisdoms.

original: ting nge 'dzin rtogs pa'i rtags su sgo khyud ldan pas thabs thugs rje /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rtogs pa'i rtags su sgo khyud ldan pas thabs thugs rje /
translated: The door and lintel are taught as the sign of the realization of meditative concentration.

original: 'khor ba las mi nyams pa'i rtags seng ge mgo g-yas su ba stan la /
analyzed: 'khor ba las mi nyams pa'i rtags seng ge mgo g-yas su ba stan la /
translated: The sign of not degenerating from samsara is the lion-head on the right side.

original: sku yang dag pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i rtags su ni glang po che g-yon du ba stan la /
analyzed: sku yang dag pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i rtags su ni glang po che g-yon du ba stan la /
translated: The sign of possessing the power of the perfect body is the elephant on the left side.

original: sgo steng thugs rje thabs kyi rta babs dang ldan pa la byang chub sems kyi mu tig ha ra la gsung rnam par dag pa dril bu dang / phrin las sna tshogs su 'byung pa'i rin po che'i do shal dang / thabs thugs rje'i rdo rje dang /
analyzed: sgo steng thugs rje thabs kyi rta babs dang ldan pa la byang chub sems kyi mu tig ha ra la gsung rnam par dag pa dril bu dang / phrin las sna tshogs su 'byung pa'i rin po che'i do shal dang / thabs thugs rje'i rdo rje dang /
translated: The archways above the gates are endowed with the archways of compassion and method. On the pearl tassels of bodhicitta, there are the pure speech of the bell and the jeweled garland that arises as the various activities, the method of compassion, and the vajra.

original: shes rab ma skyes pa'i zla bar 'brel pa lta bu ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan te ye shes kyi rtags su ba stan to //
analyzed: shes rab ma skyes pa'i zla bar 'brel pa lta bu ni dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan te ye shes kyi rtags su ba stan to //
translated: The wisdom sign of the moon that is not born is the ornament of the maṇḍala.

original: da ni nang du lha bri ba'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: da ni nang du lha bri ba'i khyad par ston te /
translated: Now, the special features of the inner deities are explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lte ba'i nang du sh'akya thub //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: lte ba'i nang du sh'akya thub // ces gsungs te /
translated: Śākyamuni is in the center of the navel.

original: lte ba ni dbus kyi pho brang ngo //
analyzed: lte ba ni dbus kyi pho brang ngo //
translated: The navel is the central palace.

original: sh'akya ni rgyal po sh'akya'i rigs kyi sras yin pa'i phyir na sh'akya'o //
analyzed: sh'akya ni rgyal po sh'akya'i rigs kyi sras yin pa'i phyir na sh'akya'o //
translated: Shakya means of the Shakya clan, because he is the son of the Shakya king.

original: thub ni sku gsungs thugs thub la /
analyzed: thub ni sku gsungs thugs thub la /
translated: Sage means sage of body, speech, and mind,

original: sku mdog ser po thugs rje thabs kyi drang srong dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i bar du bsnams par bri'o //
analyzed: sku mdog ser po thugs rje thabs kyi drang srong dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i bar du bsnams par bri'o //
translated: and sage of compassion and means, and sage of the pure realm of phenomena.

original: da ni mandala gyi don ston te /
analyzed: da ni mandala gyi don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of mandala is taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: phyag rgya rdo rje stobs po che //
analyzed: phyag rgya rdo rje stobs po che //
translated: The great powerful vajra seal,

original: @193b dpa' bo de yi spyan sngar bri //🔽zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: @193b dpa' bo de yi spyan sngar bri // zhes gsungs te //
translated: is drawn in front of that hero.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis me long lta bu'i ye shes las sprul te rdor je lta bu'i ting nges 'dzin gyis stobs dang ldan la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis me long lta bu'i ye shes las sprul te rdor je lta bu'i ting nges 'dzin gyis stobs dang ldan la //
translated: The Blessed One, emanated from mirror-like wisdom, is powerful through the vajra-like samadhi.

original: ye shes kyis chos nyid sems shing thugs rjes 'gro pa'i don la sems pa'i phyir na stobs chen no //
analyzed: ye shes kyis chos nyid sems shing thugs rjes 'gro pa'i don la sems pa'i phyir na stobs chen no //
translated: He is greatly powerful because he contemplates the nature of phenomena with wisdom and the welfare of beings with compassion.

original: dpa' bo ni sh'akya thub pa ste ting nge 'dzin mi 'gyur pa'i do bor grub pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni sh'akya thub pa ste ting nge 'dzin mi 'gyur pa'i do bor grub pa'o //
translated: The hero is Shakyamuni, who has accomplished the unchanging state of samadhi.

original: de'i spyan sngar bri ba ni mdun te shar phyogs kyi rtsibs la thugs kyi rdo rje dang / shes rab kyi dril bu dad ldan par bri ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i spyan sngar bri ba ni mdun te shar phyogs kyi rtsibs la thugs kyi rdo rje dang / shes rab kyi dril bu dad ldan par bri ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In front of him, on the eastern spoke, one should draw the Vajra of Mind and the bell of Wisdom, which are held together.

original: rgyab tu 'khor los sgyur pa bris //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgyab tu 'khor los sgyur pa bris // zhes pa ni /
translated: On the back one should draw the Cakravartin.

original: rgyab ni nub phyogs te /
analyzed: rgyab ni nub phyogs te /
translated: The back is the west.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes las sprul te /🔽dam pa'i chos bdud rtsi'i 'khor lo ni 'gro ba'i rgyud las bskor ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi so sor rtog pa'i ye shes las sprul te / dam pa'i chos bdud rtsi'i 'khor lo ni 'gro ba'i rgyud las bskor ba /
translated: He is emanated from the discriminating wisdom of the Lord.

original: thugs rje'i thabs kyi 'khor lo ni khams gsum gyi nang du sgyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje'i thabs kyi 'khor lo ni khams gsum gyi nang du sgyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He turns the wheel of the nectar of the holy Dharma in the continuums of transmigrators, and he turns the wheel of the method of compassion in the three realms.

original: sku mdog dmar po phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa ste nub kyi phyogs kyi rtsibs la bri'o //🔽g-yas phyogs rgyal ba'i gtsug tor bri /
analyzed: sku mdog dmar po phyag na 'khor lo bsnams pa ste nub kyi phyogs kyi rtsibs la bri'o // g-yas phyogs rgyal ba'i gtsug tor bri /
translated: He is red in color and holds a wheel in his hand. He should be drawn on the western spoke.🔽On the right one should draw the Jina’s uṣṇīṣa.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas ni lho ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas ni lho ste /
translated: The right of the Lord is the south.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi khyad par las nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal pas na rgyal pa'i gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi khyad par las nyon mongs pa'i bdud las rgyal pas na rgyal pa'i gtsug tor ro //
translated: Since the special wisdom of equality conquers the demon of afflictions, it is the crown of the Victorious Ones.

original: thugs rje thabs kyis 'khor ba dbang du sdud cing /
analyzed: thugs rje thabs kyis 'khor ba dbang du sdud cing /
translated: Compassion is the method that subdues samsara.

original: phrin las thabs kyi cho 'phrul rgyal ba'i rtags mnga' bas na sku mdog sngon po phyag na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mi 'gyur ba'i rtags rdo rje bsnams pa lho phyogs kyi rtsibs la bri'o //
analyzed: phrin las thabs kyi cho 'phrul rgyal ba'i rtags mnga' bas na sku mdog sngon po phyag na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mi 'gyur ba'i rtags rdo rje bsnams pa lho phyogs kyi rtsibs la bri'o //
translated: Since the method of activity is the magical display of the sign of victory, the color of the body is blue, and the wisdom of equality is held in the hand as a vajra, the sign of immutability.

original: g-yon rnam par rgyal pa zhes pa ni g-yon ni byang phyogs te /
analyzed: g-yon rnam par rgyal pa zhes pa ni g-yon ni byang phyogs te /
translated: The one on the left is called “the Victorious One.” The left is the north.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes las thugs rje'i sku sprul te nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i phrag dog las rgyal bas na //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes las thugs rje'i sku sprul te nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma'i phrag dog las rgyal bas na //
translated: Since the compassion of the Bhagavat emanates as the body of compassion from the wisdom of activity and conquers the sign of the affliction of envy,

original: thugs rje thabs kyi sprul pas rgyal pa'i rtags su sku mdog ldang gu phyag na ting nges 'dzin gyi dbu rgyan bsnams pa byang gi rtsibs la bri'o //
analyzed: thugs rje thabs kyi sprul pas rgyal pa'i rtags su sku mdog ldang gu phyag na ting nges 'dzin gyi dbu rgyan bsnams pa byang gi rtsibs la bri'o //
translated: the sign of victory is the emanation of compassion as the method, the color of the body is white, and the crown ornament of samadhi is held in the hand.

original: gzi brjid phung po me yi phyogs //
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po me yi phyogs //
translated: The mass of splendor is in the direction of fire.

original: zhes pa thugs chos nyid zhi ba'i ngo bo las thugs rjer sprul te byung pas byang chub kyi sems ye shes kyi gzi brjid spangs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa thugs chos nyid zhi ba'i ngo bo las thugs rjer sprul te byung pas byang chub kyi sems ye shes kyi gzi brjid spangs pa /
translated: Since the compassion emanates from the essence of the peaceful nature of phenomena of the mind, the mind is the mass of the splendor of the pristine consciousness of bodhicitta.

original: rnam par dag pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi gzi brjid kyi phung po brnyes pas skye ba'i sdug bsngal 'joms pas sku mdog dmar ser phyag na ye shes kyi sprin phung bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi gzi brjid kyi phung po brnyes pas skye ba'i sdug bsngal 'joms pas sku mdog dmar ser phyag na ye shes kyi sprin phung bsnams pa'o //
translated: Since the splendor of the pure body, speech, and mind is attained, the suffering of birth is destroyed. Therefore, the color of the body is orange, and the hand holds a mass of clouds of pristine consciousness.

original: @194a * // me lha drang srong ste /
analyzed: @194a * // me lha drang srong ste /
translated: The fire god is a ṛṣi.

original: shar lho'i rtsibs la bri'o //
analyzed: shar lho'i rtsibs la bri'o //
translated: He should be drawn on the petal in the southeast.

original: dbang po'i phyogs su gdugs dkar po //
analyzed: dbang po'i phyogs su gdugs dkar po //
translated: In the direction of Indra, a white parasol.

original: zhes pa ni dbang ldan byang shar mtshams na 'dug pas byang shar phyogs su'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang ldan byang shar mtshams na 'dug pas byang shar phyogs su'o //
translated: Since Indra is located in the northeast, in the northeast.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phrin las drag po'i rang bzhin las sku sprul te gtum po chen po ye shes kyi gtsug tor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phrin las drag po'i rang bzhin las sku sprul te gtum po chen po ye shes kyi gtsug tor dang ldan pa /
translated: The wrathful nature of the Bhagavat’s activity emanates as a body, the great Caṇḍa, endowed with the uṣṇīṣa of pristine consciousness.

original: 'bar ba'i phreng bas thugs rje'i 'od zer 'phro ba /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng bas thugs rje'i 'od zer 'phro ba /
translated: He is surrounded by a garland of flames, radiating the light rays of compassion.

original: byang chub kyi sems thugs rje'i dbu gdugs can /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems thugs rje'i dbu gdugs can /
translated: Bodhicitta is the parasol of compassion.

original: gdugs dkar po sku mdog dkar skyar gnas pa phyag na gtsug tor bsnams pa byang shar gyi rtsibs la bri'o //
analyzed: gdugs dkar po sku mdog dkar skyar gnas pa phyag na gtsug tor bsnams pa byang shar gyi rtsibs la bri'o //
translated: White Parasol is white in color and holds a crown protrusion in his hand. He is drawn on the northeastern spoke.

original: rnam par 'thor ba rlung gi phyogs ;🔽/ zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba rlung gi phyogs ; / zhes pa ni /
translated: Scatterer is in the direction of wind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje dbang gi ngo bo las sku sprul te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje dbang gi ngo bo las sku sprul te /
translated: This means that through the power of the Bhagavat’s compassion, a body emanates.

original: phyin ci log gi mtshan ma stong par byed pa thugs rje sprul pa sdud cing 'thor bar byed pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mtshan ma stong par byed pa thugs rje sprul pa sdud cing 'thor bar byed pa /
translated: The emanation of compassion is the one who makes the signs of error empty and who gathers and scatters.

original: 'gro ba'i don du dbang gi rgya mtshan 'dzugs pas rgas pa'i sdug bsngal spyod ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don du dbang gi rgya mtshan 'dzugs pas rgas pa'i sdug bsngal spyod ste /
translated: He is the one who raises the banner of power for the benefit of migrating beings. He experiences the suffering of aging.

original: rnam par 'thor ba ni sku mdog dmar skya phyag na ral gri ba sna mas pa rlung gi phyogs te nub byang gi rtsibs la bri'o /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba ni sku mdog dmar skya phyag na ral gri ba sna mas pa rlung gi phyogs te nub byang gi rtsibs la bri'o /
translated: Scatterer is pink in color and holds a sword in his hand. He is drawn on the northwestern spoke, the direction of wind.

original: rnam par 'joms pa bden bral phyogs //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'joms pa bden bral phyogs // zhes pa ni /
translated: Destroyer is in the direction of rakshasa.

original: thugs mchog ye shes rgyal pa'i ngo bo las sku sprul te //
analyzed: thugs mchog ye shes rgyal pa'i ngo bo las sku sprul te //
translated: This means that from the essence of the supreme mind of gnosis, a body emanates.

original: thugs rje chen pos sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma 'joms pas ye shes kyis rtog pa'i dra ba bshigs te /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos sdug bsngal gyi mtshan ma 'joms pas ye shes kyis rtog pa'i dra ba bshigs te /
translated: Since the great compassion of Nampar Gyalo destroys the signs of suffering, the wisdom of Nampar Gyalo destroys the net of concepts.

original: rnam par 'joms pa thugs kyi sprul pas na ba'i sdug bsngal 'joms te /
analyzed: rnam par 'joms pa thugs kyi sprul pas na ba'i sdug bsngal 'joms te /
translated: The emanation of Nampar Gyalo’s mind destroys the suffering of sickness.

original: rnam par 'joms pa ni sku mdog sngo skya phyag na be con bsnams pa /
analyzed: rnam par 'joms pa ni sku mdog sngo skya phyag na be con bsnams pa /
translated: Nampar Gyalo is light blue in color and holds a club.

original: rnam par 'joms pa bden bral gyi phyogs te lho nub kyi phyogs rtsibs la bri'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'joms pa bden bral gyi phyogs te lho nub kyi phyogs rtsibs la bri'o //
translated: Nampar Gyalo is in the southwest, the direction of the fire element.

original: grva yi phyogs ni thams cad du //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: grva yi phyogs ni thams cad du // zhes pa ni /
translated: In all the corners

original: spyin pa'i ngo bo sgeg mo sku mdog dkar ba rdo rje bsnams pa /
analyzed: spyin pa'i ngo bo sgeg mo sku mdog dkar ba rdo rje bsnams pa /
translated: The essence of generosity is the white goddess of beauty, holding a vajra.

original: tshul khrims kyi ngo bo phreng ba ma ser mo phreng ba 'dzin pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ngo bo phreng ba ma ser mo phreng ba 'dzin pa /
translated: The essence of discipline is the yellow goddess of garlands, holding a garland.

original: bzod pa'i ngo bo glu mkhan ma dmar mo pi wang bsnams pa //
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngo bo glu mkhan ma dmar mo pi wang bsnams pa //
translated: The essence of patience is the red goddess of song, holding a veena.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo gar ma phyag gnyis gar byed pa gru chad la bri'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo gar ma phyag gnyis gar byed pa gru chad la bri'o //
translated: The essence of diligence is the goddess of dance, dancing with two hands.

original: bris nas phyi rol bri bya ste //
analyzed: bris nas phyi rol bri bya ste //
translated: Having drawn the inner mandala, draw the outer mandala.

original: bdug spos la sogs bri bar bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdug spos la sogs bri bar bya //🔽zhes pa ni /
translated: Draw the goddesses of incense and so on.

original: tshul khrims kyi bdug spos ma dkar mo spos khang bsnams pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bdug spos ma dkar mo spos khang bsnams pa /
translated: White morality incense goddess holds an incense censer.

original: ting nges 'dzin gyi me tog ma ser mo me tog bsnams pa /
analyzed: ting nges 'dzin gyi me tog ma ser mo me tog bsnams pa /
translated: Yellow concentration flower goddess holds a flower.

original: shes rab kyi mar me ma dmar mo mar me bsnams pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mar me ma dmar mo mar me bsnams pa /
translated: Red wisdom lamp goddess holds a lamp.

original: byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i dri chab @194b ma ljang gu dri chab bsnams pa ni gru chad phyi ma la bri'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bde ba'i dri chab @194b ma ljang gu dri chab bsnams pa ni gru chad phyi ma la bri'o //
translated: Green awakening bliss water goddess holds water.🔽The heroes hook, lasso, iron chain, and bell are placed.

original: dpa' bo lcags kyu zhags pa dang // lcags sgrog dril bu snyan rnams gzhag / ces pa ni thugs rje'i lcags kyu ma dmar po dang / phrin las kyi zhags pa ma ser mo dang // thabs kyi lcags sgrog na dmar mo dang // gsung rab sgra'i dril bu ma sgo bzhir bri'o //🔽shar du byams pa sku mdog ser po phyag g-yas na klu shing gi me tog pa snam pa //
analyzed: dpa' bo lcags kyu zhags pa dang // lcags sgrog dril bu snyan rnams gzhag / ces pa ni thugs rje'i lcags kyu ma dmar po dang / phrin las kyi zhags pa ma ser mo dang // thabs kyi lcags sgrog na dmar mo dang // gsung rab sgra'i dril bu ma sgo bzhir bri'o // shar du byams pa sku mdog ser po phyag g-yas na klu shing gi me tog pa snam pa //
translated: Red compassion hook goddess, yellow activity lasso goddess, red method iron chain goddess, and speech sound bell goddess are drawn at the four doors.

original: g-yon pa spyi blugs bsnams pa //
analyzed: g-yon pa spyi blugs bsnams pa //
translated: In the east, yellow Maitreya holds a nāga tree flower in his right hand and a water pot in his left hand.

original: mthong ba don yod sku mdog ser po g-yas pa padma ba snam pa //
analyzed: mthong ba don yod sku mdog ser po g-yas pa padma ba snam pa //
translated: In the south, yellow Amoghasiddhi holds a lotus in his right hand and a sword in his left hand.

original: padma'i steng na mig g-yon pa khu tshur dkur bzhag pa /🔽ngan song spyod ba sku mdog dkar la 'od 'bar ba lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: padma'i steng na mig g-yon pa khu tshur dkur bzhag pa / ngan song spyod ba sku mdog dkar la 'od 'bar ba lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: On a lotus, his left eye is placed on his hip.🔽Durgatipariśodhana is white and radiates light. He holds a hook.

original: mya ngan mun 'joms sku mdog dkar ser g-yas pa be con 'dzin pa g-yon pa dkur bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan mun 'joms sku mdog dkar ser g-yas pa be con 'dzin pa g-yon pa dkur bzhag pa'o //
translated: Śokavinodana is white-yellow. He holds a club in his right hand and places his left hand on his hip.

original: lhor sbos kyi glang po sku mdog dkar ljang g-yas na spos kyi glang po bsnams pa g-yon dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: lhor sbos kyi glang po sku mdog dkar ljang g-yas na spos kyi glang po bsnams pa g-yon dku la brten pa'o //
translated: In the south, Ghasmarī is white-green. She holds a ghasmarī in her right hand and places her left hand on her hip.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba sku mdog dung ltar dkar ba g-yas pa ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba sku mdog dung ltar dkar ba g-yas pa ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: Śūraprajā is as white as a conch. She holds a sword in her right hand

original: g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
translated: and places her left hand on her hip.

original: nam mkha'i mdzod sku mdog dkar ser g-yas padma 'dzin pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mdzod sku mdog dkar ser g-yas padma 'dzin pa /
translated: Ākāśagarbha is white-yellow. He holds a lotus in his right hand

original: g-yon pa dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa dku la brten pa'o //
translated: and places his left hand on his hip.🔽Jñānaketu is blue. He holds a victory banner in his right hand

original: ye shes tog sku mdog sngon po g-yas pa rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes tog sku mdog sngon po g-yas pa rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
translated: and places his left hand on his hip.

original: nub tu zla 'od sku mdog dkar po phyag g-yas na padma'i steng na zla tshes /
analyzed: nub tu zla 'od sku mdog dkar po phyag g-yas na padma'i steng na zla tshes /
translated: In the west, Candro is white. In his right hand, on a lotus, is a moon.

original: g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //🔽bdud rtsi 'od sku mdog dkar po phyag g-yas pa bum pa 'dzin pa g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o // bdud rtsi 'od sku mdog dkar po phyag g-yas pa bum pa 'dzin pa g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
translated: The left hand is in a fist at the hip.🔽Amṛtaprabha is white, holding a vase in the right hand and a fist at the hip with the left hand.

original: bzang skyong dkar dmar g-yas rin pa che 'bar ba 'dzin pa g-yon pa khu tshur dkur brten pa'o //
analyzed: bzang skyong dkar dmar g-yas rin pa che 'bar ba 'dzin pa g-yon pa khu tshur dkur brten pa'o //
translated: Bhadrapāla is white and red, holding a blazing jewel in the right hand and a fist at the hip with the left hand.

original: dra ba can gyi 'od sku mdog dmar ba rdo rje'i dra ba 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dra ba can gyi 'od sku mdog dmar ba rdo rje'i dra ba 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Jālinīprabha is red, holding a vajra net.

original: byang du rdo rje snying po sku mdog sngo skya g-yas na autpala gyi steng na rdo rje dang g-yon pa dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: byang du rdo rje snying po sku mdog sngo skya g-yas na autpala gyi steng na rdo rje dang g-yon pa dku la brten pa'o //
translated: In the north, Vajragarbha is blue-green, holding a vajra on a lotus in the right hand and resting the left hand on the hip.

original: blo gros mi zad pa rdo rje dang phyag gnyis kyis bum pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pa rdo rje dang phyag gnyis kyis bum pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Akṣayamati holds a vajra and a vase with both hands.

original: spobs pa brtsegs pa sku mdog dmar ba /
analyzed: spobs pa brtsegs pa sku mdog dmar ba /
translated: Pratibhānakūṭa is red,

original: g-yas pas padma'i steng na rin chen brtsegs pa bsnams pa phyag g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pas padma'i steng na rin chen brtsegs pa bsnams pa phyag g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //
translated: holding a jewel on a lotus in the right hand and a fist at the hip with the left hand.

original: kun du  bzang po sku mdog ser po g-yas na rin po che'i snye ma bsnams pa g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o //🔽dkyil 'khor bri ba'i @195a * //
analyzed: kun du  bzang po sku mdog ser po g-yas na rin po che'i snye ma bsnams pa g-yon pa khu tshur dku la brten pa'o // dkyil 'khor bri ba'i @195a * //
translated: Samantabhadra is yellow, holding a jewel-cluster in the right hand, and resting the left hand, in the gesture of equanimity, on the hip.

original: thabs bshad zin to /
analyzed: thabs bshad zin to /
translated: The method of drawing the mandala has been explained.

original: // / da ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ston te /
translated: Now, the entry into the mandala is taught:

original: de nas dri zhim la sogs pas //
analyzed: de nas dri zhim la sogs pas //
translated: Then, with sweet scents, etc.,

original: rang gi lus ni bskus nas kyang //
analyzed: rang gi lus ni bskus nas kyang //
translated: anoint one's body,

original: rdo rje 'dzin par zhugs nas ni //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin par zhugs nas ni // zhes gsungs te /
translated: and having entered as the Vajra-holder,

original: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
translated: Then is the immediate context.

original: dri zhim ni gur gum dang / tsandan dang ; spos dang gla rtsi la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dri zhim ni gur gum dang / tsandan dang ; spos dang gla rtsi la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Sweet scents are saffron, sandalwood, incense, musk, and so on.

original: rang gi ni sgrub po'am slob ma gang rung ba la bya'o //🔽lus ba skus pa ni lus la lde gu yang bya //
analyzed: rang gi ni sgrub po'am slob ma gang rung ba la bya'o // lus ba skus pa ni lus la lde gu yang bya //
translated: One's is either the practitioner or the disciple.

original: chu dang spyar te bkru ba yang yin no //🔽rdo rje ni rig pa mo yang yin la /
analyzed: chu dang spyar te bkru ba yang yin no // rdo rje ni rig pa mo yang yin la /
translated: Anointing the body is also applying the paste, and also bathing with water mixed with it.

original: 'dzin pa ni phyag rgya ste bca' ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni phyag rgya ste bca' ba'o //
translated: Vajra is also the knowledge woman, and holder is the seal, the arrangement.

original: zhugs pa ni lha'i dkyil 'khor du spyan drang pa'i phyir phyag rgya bzhi'i sngags kyis spyan drangs nas gzugs brnyan la bzhugs par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni lha'i dkyil 'khor du spyan drang pa'i phyir phyag rgya bzhi'i sngags kyis spyan drangs nas gzugs brnyan la bzhugs par bsgom pa'o //
translated: The entrance is the invocation of the mandala deities in order to cause them to enter, by means of the mantra of the four seals, and to meditate on their abiding in the image.

original: slob dpon rtog pas zhugs pa dang / slob ma dad pas zhugs pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon rtog pas zhugs pa dang / slob ma dad pas zhugs pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: The entrance of the master is the entrance of the master by means of the imagination, and the entrance of the disciple is the entrance of the disciple by means of faith.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs par mos pa bskyed pa ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs par mos pa bskyed pa ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: Then, the generation of devotion to the Tathagata is stated.

original: de nas ni gong 'og gi mtshams sbyor ba //
analyzed: de nas ni gong 'og gi mtshams sbyor ba //
translated: The then is the connection between the previous and following sections.

original: gshegs pa ni de bzhin gshegs par sems kyis mos pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni de bzhin gshegs par sems kyis mos pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The going is the generation of devotion to the Tathagata by the mind.

original: mchod pa byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor nas dbang bskur te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor nas dbang bskur te zhes pa ni /
translated: Having made offerings, the consecration from the crown of the Tathagata is stated.

original: mchod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha mchod pa gzhung bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha mchod pa gzhung bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: The offerings are the offerings to the mandala deities, which are performed according to the scriptures.

original: de bzhin ni gong ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ni gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: The then is as above.

original: bcug ni slob ma dkyil 'khor du bcug ste de nas dbang bskur te //
analyzed: bcug ni slob ma dkyil 'khor du bcug ste de nas dbang bskur te //
translated: The entrance is the entrance of the disciple into the mandala, and then the consecration.

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi rdo rje dang dril bu dang rin po che sna bdun dang yo ga'i dbang rdzas bcus dbang bskur te /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi rdo rje dang dril bu dang rin po che sna bdun dang yo ga'i dbang rdzas bcus dbang bskur te /
translated: The empowerment is conferred with the vajra and bell of method and wisdom, the seven precious substances, and the ten empowerment substances of yoga.

original: yon tan gzhung las smos pa bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gzhung las smos pa bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The qualities are obtained as mentioned in the treatise.

original: da ni shi ba la sgos su phan pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: da ni shi ba la sgos su phan pa'i don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of benefiting the dead in particular is explained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lha dang gnod spyin srin po la sogs pa //🔽zhes pa ni lha'i rgyal po rnam sdang klu dang gnod spyin la sogs pa yang thugs rje'i zhing yin te de'i ming dang rus kyi sgo nas dmigs te /
analyzed: lha dang gnod spyin srin po la sogs pa // zhes pa ni lha'i rgyal po rnam sdang klu dang gnod spyin la sogs pa yang thugs rje'i zhing yin te de'i ming dang rus kyi sgo nas dmigs te /
translated: The gods, yakṣas, rākṣasas, and so on🔽are the field of compassion.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha la spyin sreg gi las byas shing /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha la spyin sreg gi las byas shing /
translated: The rite of fire sacrifice is performed for the deities of the maṇḍala by means of the name and clan of the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and so on.

original: mkhyen par gsol na yang 'grub la /
analyzed: mkhyen par gsol na yang 'grub la /
translated: If one requests their knowledge, it is accomplished.

original: gal te sems can par ma do'i srid pa de len pas de'i dbang du yang gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te sems can par ma do'i srid pa de len pas de'i dbang du yang gsungs te /
translated: If the being in the intermediate state is to take an intermediate existence, it is also said to be under the power of that.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngan 'gro'i rgyud dbang du gyur pa rnams kyi zhes gsungs te ngan pa ni bag chags so //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i rgyud dbang du gyur pa rnams kyi zhes gsungs te ngan pa ni bag chags so //
translated: It is said that those who are under the power of the continuum of the lower realms are bad.

original: 'gro ba ni der 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni der 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going is going there.

original: @195b rgyud ni sems can gyi rgyud do //
analyzed: @195b rgyud ni sems can gyi rgyud do //
translated: A continuum is a sentient being’s continuum.

original: dbang du gyur pa ni las kyi ngo bos der skyes nas dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa ni las kyi ngo bos der skyes nas dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: Having come under the power of karma is having come under the power of karma by being born there.

original: de la phan pa'i thabs ba stan pa'i phyir shi ba'i ro'am gzugs brnyan nam ming zhes smos te //
analyzed: de la phan pa'i thabs ba stan pa'i phyir shi ba'i ro'am gzugs brnyan nam ming zhes smos te //
translated: In order to teach the means of benefiting those, he says “a corpse, a reflection, or a name.”

original: shi ba ni srog dang bral ba'o //🔽ro ni dngos po yod pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: shi ba ni srog dang bral ba'o // ro ni dngos po yod pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: A corpse is one that is devoid of life.

original: gzugs brnyan ni med na yang ri mo mkhan gyi ras sam dar la tshon gyis bris pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni med na yang ri mo mkhan gyi ras sam dar la tshon gyis bris pa'o //
translated: A reflection is one that is drawn with colors on cloth or silk, even though it does not exist.🔽A name is one that is written with saffron on birch bark or paper.

original: ming ni gro ga'm shog shog la gur gum gyis bris pa'o / de yang dngos po la zhen pas ni ro smos la //
analyzed: ming ni gro ga'm shog shog la gur gum gyis bris pa'o / de yang dngos po la zhen pas ni ro smos la //
translated: Moreover, a corpse is mentioned for those who are attached to things;

original: gdags pa'i gzhi dgos pa'i sgo nas ming smos la /
analyzed: gdags pa'i gzhi dgos pa'i sgo nas ming smos la /
translated: a name is mentioned for those who are attached to the basis of imputation;

original: tshon par byed pa'i sgo nas ni gzugs brnyan smos te /
analyzed: tshon par byed pa'i sgo nas ni gzugs brnyan smos te /
translated: and a reflection is mentioned for those who are attached to form.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi bzlas pa dang / sngags kyis brjod pa dang / spyin sreg tshul bzhin du ni byas te snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur nas ngan song las thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi bzlas pa dang / sngags kyis brjod pa dang / spyin sreg tshul bzhin du ni byas te snga ma bzhin du dbang bskur nas ngan song las thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having performed the recitation of samādhi, the recitation of mantra, and the fire sacrifice in the proper way, as before, one should confer empowerment, and one will be liberated from the lower realms.

original: gtsug tor brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gtsug tor brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the summary of the maṇḍala of the uṣṇīṣa is complete.

original: // / da ni phyag rgya'i le'u ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni phyag rgya'i le'u ston te /
translated: Now, the chapter on the mudrā is taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes gsungs te //
translated: Then the bhagavān Vajrapāṇi is stated.

original: rgyud kyi ston pa gong du bshad zin pa yin pas phyag rgya la 'jug pa'i go rims smos mo //
analyzed: rgyud kyi ston pa gong du bshad zin pa yin pas phyag rgya la 'jug pa'i go rims smos mo //
translated: Since the teacher of the tantra was explained above, the order of engaging in the mudrā is mentioned.

original: seng ge'i lta bas zhes pa ni bag tsha zhing 'jigs pa dang bral pa'i phyir dang 'khor thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can thams cad gzengs bstod pa'i phyir ba stan to //
analyzed: seng ge'i lta bas zhes pa ni bag tsha zhing 'jigs pa dang bral pa'i phyir dang 'khor thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can thams cad gzengs bstod pa'i phyir ba stan to //
translated: The lion’s gaze is explained because one is free from embarrassment and fear, because all retinues are overwhelmed, and because all those of the Mahāyāna family are encouraged.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag rgya dam pa'i zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag rgya dam pa'i zhes pa ni /
translated: The bhagavān of the sublime mudrā is stated.

original: 'khor gar bzhugs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor gar bzhugs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavat is so called because he is the one who has gone to the circle of retinue.

original: phyag rgya ni rnam pa gsum ste mi 'da' ba'i phyir phyag rgya ni chos nyid rtogs pas mi 'da'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya ni rnam pa gsum ste mi 'da' ba'i phyir phyag rgya ni chos nyid rtogs pas mi 'da'o //
translated: The mudra is threefold: because it is not transgressed, the mudra is not transgressed by the realization of reality.

original: mtshon pa'i phyag rgya ni kha dog rnam pa lnga'am phyag rgyas mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon pa'i phyag rgya ni kha dog rnam pa lnga'am phyag rgyas mtshon pa'o //
translated: The indicating mudra is the five-colored or mudra-marked.

original: 'cha' ba'i phyag rgya ni lag pa'i sor mo byin gyis brlabs te 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: 'cha' ba'i phyag rgya ni lag pa'i sor mo byin gyis brlabs te 'cha' ba'o //
translated: The formed mudra is formed by blessing the fingers of the hand.

original: dam pa mnyes pa'i phyir dang gnyis su med pa'i phyir dam pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa mnyes pa'i phyir dang gnyis su med pa'i phyir dam pa'o //
translated: It is supreme because it pleases the supreme and because it is nondual.

original: phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid mdor ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i mtshan nyid mdor ba stan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief explanation of the characteristics of the mudra.

original: da ni sku gzungs bri ba'i cho ga ston te //
analyzed: da ni sku gzungs bri ba'i cho ga ston te //
translated: Now, the ritual of drawing the image is taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why?

original: sku gzugs kyi cho ga 'dir yang de bzhin du bya ste zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi cho ga 'dir yang de bzhin du bya ste zhes gsungs te //
translated: Here, too, the ritual of the image should be done in the same way.

original: sku gzugs ni gtsug tor brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la sku gzugs la bris te //
analyzed: sku gzugs ni gtsug tor brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor rnams la sku gzugs la bris te //
translated: The image is the image drawn in the mandala of the ushnisha.

original: bdag nyid kyang de'i zhabs drung du bris la //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang de'i zhabs drung du bris la //
translated: And oneself is drawn at its feet.

original: bsnyen pa gong du gsungs pa ltar byas nas yi @196a * //
analyzed: bsnyen pa gong du gsungs pa ltar byas nas yi @196a * //
translated: Having done the approach as taught above,🔽

original: dam du bcas na ngan song las thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam du bcas na ngan song las thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one performs the service as previously taught and makes a vow, one will be liberated from the evil destinies.

original: sku gzugs kyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to /🔽// / da ni tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: sku gzugs kyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to / // / da ni tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: The meaning of the image is finished.

original: dbang du 'gyur zhes pa'i bar gyis ni nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od sngon las ci byas ba zhus pa'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas /
analyzed: dbang du 'gyur zhes pa'i bar gyis ni nor bu dri ma med pa'i 'od sngon las ci byas ba zhus pa'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas /
translated: Now, from “Brahma and so forth” up to “will be brought under control” is the question of what to do with the previously taught stainless light jewel.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus las 'das so zhes pa'i bar gyis ni las kyi rnam par smin pa ngan par smin pa'i rgyu rkyen ston /🔽lan cig ci zhig gi rkyen gyis zhes pa nas /🔽bde mang kun gyi gnas su skye //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus las 'das so zhes pa'i bar gyis ni las kyi rnam par smin pa ngan par smin pa'i rgyu rkyen ston / lan cig ci zhig gi rkyen gyis zhes pa nas / bde mang kun gyi gnas su skye //
translated: Then, from “thereupon the Bhagavat” up to “will be born in the future” teaches the cause and condition of the ripening of evil karma.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni las kyi rnam par smin pa ma nges pa'i don ston to ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni las kyi rnam par smin pa ma nges pa'i don ston to ;
translated: From “What is the condition of the one time?” up to “will be born in the abode of all happiness” teaches the meaning of the ripening of karma that is not definite.

original: /'bras bu ngan song du skye rgyu las rkyen drang srong dang phrad nas lhar skyes pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: /'bras bu ngan song du skye rgyu las rkyen drang srong dang phrad nas lhar skyes pa'i don ston te /
translated: The cause of the result of being born in the evil destinies is karma, and the condition is meeting with a sage, and the meaning of being born as a god is taught.

original: lha'i dbang po nyon cig ces pa nas lha'i 'khor 'di dag yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sngon las mthun pa'i 'brel ba ston te /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po nyon cig ces pa nas lha'i 'khor 'di dag yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sngon las mthun pa'i 'brel ba ston te /
translated: The passage from Listen, Lord of the Gods! up to these are the retinues of the gods shows the connection with the previous deeds.

original: sngon gyi gleng gzhi'i rgyu ni mdo sde la smos te yan chad du thal lo //
analyzed: sngon gyi gleng gzhi'i rgyu ni mdo sde la smos te yan chad du thal lo //
translated: The cause of the previous nidāna is mentioned in the sūtra up to this point.

original: da ni tshe dpag med kyis las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa'i mandala gyi don ston te /
analyzed: da ni tshe dpag med kyis las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa'i mandala gyi don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the maṇḍala for severing karmic obscurations by Amitāyus is taught.

original: de la tshe ni ye shes so //
analyzed: de la tshe ni ye shes so //
translated: There, life is wisdom.

original: dpag med ni dngos po thams cad dang bral pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpag med ni dngos po thams cad dang bral pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Amitā means free from all things.

original: las ni dge sdig rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: las ni dge sdig rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Karma is the two types, virtuous and non-virtuous.

original: sgrib pa ni nam mkha' dngas pa la sprin gyis g-yogs pa dang 'dra bar kun gzhi la rtog pa glo bur bas bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni nam mkha' dngas pa la sprin gyis g-yogs pa dang 'dra bar kun gzhi la rtog pa glo bur bas bsgribs pa'o //
translated: Obscurations are like the sky being covered by clouds, obscured in the all-base by adventitious thoughts.

original: rgyun gcod ni gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyi stobs kyis mi mthun pa rgyun gcod pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun gcod ni gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyi stobs kyis mi mthun pa rgyun gcod pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Severing the continuum means by the power of the wisdom of the noble path, the antidote, it is the meaning of severing the continuum of the discordant factors.

original: dkyil 'khor ni dpag med de chos nyid do //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni dpag med de chos nyid do //
translated: The maṇḍala is Amitā, the dharmatā.

original: 'khor ni che ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ni che ste zhes pa ni /
translated: The retinue is great means

original: sems ni rangs te gsol pa 'de bas pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems ni rangs te gsol pa 'de bas pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: the mind is pleased and makes this request.

original: ye shes bzhi'i 'khor ro //
analyzed: ye shes bzhi'i 'khor ro //
translated: The retinue is the four exalted wisdoms.

original: de bshad pa'i phyir zhu ba gsol ba ston te /
analyzed: de bshad pa'i phyir zhu ba gsol ba ston te /
translated: In order to explain that, it shows the request.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas brgya byin dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang zhes smos so //
translated: Then, Indra and so forth.

original: brgya byin ni yon bdag yin pa'i phyir dang gnas kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir dang por smos so //🔽rab tu mgu zhing yi rangs te //
analyzed: brgya byin ni yon bdag yin pa'i phyir dang gnas kyi bdag po yin pa'i phyir dang por smos so // rab tu mgu zhing yi rangs te //
translated: Indra is mentioned first because he is the patron and the lord of the place.🔽Very pleased and delighted means

original: zhes pa ni sems ni rangs te gsol pa 'de bas pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems ni rangs te gsol pa 'de bas pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: the mind is pleased and makes this request.

original: ba spu'i bu ga nas spu rnams langs pa ni 'khor ba la skrag cing 'bras bu bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas la dga' bas na sna la smos so //🔽rgyal ba rgyal pa ni ye shes kyi chos nyid rtogs pas mtshan ma las rgyal ba /
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga nas spu rnams langs pa ni 'khor ba la skrag cing 'bras bu bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas la dga' bas na sna la smos so // rgyal ba rgyal pa ni ye shes kyi chos nyid rtogs pas mtshan ma las rgyal ba /
translated: The hairs on the pores of the body standing on end is mentioned because of fear of samsara and delight in the unsurpassed fruition of buddhahood.

original: thugs rjes 'gro @196b ba'i don mdzad pas 'khor ba la spyod pa rgyal lo //
analyzed: thugs rjes 'gro @196b ba'i don mdzad pas 'khor ba la spyod pa rgyal lo //
translated: The Victorious Victor is mentioned because of conquering the signs of the phenomena of exalted wisdom and conquering the conduct in samsara through acting for the welfare of transmigrating beings with compassion.

original: phyag na rdo rje la ming bcus mngon par bstod de zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la ming bcus mngon par bstod de zhes pa ni /
translated: He praised Vajrapāṇi with ten names, saying,

original: phyag na rdo rje gnod spyin kun du  bzang po yin pa'i phyir ni /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje gnod spyin kun du  bzang po yin pa'i phyir ni /
translated: Since Vajrapāṇi is the yakṣa Samantabhadra,

original: gnod spyin skad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod do //
analyzed: gnod spyin skad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod do //
translated: he praised him with the language of the yakṣas in terms of his qualities, such as the ten perfections.

original: de ni tshe dpag med kyi mandala bshad pa'i gsol ba gdab pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni tshe dpag med kyi mandala bshad pa'i gsol ba gdab pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of the supplication explained in the maṇḍala of Amitāyus.

original: ko ta ksha ni khyed kyi thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnga' brnyes pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ko ta ksha ni khyed kyi thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnga' brnyes pa'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Koṭaka means you have attained mastery over the perfection of method.

original: ko ta pa ni khyod kyi shes rab kyis spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid 'byed pa'i don to //🔽ko ta ko ta ni khyod kyi brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang ldan pas 'khor bar mi gtong ba'i rtags so //
analyzed: ko ta pa ni khyod kyi shes rab kyis spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid 'byed pa'i don to // ko ta ko ta ni khyod kyi brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang ldan pas 'khor bar mi gtong ba'i rtags so //
translated: Koṭapa means you distinguish the general and specific characteristics with wisdom.🔽Koṭakoṭa means you are endowed with the power of diligence, a sign of not abandoning saṃsāra.

original: ko la pa la ni khyod kyi bzod pas ni mi 'khrugs shing sran tshugs pa'i don to //
analyzed: ko la pa la ni khyod kyi bzod pas ni mi 'khrugs shing sran tshugs pa'i don to //
translated: Kolapala means you are unshakable and steadfast with patience.

original: ka ti ra ka ni khyod kyi tshul khrims yang dag pa mi nyams pa'i don to //
analyzed: ka ti ra ka ni khyod kyi tshul khrims yang dag pa mi nyams pa'i don to //
translated: Katirāka means your morality is not impaired.

original: ko la ksha ni khyod kyi stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzhan gyis mi gnon pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: ko la ksha ni khyod kyi stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzhan gyis mi gnon pa'i rtags so //
translated: Ko la kṣa means your perfection of strength is a sign of being unassailable by others.

original: ko la pa ni khyod kyi spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: ko la pa ni khyod kyi spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rtags so //
translated: Ko la pa means your perfection of generosity is endowed with the sign of complete giving.

original: ko la ko la ni khyod kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye nas shes pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: ko la ko la ni khyod kyi ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye nas shes pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i rtags so //
translated: Ko la ko la means your perfection of wisdom is a sign of primordially having the nature of wisdom.

original: bhanydza ni khyod kyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skyo dub med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bhanydza ni khyod kyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni skyo dub med pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Bhajña means your perfection of diligence is characterized by being without weariness.

original: ko la pa ti ni khyod kyi smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthun pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: ko la pa ti ni khyod kyi smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthun pa'i ye shes la dmigs pa'i don to //
translated: Ko la pa ti means your perfection of aspiration is the meaning of the focus of concordant wisdom.

original: ko la ta tha ainti ni khyod ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don mthong ba'i chos nyid bsam du med pa la gtan 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ko la ta tha ainti ni khyod ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don mthong ba'i chos nyid bsam du med pa la gtan 'cha' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: You are Kola, because you are firmly established in the inconceivable reality of the perfection of meditation, which is the vision of the truth of the meaning of the perfection of meditation.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: By the perfection of means, he is Vajradhara.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni mgon po rgyal mtshan gyi dpung rgyan can no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni mgon po rgyal mtshan gyi dpung rgyan can no //
translated: By the perfection of wisdom, he is the Lord with the armlet of the banner.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni glang po'i rna ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni glang po'i rna ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: By the perfection of effort, he has the elephant's ear.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni rnam par gnon pa'i ngo bo brnyes se ;
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni rnam par gnon pa'i ngo bo brnyes se ;
translated: By the perfection of patience, he has attained the essence of subduing.

original: / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni yon tan rin chen 'byung ldan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni yon tan rin chen 'byung ldan du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the perfection of morality, he becomes the source of precious qualities.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bden pa'i don ston pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni bden pa'i don ston pa thob pa'o //
translated: By the perfection of power, he attains the teaching of the meaning of truth.

original: spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni gzugs mdzes pa thob bo //
analyzed: spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni gzugs mdzes pa thob bo //
translated: By the perfection of generosity, he attains a beautiful form.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni yid kyis brgyan pa @197a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni yid kyis brgyan pa @197a * //
translated: By the perfection of wisdom, one accomplishes the mental adornment.

original: 'grub po // smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni me 'bar ba can 'grub po //
analyzed: 'grub po // smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni me 'bar ba can 'grub po //
translated: By the perfection of aspiration, one accomplishes the blazing fire.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni gzugs mdzes pa yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni gzugs mdzes pa yin zhes pa'o //
translated: By the perfection of meditation, one accomplishes the beautiful form.

original: gsang ba'i bdag pos bshad du gsol //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag pos bshad du gsol //
translated: The Lord of Secrets said, “Please explain.”

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: This is the supplication.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas bshad du gsol zhes pa'i bar gyis ni bka' ngang ba ba stan to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas bshad du gsol zhes pa'i bar gyis ni bka' ngang ba ba stan to //
translated: Then, from “Thereupon the Blessed One” up to “Please explain,” the permission is given.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi yig 'bru'i don te /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi yig 'bru'i don te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the maṇḍala syllables.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi

original: ngang nas tshe dpag med kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i phyir na smos so //
analyzed: ngang nas tshe dpag med kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i phyir na smos so //
translated: is mentioned because he entered the samādhi of Amitāyus.

original: thams cad kyi tshe dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni thams cad ni dngos por snang ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe dpag tu med pa zhes pa ni thams cad ni dngos por snang ba'o //
translated: “All are immeasurable life” means all appearing things

original: tshe ni ye shes kyi dngos po med par rtogs pas na dpag med do //
analyzed: tshe ni ye shes kyi dngos po med par rtogs pas na dpag med do //
translated: are realized as the non-entity of wisdom, thus immeasurable.

original: khyad par du 'byung ba'i rdo rje zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par du 'byung ba'i rdo rje zhes pa ni /
translated: The special vajra is

original: dbyings khyab pa'i rang bzhin las ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir na rdo rje zhes smos so //
analyzed: dbyings khyab pa'i rang bzhin las ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir na rdo rje zhes smos so //
translated: called a vajra because the pristine consciousness arises from the nature of the pervading dhātu.

original: phyi ma ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The latter is easy to understand, so it is not mentioned.🔽The mind enters into the letter of the Dharma.

original: thugs chos kyi yi ge nyid du zhugs par gyur pa ni thugs ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: thugs chos kyi yi ge nyid du zhugs par gyur pa ni thugs ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin la /
translated: The mind is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: chos ni mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyi tshul du phrin las mdzad pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos ni mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyi tshul du phrin las mdzad pa'i don to //
translated: The Dharma is the meaning of the deeds performed in the manner of the twelve deeds.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dpag tu med pa rdo rje'i 'od byed pa ni /
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med pa rdo rje'i 'od byed pa ni /
translated: The light of the vajra of immeasurable life

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dngos po dang bral bas ni dpag tu med la ;
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dngos po dang bral bas ni dpag tu med la ;
translated: is immeasurable because the actual pristine consciousness is free from entities.

original: rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pas ni thugs rje'i 'od byed /
analyzed: rdo rje ltar 'dus ma byas pas ni thugs rje'i 'od byed /
translated: The light of compassion is like a vajra because it is uncompounded.

original: gdon mi za ba'i sgrib pa rnam par 'joms pa ni zhes pa la gdon mi za ni phrin las gdon mi za la /
analyzed: gdon mi za ba'i sgrib pa rnam par 'joms pa ni zhes pa la gdon mi za ni phrin las gdon mi za la /
translated: The meaning of “destroying the doubt of obscuration” is as follows: Doubt is undoubtable activity.

original: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Obscuration is affliction.

original: 'joms pa ni mtshan ma thams cad 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms pa ni mtshan ma thams cad 'joms pa'o //
translated: Destroying is destroying all signs.

original: dri ma med cing rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje ni /
analyzed: dri ma med cing rnam par dag pa'i rdo rje ni /
translated: The stainless, pure vajra is

original: dri ma ni gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags so //
analyzed: dri ma ni gzung 'dzin gyi bag chags so //
translated: the stainlessness is the habit-energy of subject and object.

original: med pa ni dag pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni dag pa'o //
translated: The non-existence is the purity.

original: rdo rje ni chos nyid du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni chos nyid du bsgom pa'o //
translated: The vajra is the cultivation of reality.

original: gdon mi za bar mi choms  pa //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar mi choms  pa //
translated: It is the invincible,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is

original: thugs rje dang phrin las gzhan gyis mi choms  pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje dang phrin las gzhan gyis mi choms  pa'o //
translated: the compassion and activity that are invincible by others.

original: de rnams ni rigs lnga'i snying po ste ci rigs par spyar /
analyzed: de rnams ni rigs lnga'i snying po ste ci rigs par spyar /
translated: These are the essences of the five families, and they are to be applied as appropriate.

original: sngags kyi yig 'bru'i don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: sngags kyi yig 'bru'i don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
translated: The meaning of the mantra syllables has been explained in summary.

original: // / da ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs ston te /
translated: Now the method of drawing the maṇḍala is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: grub zhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //🔽sgo ba rnams dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: grub zhi pa la sgo bzhi pa // sgo ba rnams dang ldan pa ste //
translated: The four-sided one is for pacifying,🔽endowed with four doors,

original: rta babs bzhi dang ldan par bya //
analyzed: rta babs bzhi dang ldan par bya //
translated: and having four arched gateways.

original: lte ba dang ni mu khyud ldan //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lte ba dang ni mu khyud ldan // zhes gsungs te /
translated: It has a center and a circumference.

original: grub bzhi ni phrin las @197b rnam pa bzhis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rtags yin pas grub zhir ldan no //
analyzed: grub bzhi ni phrin las @197b rnam pa bzhis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i rtags yin pas grub zhir ldan no //
translated: The four sides are the sign of benefiting migrating beings through the four types of enlightened activity, and therefore it is endowed with four sides.

original: sgo bzhi ni tshad med pa'i phrin las rnam pa bzhis 'gro ba la dbyung ba'i sgo dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis theg pa chen po la 'dzud cing 'god pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: sgo bzhi ni tshad med pa'i phrin las rnam pa bzhis 'gro ba la dbyung ba'i sgo dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis theg pa chen po la 'dzud cing 'god pa'i rtags so //
translated: The four doors are the doors of going out to beings through the four kinds of immeasurable deeds, and the signs of leading beings into the Great Vehicle and establishing them in it through the four means of gathering disciples.

original: sgo ba ni de'i phyag rgya ste ye shes kyi 'od dang ldan par bri'o //
analyzed: sgo ba ni de'i phyag rgya ste ye shes kyi 'od dang ldan par bri'o //
translated: The door guardians are the seals of those [four doors], and they should be drawn with the light of pristine awareness.

original: rta babs bzhi ni sgo bzhi bang rim gyi them pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rta babs bzhi ni sgo bzhi bang rim gyi them pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four pediments are the four steps of the four doors,

original: snying rje la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi'i rtags so //
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa tshad med pa bzhi'i rtags so //
translated: and they are the signs of the four immeasurables such as compassion.

original: lte ba ni dbus kyi pho brang zlum po ste chos nyid kyi rtags so //
analyzed: lte ba ni dbus kyi pho brang zlum po ste chos nyid kyi rtags so //
translated: The center is the round central palace, and it is the sign of reality.

original: de'i dbus su 'khor lo ni //
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'khor lo ni //
translated: In the center of that, a wheel

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: is drawn.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor la bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor la bya'o //
translated: That refers to the mandala.

original: dbus ni dkyil 'khor gyi sum gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: dbus ni dkyil 'khor gyi sum gnyis la bya'o //
translated: The center is the inner two-thirds of the mandala.

original: 'khor lo ni rtsibs bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni rtsibs bzhi ba'o //
translated: The wheel has four spokes.

original: dkyil 'khor dam pa bri bar bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dam pa bri bar bya //
translated: The excellent mandala should be drawn.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: That refers to

original: dkyil ni dbus kyi pho brang ste gtso bo'i sa bcad do //
analyzed: dkyil ni dbus kyi pho brang ste gtso bo'i sa bcad do //
translated: the center, which is the central palace, the section of the principal deity.

original: rtsibs bzhi pa dang ldan pa la //
analyzed: rtsibs bzhi pa dang ldan pa la //
translated: Endowed with four spokes,

original: zhes pa ni rtsibs bzhi pa ni 'khor lo'i lce bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtsibs bzhi pa ni 'khor lo'i lce bzhi'o //
translated: The four spokes are the four tongues of the wheel.

original: de ni ye shes rnam pa bzhi'i phrin las so //🔽lte ba dkyil 'khor ldan par bya //
analyzed: de ni ye shes rnam pa bzhi'i phrin las so // lte ba dkyil 'khor ldan par bya //
translated: This is the activity of the four kinds of exalted wisdom.🔽One should make the center have a mandala.

original: zhes pa ni lte ba ni dbus kyi pho brang zlum po la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni lte ba ni dbus kyi pho brang zlum po la /
translated: The center is the round palace in the middle.

original: dkyil ni de'i sa bcad do //
analyzed: dkyil ni de'i sa bcad do //
translated: The mandala is its division.

original: 'khor lo ni rtsibs su ba stan to //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni rtsibs su ba stan to //
translated: The wheel is taught to be the spokes.

original: ldan par bya ba ni lha bri ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldan par bya ba ni lha bri ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One should make” means one should draw the deities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: de yid bus su gtso bo ni //
analyzed: de yid bus su gtso bo ni //
translated: The principal one is in the center of that.

original: zhes gsungs te de ni 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te de ni 'khor lo'o //
translated: That is the wheel.

original: dbus ni lte ba'o //
analyzed: dbus ni lte ba'o //
translated: The center is the navel.

original: gtso bo ni phyag na rdo rje sku mdog ljang skya zhal zla ba rgyas pa ltar 'dzum pa phyag g-yas na rdo rje /
analyzed: gtso bo ni phyag na rdo rje sku mdog ljang skya zhal zla ba rgyas pa ltar 'dzum pa phyag g-yas na rdo rje /
translated: The principal one is green Vajrapāṇi, his face smiling like a full moon, holding a vajra in his right hand,

original: g-yon pa na dril bu bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa na dril bu bsnams pa /
translated: and a bell in his left hand.

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa bri'o //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa bri'o //
translated: He is drawn adorned with various ornaments.

original: shar gyi rtsibs kyi steng du ni mgon po mi bskyod pa bri bar bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: shar gyi rtsibs kyi steng du ni mgon po mi bskyod pa bri bar bya zhes pa ni /
translated: On top of the eastern spoke, one should draw Lord Akṣobhya.

original: shar ni shar kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: shar ni shar kyi phyogs so //
translated: The east is the eastern direction.

original: rtsibs ni 'khor lo'i lce'o //
analyzed: rtsibs ni 'khor lo'i lce'o //
translated: The spokes are the spokes of the wheel.

original: mgon po ni khams gsum gyi mgon mdzad cing mtshan mas mi bskyod pas sku mdog dkar po sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni khams gsum gyi mgon mdzad cing mtshan mas mi bskyod pas sku mdog dkar po sa gnon gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //
translated: The protector is the one who protects the three realms, and since he is unshakable by signs, he is white in color and has the earth-touching mudra.

original: lho'i rtsibs la rin chen 'byung ldan mchog spyin gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //🔽nub kyi rtsibs la snang ba mtha' yas sku mdog dmar po ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //
analyzed: lho'i rtsibs la rin chen 'byung ldan mchog spyin gyi phyag rgya can bri'o // nub kyi rtsibs la snang ba mtha' yas sku mdog dmar po ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //
translated: On the southern spoke, Ratnasaṃbhava is drawn with the mudra of supreme generosity.🔽On the western spoke, Amitābha is drawn red in color with the mudra of meditative equipoise.

original: byang gi rtsibs la gdon mi za bar grub pa sku mdog ljang gu skyabs spyin gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //
analyzed: byang gi rtsibs la gdon mi za bar grub pa sku mdog ljang gu skyabs spyin gyi phyag rgya can bri'o //
translated: On the northern spoke, Amoghasiddhi is drawn green in color with the mudra of granting refuge.

original: phyi ma ni gtsug tor brgyang dang cha mthun no //
analyzed: phyi ma ni gtsug tor brgyang dang cha mthun no //
translated: The latter is similar to the expanded uṣṇīṣa.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha lugs su bri /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i cha lugs su bri /
translated: They are drawn in the attire of a cakravartin.

original: mandala du bdag nyid zhugs shing lha spyan drang ba ni /
analyzed: mandala du bdag nyid zhugs shing lha spyan drang ba ni /
translated: Inviting the deities into the maṇḍala in which one has entered is as follows:

original: de nas rnam grol can nyid dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas rnam grol can nyid dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, with “One who is liberated,”

original: @198a * // sa ma ya h'um zhes pa'i bar gyis ba stan //
analyzed: @198a * // sa ma ya h'um zhes pa'i bar gyis ba stan //
translated: up to “samaya hūṃ,” the seat is offered.

original: rdo rje ti ri zhes pa nas badzra h'um zhes pa'i bar gyis ni rig pa'i me tog de mandala du 'jug pa ba stan /
analyzed: rdo rje ti ri zhes pa nas badzra h'um zhes pa'i bar gyis ni rig pa'i me tog de mandala du 'jug pa ba stan /
translated: The passage from “vajra” to “hum” indicates the insertion of the flower of awareness into the mandala.

original: de nas zhes ba nas h'um zhes ba'i bar gyis ni dam tshig bsgrag pa ba stan /
analyzed: de nas zhes ba nas h'um zhes ba'i bar gyis ni dam tshig bsgrag pa ba stan /
