analyzed: bar gyi tshigs gnyis kyis ni dkyil 'khor ba stan pa'o //
translated: The two middle lines indicate the mandala.

original: de nas 'di zhes ba nas aa bhi shinytsa h'um zhes pa'i bar gyis ni dbang bskur ba ba stan /
analyzed: de nas 'di zhes ba nas aa bhi shinytsa h'um zhes pa'i bar gyis ni dbang bskur ba ba stan /
translated: The passage from “then” to “abhisinca hum” indicates the conferral of empowerment.

original: de nas zhes pa nas aa: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni tshe bsring ba'i thabs ba stan /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa nas aa: zhes pa'i bar gyis ni tshe bsring ba'i thabs ba stan /
translated: The passage from “then” to “ah” indicates the method of prolonging life.

original: de'i sgrub pa zhes pa nas bzlas brjod ces pa'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa zhes pa nas bzlas brjod ces pa'i bar gyis ni /
translated: The passage from “its practice” to “recitation” indicates

original: bsgrub pa'i lha bri ba ba stan /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i lha bri ba ba stan /
translated: the painting of the deity of practice.

original: da ni sgrub pa po ston te de nas zla ba nya'i tshe mchod pa chen po byas la ba dmar ser gyi mar snod sar par bcug la zhes pa ni sgrub pa byed pa'i dus ni zla ba nya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa po ston te de nas zla ba nya'i tshe mchod pa chen po byas la ba dmar ser gyi mar snod sar par bcug la zhes pa ni sgrub pa byed pa'i dus ni zla ba nya ba ste /
translated: Now the practitioner is indicated: “Then, on the full moon, having performed a great offering, place the vessel of reddish-yellow butter in a new vessel.” The time for practice is the full moon.

original: tshogs gnyis rdzogs pa'i phyir dang // ting nge 'dzin rgyas pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis rdzogs pa'i phyir dang // ting nge 'dzin rgyas pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten pa dang mthun pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: for the sake of expanding meditative concentration, and for the sake of being in accord with the world.

original: phyi nang gi mchod pas mnyes par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa la mchod pa phul la /
analyzed: phyi nang gi mchod pas mnyes par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa la mchod pa phul la /
translated: Having made offerings to the noble ones in order to please them with outer and inner offerings,

original: bdag gis snod gtsang ma'i nang du ba dmar ser gyi mar dang / til mar dang / gur gum la sogs pa bsres shing bcug la /
analyzed: bdag gis snod gtsang ma'i nang du ba dmar ser gyi mar dang / til mar dang / gur gum la sogs pa bsres shing bcug la /
translated: in a clean vessel one should place red and yellow butter, sesame oil, saffron, and so forth.

original: bdag nyid las kyi lha phyag na rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs la /
analyzed: bdag nyid las kyi lha phyag na rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs la /
translated: Having entered into the meditative concentration of one's deity, Vajrapāṇi,

original: lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya bcas la snod la gtad la g-yas pa thal mo khong stong du spyar te /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya bcas la snod la gtad la g-yas pa thal mo khong stong du spyar te /
translated: one should make the mudra of the three-pointed vajra with the left hand and point to the vessel, while with the right hand one should open the hollow space of the palm.

original: bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med rab tu bsam zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag med rab tu bsam zhing /
translated: Visualizing the Bhagavān Amitāyus,

original: sku'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i rten bcas nas bsnyen pa dang bzlas brjod tshul bzhin byas nas /
analyzed: sku'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa'i rten bcas nas bsnyen pa dang bzlas brjod tshul bzhin byas nas /
translated: having established the support of the visualized form of the deity, one should perform the approach and recitation properly.

original: dngos grub mtshan ma ma byung na yang /
analyzed: dngos grub mtshan ma ma byung na yang /
translated: Even if the signs of siddhi do not occur,

original: de la mar sar pa'am /
analyzed: de la mar sar pa'am /
translated: In that, one should confess with oneself, reciting over ghee,

original: til mar ram 'o ma chang ngam khrag gam zhag gam glang ba'am sha'am gang yang rung ba la bzlas shing bdag nyid kyis bshags pa bya zhing /
analyzed: til mar ram 'o ma chang ngam khrag gam zhag gam glang ba'am sha'am gang yang rung ba la bzlas shing bdag nyid kyis bshags pa bya zhing /
translated: sesame oil, milk, beer, blood, fat, marrow, meat, or whatever is suitable.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus gur gum gyi chu la bkrus la bsnyen pa yun ring du byas na 'grub par the tshom med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus gur gum gyi chu la bkrus la bsnyen pa yun ring du byas na 'grub par the tshom med do //
translated: If one bathes one's body with saffron water and performs the familiarization for a long time, there is no doubt of success.

original: tshe dpag med las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa'i phyag na rdo rje'i 'di dkyil 'khor bshad zin to /
analyzed: tshe dpag med las kyi sgrib pa rgyun gcod pa'i phyag na rdo rje'i 'di dkyil 'khor bshad zin to /
translated: This is the mandala of Vajrapāṇi who severs the continuum of karmic obscurations from Amitāyus.

original: // / da ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: // / da ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Now, the mandala of the Four Great Kings is taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhis //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhis //
translated: Then the four great kings

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: is stated.

original: de nas ni tshe dpag med kyi dkyil 'khor rting thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir na de nas zhes @198b bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ni tshe dpag med kyi dkyil 'khor rting thogs su 'byung ba'i phyir na de nas zhes @198b bya'o //
translated: Then is because it occurs immediately after the mandala of Amitāyus.

original: rgyal po ni rgya la po chen po bzhi lha'i rgyal pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal po ni rgya la po chen po bzhi lha'i rgyal pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A king is a great king because he is a king of the gods.

original: chen po ni sku bzhi dang dpal brgyang bka' srung rigs kyis 'dul ba'i phyir phrin las mdzad pa'i phyir na chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po ni sku bzhi dang dpal brgyang bka' srung rigs kyis 'dul ba'i phyir phrin las mdzad pa'i phyir na chen po'o //
translated: The great one is great because of the four bodies and the great deeds of the glorious protectors, the four great kings, and so forth, who are the guardians of the teachings.

original: bzhi ni yul 'khor srung dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / rnam thos sras la sogs pa bzhis bka' stsal du gsol bya ba'i bar gyis rang gi snying po 'gro ba la phan pa'i don du mdongs gsol du dbul bar gsol ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi ni yul 'khor srung dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / rnam thos sras la sogs pa bzhis bka' stsal du gsol bya ba'i bar gyis rang gi snying po 'gro ba la phan pa'i don du mdongs gsol du dbul bar gsol ba'o //
translated: The four are Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Virūḍhaka, Virūpākṣa, and Vaiśravaṇa, who are the four who request the teaching with “Please teach!” and so forth, and they offer their hearts to the Tathāgata for the benefit of migrating beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' ngang ba dang rgyal pos snying po phul ba ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bka' ngang ba dang rgyal pos snying po phul ba ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The Tathāgata’s teaching and the kings’ offering of their hearts are good, but they are not mentioned.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i don ba stan te /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor bri ba'i don ba stan te /
translated: Now the meaning of drawing the maṇḍala is taught.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes gsungs te /
translated: Then, the maṇḍala of those is explained.

original: de nas ni snying po phul ba'i rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni snying po phul ba'i rting thogs so //
translated: Then means immediately after the offering of the hearts.

original: dkyil ni phyag na rdo rje dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil ni phyag na rdo rje dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The maṇḍala is Vajrapāṇi dwelling in the center.

original: 'khor ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'o //
translated: The retinue is the four great kings.

original: bshad pa ni don bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni don bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the explanation of the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽grub zhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / grub zhi pa la sgo bzhi pa //
translated: Why is this?🔽The mandala is square with four doors,

original: dkyil 'khor ldas ni brgyan pa ste //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ldas ni brgyan pa ste // zhes gsungs te /
translated: and is adorned with five.

original: gru bzhi ni rgyal po chen po bzhi yod pas gru bzhir bya'o //
analyzed: gru bzhi ni rgyal po chen po bzhi yod pas gru bzhir bya'o //
translated: The mandala is square because the four great kings are present.

original: sgo bzhi ni rgyal po bzhis phyogs bzhi nas rigs kyis 'dul ba dang dam bca' ba'i phrin las mdzad pas na sgo bzhi'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi ni rgyal po bzhis phyogs bzhi nas rigs kyis 'dul ba dang dam bca' ba'i phrin las mdzad pas na sgo bzhi'o //
translated: It has four doors because the four kings perform the activities of subduing and binding with their clans in the four directions.

original: dkyil 'khor ni phyag na rdo rje dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni phyag na rdo rje dbus na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The mandala is Vajrapani in the center.

original: ldas brgyan zhes ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang lnga yod pa'i phyir na ldas brgyan te zhes smos so //
analyzed: ldas brgyan zhes ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang lnga yod pa'i phyir na ldas brgyan te zhes smos so //
translated: It is adorned with five because there are four great kings and the fifth is Vajrapani.

original: de yang mandala gyi sum gnyis la tham ga bzhi btab pa'i re'u mig dgu la /
analyzed: de yang mandala gyi sum gnyis la tham ga bzhi btab pa'i re'u mig dgu la /
translated: Furthermore, in the mandala, which is two-thirds the size of the maṇḍala, there are nine squares with four seals.

original: dbus su phyag na rdo rje 'gying bag tu bri /
analyzed: dbus su phyag na rdo rje 'gying bag tu bri /
translated: In the center, Vajrapani is drawn with a swaying posture.

original: re'u mig gi mtshams su rgyal po chen po bzhi'i btsun mo bri'o //
analyzed: re'u mig gi mtshams su rgyal po chen po bzhi'i btsun mo bri'o //
translated: In the corners of the squares, the queens of the four great kings are drawn.

original: yul 'khor srung gi btsun mo rdo rje mda' byed ma dang / 'phags skyes po'i btsun mo dpe med ma dang // mig mi bzang gi btsun mo 'dul mkhas ma dang / rnam thos sras kyi btsun mo phreng 'dzin dang / re'u mig gi bar yang rin po che'i phreng bas bcad do //
analyzed: yul 'khor srung gi btsun mo rdo rje mda' byed ma dang / 'phags skyes po'i btsun mo dpe med ma dang // mig mi bzang gi btsun mo 'dul mkhas ma dang / rnam thos sras kyi btsun mo phreng 'dzin dang / re'u mig gi bar yang rin po che'i phreng bas bcad do //
translated: The queen of Dhṛtarāṣṭra is Vajreṣu, the queen of Virūḍhaka is Anupamā, the queen of Virūpākṣa is Vinayavatī, the queen of Vaiśravaṇa is Sragdharā, and the squares are also divided by a precious garland.

original: phyi rol yang zlum pos bskor /
analyzed: phyi rol yang zlum pos bskor /
translated: Outside, it is surrounded by a circle.

original: gru chad bzhi la dus bzhi bri'o //
analyzed: gru chad bzhi la dus bzhi bri'o //
translated: In the four corners, draw the four times.

original: de'i phyi rol du mchod snam bcad /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du mchod snam bcad /
translated: Outside of that, make an offering platform.

original: sgo bzhi yang phyogs su bri'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi yang phyogs su bri'o //
translated: Also, draw the four doors in the directions.🔽Then, with the mudra of Vajradhara, the disciple is admitted.

original: de nas rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcas la slob ma gzhug / rig pa'i me tog dor /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcas la slob ma gzhug / rig pa'i me tog dor /
translated: The flower of awareness is cast.

original: gang la bab pa'i rgyal pos dbang bskur /
analyzed: gang la bab pa'i rgyal pos dbang bskur /
translated: The empowerment is conferred by the king on whom it falls.

original: da ni dbang bskur ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur ba ston te /
translated: Now, the empowerment is taught.

original: de nas grva na gzhag ba @199a * //
analyzed: de nas grva na gzhag ba @199a * //
translated: Then, in the corners,

original: yi ; / bum pa bzhis ni dbang bskur te //
analyzed: yi ; / bum pa bzhis ni dbang bskur te //
translated: the four vases confer empowerment.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nas ni zhes pa ni mandala bri ba'i rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni zhes pa ni mandala bri ba'i rting thogs so //
translated: Then is immediately after drawing the maṇḍala.

original: mtshams zhes bya ba ni re'u mig gi mtshams su gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams zhes bya ba ni re'u mig gi mtshams su gzhag pa'o //
translated: The interval is the interval between the squares.

original: bum pa bzhi rgyal po bzhi'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: bum pa bzhi rgyal po bzhi'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: The four vases should be endowed with the mantra and seal of the four kings.

original: de nas bdag nyid phyag na rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs la /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid phyag na rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs la /
translated: Then, one should enter into the meditative concentration of Vajrapāṇi.

original: dang po phyag na rdo rje'i dbang bskur /
analyzed: dang po phyag na rdo rje'i dbang bskur /
translated: First, one should confer the empowerment of Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi'i bum pa phyogs phyogs na yod bas rim pas dbang bskur la byin gyis brlabs na yon tan gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi'i bum pa phyogs phyogs na yod bas rim pas dbang bskur la byin gyis brlabs na yon tan gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, since the vases of the four great kings are in the four directions, one should confer the empowerment in sequence, and if one blesses them, one will obtain the good qualities as they appear in the treatise.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to /
translated: The concise explanation of the meaning of the maṇḍala of the four great kings is complete.

original: // / da ni phyogs skyod bcu'i dkyil 'khor bshad de /
analyzed: // / da ni phyogs skyod bcu'i dkyil 'khor bshad de /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala of the ten direction protectors will be explained.

original: de nas phyogs skyong ba rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas phyogs skyong ba rnams kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the direction protectors means

original: de nas ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i rting thogs so //
translated: then is after the four great kings.

original: phyogs ni phyogs bzhi mtshams bzhi dang brgyang steng 'og dang bcu'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni phyogs bzhi mtshams bzhi dang brgyang steng 'og dang bcu'o //
translated: The directions are the four cardinal directions, the four intermediate directions, above, and below, making ten.

original: skyong ba ni de rnams kyis 'jig rten skyong ba'o ;
analyzed: skyong ba ni de rnams kyis 'jig rten skyong ba'o ;
translated: Protecting means that they protect the world.

original: / de rnams kyis ni 'khor rnams kyis rang gi snying po 'bul bar zhus pa dang / ngang ba dang snying po phul ba'o //
analyzed: / de rnams kyis ni 'khor rnams kyis rang gi snying po 'bul bar zhus pa dang / ngang ba dang snying po phul ba'o //
translated: They refers to the retinue offering their own essence, and the offering of the goose and essence.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor bri ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor bri ba ston te /
translated: Now, the drawing of the maṇḍala is taught.

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, their maṇḍala is explained means

original: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
translated: then, in sequence, after the previous maṇḍala.

original: de dag ni phyogs skyong pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phyogs skyong pa'o //
translated: They are the directional guardians.

original: dkyil ni dbus su mgon po phyag na rdo rje bri'o //
analyzed: dkyil ni dbus su mgon po phyag na rdo rje bri'o //
translated: The center is the middle, where Lord Vajrapāṇi is drawn.

original: 'khor ni phyogs skyong bcu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni phyogs skyong bcu'o //
translated: The retinue is the ten directional guardians.

original: bshad pa ni don bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni don bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the explanation of the meaning.

original: dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin bris la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor snga ma bzhin bris la zhes pa ni /
translated: Having drawn the maṇḍala as before,

original: snga ma ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang 'dra bar bri ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang 'dra bar bri ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: before means that it is drawn like the four great kings.

original: phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyang kyi re'u mig las dbus kyi re'u mig la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhib sku mdog ljang gu phyag g-yas pa rdo rje thugs kar 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyang kyi re'u mig las dbus kyi re'u mig la bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhib sku mdog ljang gu phyag g-yas pa rdo rje thugs kar 'dzin pa /
translated: In the center square of the four-direction, eight-sector grid, draw Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi, green, holding a vajra at his heart with his right hand,

original: g-yon dril bu dku la brten pa bri'o //
analyzed: g-yon dril bu dku la brten pa bri'o //
translated: and a bell resting on his hip with his left hand.

original: de'i mdun du nyi ma dmar po shing rta la zhon pa nyi ma 'dzin pa /
analyzed: de'i mdun du nyi ma dmar po shing rta la zhon pa nyi ma 'dzin pa /
translated: In front of him, draw red Sun, holding the sun, riding a chariot.

original: zla ba dkar po ngang pa la zhon pa zla ba 'dzin pa /
analyzed: zla ba dkar po ngang pa la zhon pa zla ba 'dzin pa /
translated: Draw white Moon, holding the moon, riding a swan.

original: rgyab tu sa bdag phag mgo can pi wang 'dzin pa /
analyzed: rgyab tu sa bdag phag mgo can pi wang 'dzin pa /
translated: In the back, draw the earth lord, with a pig’s head and holding a lute.

original: shar du brgya byin ser po glang po che la zhon pa rdo rje 'dzin pa /🔽lhor gshin rje sngon po ma he la zhon pa dbyug to 'dzin pa /
analyzed: shar du brgya byin ser po glang po che la zhon pa rdo rje 'dzin pa / lhor gshin rje sngon po ma he la zhon pa dbyug to 'dzin pa /
translated: In the east, draw yellow Indra, riding an elephant and holding a vajra.🔽In the south, draw blue Death, riding a water buffalo and holding a club.

original: nub tu chu lha dkar po chu srin la zhon ba sprul zhags 'dzin pa /
analyzed: nub tu chu lha dkar po chu srin la zhon ba sprul zhags 'dzin pa /
translated: In the west, draw white Water God, riding a crocodile and holding a snake lasso.

original: byang du gnod spyin ser po rta la zhon pa rin po che 'dzin pa /
analyzed: byang du gnod spyin ser po rta la zhon pa rin po che 'dzin pa /
translated: In the north, draw yellow Yakṣa, riding a horse and holding a jewel.

original: byang shar du dbang ldan dkar po glang la zhon pa rtse @199b gsum 'dzin pa /
analyzed: byang shar du dbang ldan dkar po glang la zhon pa rtse @199b gsum 'dzin pa /
translated: In the northeast, white Indra rides a white elephant and holds a spear.

original: shar lhor me lha dmar po ra la zhon pa dbyug to 'dzin pa /
analyzed: shar lhor me lha dmar po ra la zhon pa dbyug to 'dzin pa /
translated: In the southeast, red Agni rides a ram and holds a club.

original: lho nub tu srin po nag po mi la zhon par ral gri 'dzin pa /
analyzed: lho nub tu srin po nag po mi la zhon par ral gri 'dzin pa /
translated: In the southwest, black Rakshasa rides a human and holds a sword.

original: nub byang du rlung lha ljang gu sha ba la zhon pa bdag 'dzin pa /
analyzed: nub byang du rlung lha ljang gu sha ba la zhon pa bdag 'dzin pa /
translated: In the northwest, green Vayu rides a deer and holds a flag.

original: sgo ba rnams kyang de bzhin du phyi ma ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang mthun no //
analyzed: sgo ba rnams kyang de bzhin du phyi ma ni rgyal po chen po bzhi dang mthun no //
translated: The gatekeepers are similar to the latter, the four great kings.

original: de nas spyan drang pa dang ; bdag nyid zhugs pa dang / slob ma gzhug pa dang / phyogs skyong ba bcu'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang / de'i yon tan dang / yon tan gyi che ba bsrung zhing 'phel bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: de nas spyan drang pa dang ; bdag nyid zhugs pa dang / slob ma gzhug pa dang / phyogs skyong ba bcu'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pa rnams kyis dbang bskur ba dang / de'i yon tan dang / yon tan gyi che ba bsrung zhing 'phel bar bya ba dang /
translated: Then, the invocation, one's own entry, the disciples' entry, the empowerment conferred by the vases empowered by the mantras of the ten direction protectors, the qualities of that, the protection and increase of the qualities,

original: so so rang rang gi phyogs srung ba'i phyir dam bcas ba ni bde ste bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: so so rang rang gi phyogs srung ba'i phyir dam bcas ba ni bde ste bshad mi dgos so //
translated: and the individual pledges to guard one's own direction are easy to understand and do not need to be explained.

original: phyogs skyong ba bcu'i mandala 'dis ni gdon stong phrag brgyang cu rtsa bzhi zlog par bgyid pas phyogs skyong bcu'i dkyil 'khor gsungs te de ni 'jig rten pa'i gtso bo yin pas na 'jig rten pa la phan pa'i don du bshad do //
analyzed: phyogs skyong ba bcu'i mandala 'dis ni gdon stong phrag brgyang cu rtsa bzhi zlog par bgyid pas phyogs skyong bcu'i dkyil 'khor gsungs te de ni 'jig rten pa'i gtso bo yin pas na 'jig rten pa la phan pa'i don du bshad do //
translated: This maṇḍala of the ten direction protectors is taught for the sake of warding off the four hundred and four types of demons. Since they are the chief ones in the world, it is explained for the sake of benefiting the world.

original: phyogs skyong bcu'i dkyil 'khor gyi don mdor bsdus pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyogs skyong bcu'i dkyil 'khor gyi don mdor bsdus pa bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the maṇḍala of the ten direction protectors has been explained in brief.

original: da ni gza' chen po brgyang kyi mandala bshad de /
analyzed: da ni gza' chen po brgyang kyi mandala bshad de /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala of the twelve great planets will be explained.

original: de ni sems can la gza' chen po brgyang gshed dang skar ma'i rlung rnams zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni sems can la gza' chen po brgyang gshed dang skar ma'i rlung rnams zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs te /
translated: That is taught for the sake of pacifying the great planets, the twelve rāhu, and the stars and winds for sentient beings.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas gza' chen po brgyang dang / 'khor rgyu skar dang bcas pa rnams kyis zhes gsungs te /🔽de ni skabs kyi rting thogs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas gza' chen po brgyang dang / 'khor rgyu skar dang bcas pa rnams kyis zhes gsungs te / de ni skabs kyi rting thogs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: Then, the twelve great planets and their retinues, the stars,🔽occur in sequence.

original: nas ni 'og gi mgo 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: nas ni 'og gi mgo 'dren pa'o //
translated: Then is the beginning of the next section.

original: gza' ni dper na 'jig rten pa dag sgra la gza' zhugs na mi rung par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gza' ni dper na 'jig rten pa dag sgra la gza' zhugs na mi rung par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: The planets are like the worldly saying, “It is not suitable for a planet to enter a sound.”

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i gza' chen po brgyang ni 'jig rten na rgyu ba'i ma rungs pa ste bar snang la gnas shing gnod pa'i gdug rtsub byed pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i gza' chen po brgyang ni 'jig rten na rgyu ba'i ma rungs pa ste bar snang la gnas shing gnod pa'i gdug rtsub byed pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: Thus, the ten great worldly planets are mentioned because they are the wicked ones who move in the world, who abide in the sky, and who create harm and malice.

original: de'i 'khor ni rgyu skar te nam mkha' la rgyu zhing zla ba'i mngag gzhug dang / las kun byed pas na rgyu skar ro //
analyzed: de'i 'khor ni rgyu skar te nam mkha' la rgyu zhing zla ba'i mngag gzhug dang / las kun byed pas na rgyu skar ro //
translated: Their retinue is the lunar mansions, which move in the sky, and are the servants of the moon, and do all the work, and so are the lunar mansions.

original: de rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor yin pas 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa zhi par bya ba'i phyir smos so ;
analyzed: de rnams ni bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor yin pas 'jig rten pa'i gnod pa zhi par bya ba'i phyir smos so ;
translated: Since they are the retinue of the Bhagavat, they are mentioned in order to pacify the harm of the world.

original: /'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They said this:

original: 'og gi don 'di kho na bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba gsol ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: 'og gi don 'di kho na bcom ldan 'das la zhu ba gsol ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: This is mentioned in order to request the Bhagavat to explain the meaning below.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom zhing pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas mtha' gnyis kyi skyon dang bral pas phyag na @200a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom zhing pha rol tu phyin pa'i legs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas mtha' gnyis kyi skyon dang bral pas phyag na @200a * //
translated: The Blessed One means that he has conquered the demon of afflictions and possesses the excellent qualities of the perfections, so he is free from the faults of the two extremes, and thus he is Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje'o // bdag cag 'khor dang bcas pa zhes pa ni bdag gi gza' chen po brgyang la pa sangs gtsor smos pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'o // bdag cag 'khor dang bcas pa zhes pa ni bdag gi gza' chen po brgyang la pa sangs gtsor smos pa'o //
translated: As for we and our retinue, the chief of the eight great planets is mentioned first.

original: gcig ni phur bu la sogs pa phyi ma bdun gyi tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig ni phur bu la sogs pa phyi ma bdun gyi tha tshig go //
translated: One refers to Mercury and so on, the last seven.

original: 'khor ni gza' re re dang rgyu skar rnams dus su rgyu bas na rgyu skar gyi 'khor du gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ni gza' re re dang rgyu skar rnams dus su rgyu bas na rgyu skar gyi 'khor du gsungs so //
translated: The retinue is said to be the lunar mansions because each planet moves in conjunction with the lunar mansions.

original: rang rang gi gsang sngags kyi zhes pa ni rang rang gza' dang rgyu skar nyid la bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rang gi gsang sngags kyi zhes pa ni rang rang gza' dang rgyu skar nyid la bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As for our own secret mantra, it means each of the planets and lunar mansions themselves.

original: gsang sngags ni rang rtags kyi snying po sems la gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsang sngags ni rang rtags kyi snying po sems la gnas pa'i don to //
translated: Secret mantra means the essence of one's own sign, which abides in the mind.

original: byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu gsol zhes pa ni /
translated: Please grant your blessings means:

original: dper na ras dkar po dmar por byin gyis brlab pa ni btsod la yod pa dang 'dra bar de bzhin du gza' dang rgyu skar gyi snying po byin gyis brlab pa ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la mnga' bas so //
analyzed: dper na ras dkar po dmar por byin gyis brlab pa ni btsod la yod pa dang 'dra bar de bzhin du gza' dang rgyu skar gyi snying po byin gyis brlab pa ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje la mnga' bas so //
translated: For example, just as the consecration of a white cloth as red is like the existence of vermilion, in the same way, the consecration of the essence of the planets and stars is possessed by the Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi.

original: byin gyis brlab pa bshad zin to //🔽da ni snying po bshad ba ston te legs so dpa' zhes pa ni legs so ni gza' tshig la bcom ldan 'das mgu ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa bshad zin to // da ni snying po bshad ba ston te legs so dpa' zhes pa ni legs so ni gza' tshig la bcom ldan 'das mgu ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The explanation of consecration is finished.

original: dpa' ni phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis ngang ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpa' ni phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis ngang ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Now, the teaching on the explanation of the essence is shown: “Excellent, hero” means “excellent” is the word of the planets, and “bhagavān” is the word of Vajrapāṇi himself.🔽“ Excellent” is the word of delighting the Bhagavān.

original: phyi ma ni bde ste bshad mi dgos so //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bde ste bshad mi dgos so //
translated: The latter is easy and does not need to be explained.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi don ston te /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor gyi don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the maṇḍala is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, their maṇḍala is explained.

original: de ni gong ma'i mjug sdud pa la /
analyzed: de ni gong ma'i mjug sdud pa la /
translated: “ Then” is the conclusion of the above.

original: nas ni 'og gi dkyil 'khor gyi mgo 'dren pa la'o //
analyzed: nas ni 'og gi dkyil 'khor gyi mgo 'dren pa la'o //
translated: “ Now” is the introduction to the maṇḍala below.

original: de dag ni gza' dang rgyu skar de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni gza' dang rgyu skar de dag go //
translated: Those are the planets and stars.

original: dkyil ni phyag na rdo rje dkyil na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil ni phyag na rdo rje dkyil na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The “center” is where Vajrapāṇi resides.

original: 'khor ni gza' dang rgyu skar du bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni gza' dang rgyu skar du bcas pa'o //
translated: The “retinue” is the planets and stars.

original: bshad pa ni tshig dang don gsal bar bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad pa ni tshig dang don gsal bar bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Explanation” means the clarification of the words and meanings.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i gzugs su bri zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i gzugs su bri zhes pa ni /
translated: “Draw in the form of the conqueror of the three worlds” means🔽that since all phenomena are naturally pure, they are not annihilated, and

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam bar dag pa yin pa'i phyir ni 'jig / chad pa ma yin pas ni rten la /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam bar dag pa yin pa'i phyir ni 'jig / chad pa ma yin pas ni rten la /
translated: since they are not permanent, they are not subsumed.

original: gsum ni 'dod khams dang gzugs khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams gsum la bya'o //
analyzed: gsum ni 'dod khams dang gzugs khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams gsum la bya'o //
translated: The “three” are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.🔽“Conquering” is the aspect of signs.

original: rnam par rgyal ba ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa ste de rnams las thugs rje'i phrin las kyi rgyal ba'i rtags te /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba ni mtshan ma'i rnam pa ste de rnams las thugs rje'i phrin las kyi rgyal ba'i rtags te /
translated: The sign of the victorious activity of compassion is Vajrapāṇi.

original: de ni phyag na rdo rje ste gza'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su khro bor ston te /
analyzed: de ni phyag na rdo rje ste gza'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su khro bor ston te /
translated: In the context of the maṇḍala of the planets, he is shown as wrathful.

original: h'um ka ra'i gzugs su bri ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: h'um ka ra'i gzugs su bri ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he is drawn in the form of Hūṃkāra.

original: ngos rnams su phyag rgya chen po bzhi bri zhes pa ni //
analyzed: ngos rnams su phyag rgya chen po bzhi bri zhes pa ni //
translated: “Draw the four great mudras on the sides” means

original: ngos ni dkyil 'khor kha gsum du bcad ba de'i dbus thig bzhi btab pa'i re'u mig dgu pa rin po che'i phreng bas zlum por bskor @200b ba'i phyi rol gyi gru chad bzhi la bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngos ni dkyil 'khor kha gsum du bcad ba de'i dbus thig bzhi btab pa'i re'u mig dgu pa rin po che'i phreng bas zlum por bskor @200b ba'i phyi rol gyi gru chad bzhi la bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: I am the central one of the three circles, in the middle of which are four lines forming a nine-part grid, surrounded by a circle of jewels. The four corners outside of that are the four activities.

original: phyag rgya bzhi ni dus bzhi'i lha mo bzhi phyag rgya bdug spos me tog mar me dri chab dang bzhi bri'o //🔽rnam pa gcig tu rdo rje rin po che /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi ni dus bzhi'i lha mo bzhi phyag rgya bdug spos me tog mar me dri chab dang bzhi bri'o // rnam pa gcig tu rdo rje rin po che /
translated: The four seals are the four goddesses of the four times. Draw the four seals of incense, flowers, lamp, and perfume.

original: padma rgya gram zhes smos so //
analyzed: padma rgya gram zhes smos so //
translated: In another way, they are the vajra, jewel, lotus, and sword.

original: de yi mdun du pa ba sangs //
analyzed: de yi mdun du pa ba sangs //
translated: In front of that, draw Papa.

original: zhes pa ni de ni h'um ka ra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ni h'um ka ra'o //
translated: That is Humkara.

original: mdun du ni shar phyogs kyi re'u mig go //
analyzed: mdun du ni shar phyogs kyi re'u mig go //
translated: In front is the square in the east.

original: pa ba sangs mdog dkar po lag na me tog ku mu ta dang shing tog bsnams pa /
analyzed: pa ba sangs mdog dkar po lag na me tog ku mu ta dang shing tog bsnams pa /
translated: Papa is white in color and holds a night lily flower and a fruit.

original: rgyab tu zla ba bri bar bya //
analyzed: rgyab tu zla ba bri bar bya //
translated: In back, draw the moon.

original: zhes pa ni rgyab ni nub phyogs te gza' zla ba phyag na ku mu ta thogs pa dang ngang pa la zhon pa bri /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyab ni nub phyogs te gza' zla ba phyag na ku mu ta thogs pa dang ngang pa la zhon pa bri /
translated: In back is the west. Draw the moon planet holding a night lily flower and riding on a goose.

original: g-yas ni lho phyogs te phur bu sku mdog sngon po phyag na bu sti bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas ni lho phyogs te phur bu sku mdog sngon po phyag na bu sti bsnams pa'o //
translated: The right is the south, where one should draw the blue planet Shukra holding a water-pot.

original: g-yon du gza' lhag bri bar bya //
analyzed: g-yon du gza' lhag bri bar bya //
translated: One should draw the planet Rahu on the left.

original: zhes pa ni g-yon ni byang phyogs te gza' lhag padma la 'dug pa /
analyzed: zhes pa ni g-yon ni byang phyogs te gza' lhag padma la 'dug pa /
translated: The left is the north, where one should draw the planet Rahu seated on a lotus,

original: phyag g-yas mchod spyin byed pa /🔽g-yon autpala bsnams pa bri /
analyzed: phyag g-yas mchod spyin byed pa / g-yon autpala bsnams pa bri /
translated: with the right hand in the mudra of giving,🔽and the left holding an utpala.

original: me yi phyogs su mig dmar dang // zhes pa ni shar lho'i mtshams te /
analyzed: me yi phyogs su mig dmar dang // zhes pa ni shar lho'i mtshams te /
translated: In the southeast corner, one should draw Mars,

original: mig dmar mdog dmar po phyag g-yas pa na bdud rtsi'i bum pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: mig dmar mdog dmar po phyag g-yas pa na bdud rtsi'i bum pa bsnams pa /
translated: red in color, holding in the right hand a vase of nectar,

original: g-yon pa na me sgron bsnams pa'o //🔽rlung gi phyogs su nyi ma ste //🔽zhes pa ni rlung ni nub byang gi mtshams te gza' nyi ma rta la zhon ba phyag g-yas pa na padma kha bye ba bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa na me sgron bsnams pa'o // rlung gi phyogs su nyi ma ste // zhes pa ni rlung ni nub byang gi mtshams te gza' nyi ma rta la zhon ba phyag g-yas pa na padma kha bye ba bsnams pa /
translated: and in the left a torch.🔽In the northwest corner, one should draw the sun,

original: g-yon ba na mtha' ber bsnams pa bri /
analyzed: g-yon ba na mtha' ber bsnams pa bri /
translated: mounted on a horse, holding in the right hand an open lotus,

original: dbang ldan phyogs su sben pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan phyogs su sben pa'o //
translated: and in the left a sword.

original: zhes pa ni dbang ldan ni byang shar gyi phyogs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang ldan ni byang shar gyi phyogs te /
translated: In the northeast corner, one should draw Saturn,

original: spen pa lag pa g-yas na dbyug pa thogs pa /🔽g-yon pa dgra sta thogs pa /
analyzed: spen pa lag pa g-yas na dbyug pa thogs pa / g-yon pa dgra sta thogs pa /
translated: and an axe in his left hand,

original: stan nang tshangs can la 'dug pa bri /🔽srin po'i phyogs su sgra gcan bri //
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can la 'dug pa bri / srin po'i phyogs su sgra gcan bri //
translated: sitting on a seat with a cushion.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: Rahu is drawn in the direction of the rakshasas.

original: srin po ni lho nub kyi phyogs su sgra gcan mdog dud kha mi'i mgo can ro smad sprul du 'dug ba ;🔽phyag g-yas pa na padma sdong bu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: srin po ni lho nub kyi phyogs su sgra gcan mdog dud kha mi'i mgo can ro smad sprul du 'dug ba ; phyag g-yas pa na padma sdong bu dang bcas pa /
translated: Rahu is drawn in the southwest direction, with a smoky-colored human head and a lower body in the form of a snake.🔽He holds a lotus stalk in his right hand

original: g-yon pa na ral gri bsnams pa bri /
analyzed: g-yon pa na ral gri bsnams pa bri /
translated: and a sword in his left hand.

original: da ni 'khor rgyu skar smos te /
analyzed: da ni 'khor rgyu skar smos te /
translated: Now, the moving stars are mentioned:

original: dkyil 'khor phyi rol khor yug tu //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor phyi rol khor yug tu //
translated: On the outer circle of the mandala,

original: zhes pa ni phyi rol gru chad phyi snam la rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyang rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor nas 'byung ba bzhin du bri ba ni phyogs rer bdun bdun no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi rol gru chad phyi snam la rgyu skar nyi shu rtsa brgyang rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor nas 'byung ba bzhin du bri ba ni phyogs rer bdun bdun no //
translated: on the outer square, the twenty-eight constellations are drawn as they appear in the root mandala, seven in each direction.

original: smin drug dmar po bum pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: smin drug dmar po bum pa la gnas pa /
translated: [Ardra] is red and stands on a pot.

original: snar ma ljang gu khyu ba dkar po la zhon pa /🔽mgo ser po sha ba la zhon pa /
analyzed: snar ma ljang gu khyu ba dkar po la zhon pa / mgo ser po sha ba la zhon pa /
translated: [Punarvasu] is green and rides a white ox.🔽[Pushya] is yellow and rides a deer.

original: lag dmar po sprul la zhon pa /
analyzed: lag dmar po sprul la zhon pa /
translated: [Ashlesha] is red and rides a snake.

original: nab so ser po padma la 'dug pa /🔽rgyal ljang gu bum pa la 'dug pa /
analyzed: nab so ser po padma la 'dug pa / rgyal ljang gu bum pa la 'dug pa /
translated: Nabhas is yellow, sitting on a lotus.🔽Jyeshtha is green, sitting on a pot.

original: skag ljang gu bya rog la 'dug pa /
analyzed: skag ljang gu bya rog la 'dug pa /
translated: Anurádhas is green, sitting on a crow.

original: mchu ser po me tog la @201a * //
analyzed: mchu ser po me tog la @201a * //
translated: Ashádhas is yellow, sitting on a flower.

original: 'dug pa / gre dkar po padma la 'dug pa /
analyzed: 'dug pa / gre dkar po padma la 'dug pa /
translated: Shravana is white, sitting on a lotus.

original: dbo ljang gu chu srin la 'dug pa /🔽me bzhi ser po glang po che la zhon pa /
analyzed: dbo ljang gu chu srin la 'dug pa / me bzhi ser po glang po che la zhon pa /
translated: Shatabhisha is green, sitting on a crocodile.🔽Purvabhadrapadás are yellow, riding on elephants.

original: nag pa ljang su rma bya la zhon pa /
analyzed: nag pa ljang su rma bya la zhon pa /
translated: Uttarabhadrapadás are green, riding on peacocks.

original: sa ri dmar po lcong mo la zhon pa /
analyzed: sa ri dmar po lcong mo la zhon pa /
translated: Revátis are red, riding on frogs.

original: sag ljang gu rta dkar bo la zhon pa /
analyzed: sag ljang gu rta dkar bo la zhon pa /
translated: Ashvini is green, riding on a white horse.

original: lha mtshams ser po bya rog la zhon pa /🔽sgrog dmar po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa /🔽snubs ljang gu sbal pa la zhon pa /
analyzed: lha mtshams ser po bya rog la zhon pa / sgrog dmar po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa / snubs ljang gu sbal pa la zhon pa /
translated: Mrigashiras is yellow, riding on a crow.🔽Ardra is red, sitting on a peacock.🔽Punarvasu is green, riding on a turtle.

original: chu stod ser po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa /
analyzed: chu stod ser po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa /
translated: Pushya is yellow, sitting on a peacock.

original: chu smad ljang gu mi'i snying la 'dug pa /🔽byi bzhin dkar po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa /🔽gro bzhin ser po skur ma la 'dug pa /
analyzed: chu smad ljang gu mi'i snying la 'dug pa / byi bzhin dkar po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa / gro bzhin ser po skur ma la 'dug pa /
translated: Ashlesha is green, sitting in a human heart.🔽Magha is white, sitting on a peacock.🔽Púrva-phalgunis are yellow, sitting on a peacock.

original: mon grub dmar po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa /
analyzed: mon grub dmar po nang tshangs can la 'dug pa /
translated: Uttara-phalgunis are red, sitting on a peacock.

original: mon gre ljang gu glud khyu mchog zhon pa /
analyzed: mon gre ljang gu glud khyu mchog zhon pa /
translated: Monira is green and rides a bull.

original: chu stod ljang gu gser khri la 'dug pa /
analyzed: chu stod ljang gu gser khri la 'dug pa /
translated: Punarvasu is green and sits on a golden throne.

original: tha skar ljang gu mi la 'dug pa /
analyzed: tha skar ljang gu mi la 'dug pa /
translated: Pushya is green and sits on a man.

original: bra nye ser po 'khor lo la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: bra nye ser po 'khor lo la 'dug pa'o //
translated: Ashvini is yellow and sits on a wheel.

original: sgo sgor de bzhin sgo ba rnams //
analyzed: sgo sgor de bzhin sgo ba rnams //
translated: At the gates, the gatekeepers

original: khros pa'i yid du bri bar bya //
analyzed: khros pa'i yid du bri bar bya //
translated: should be drawn with wrathful minds.

original: zhes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa gsungs te /
translated: This is stated.

original: phyi rol gyi sgo bzhi la rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa bzhi rab tu khros pa bskal pa'i me dpung 'bar ba'i dkyil na rdo rje'i brag ri la brkyang bskum gyi tshul du gnas pa bri /🔽rdo rje 'dzin mar zhugs nas ni //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sgo bzhi la rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa bzhi rab tu khros pa bskal pa'i me dpung 'bar ba'i dkyil na rdo rje'i brag ri la brkyang bskum gyi tshul du gnas pa bri / rdo rje 'dzin mar zhugs nas ni //
translated: At the four outer gates, the four such as Vajra Hook are very wrathful, standing in the midst of a blazing bonfire of the fire at the end of the eon, standing on vajra rock mountains in the manner of stretching and bending.🔽Having entered as Vajradhara,

original: zhes pa nas sam ya h'um gi bar gyis ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ba stan to //
analyzed: zhes pa nas sam ya h'um gi bar gyis ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ba stan to //
translated: from “the vajra master” up to “samaya hūṃ” teaches the entry into the maṇḍala.

original: da ni dbang bskur ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni dbang bskur ba ston te /
translated: Now, the empowerment is taught:

original: de nas gza' brgyang sngags btab ste ;
analyzed: de nas gza' brgyang sngags btab ste ;
translated: Then, having empowered the vase,

original: / de bum brgyang kyis dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: / de bum brgyang kyis dbang bskur ro //
translated: the empowerment is conferred with the vase.

original: zhes pa ni bdag nyid khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag nyid khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs la /
translated: This is the self entering into the samadhi of the total victory over the three worlds.

original: bum pa brgyang gza' brgyang kyi sngags kyis btab nas slob ma rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcas nas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa brgyang gza' brgyang kyi sngags kyis btab nas slob ma rdo rje'i phyag rgya bcas nas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Having sealed the vase with the mantra of the planets, the disciple should practice with the vajra mudra.

original: de nas tsandan dmar po'i shing la 'bras thug rin po che dang ; til dang / sbrang rtsi dang / s'a lu dkar po dang / bu ram /
analyzed: de nas tsandan dmar po'i shing la 'bras thug rin po che dang ; til dang / sbrang rtsi dang / s'a lu dkar po dang / bu ram /
translated: Then, on a stick of red sandalwood, one should prepare a cake of rice, jewels, sesame seeds, honey, white rice, and sugar.🔽Guggulu,

original: gu gul / spos /
analyzed: gu gul / spos /
translated: camphor,

original: kla rtsi gur gum rnams bsres la gza' brgyang bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: kla rtsi gur gum rnams bsres la gza' brgyang bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and saffron are mixed with red sandalwood and prepared as a cake.

original: da ni gza' brgyang kyis dam bcas ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni gza' brgyang kyis dam bcas ba ston te /
translated: Now, the vow of the planets is taught.🔽Then, those great planets,

original: de nas gza' chen po de dag ni zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bsrung zhing /
analyzed: de nas gza' chen po de dag ni zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bsrung zhing /
translated: is said in order to protect the speech of the Bhagavān and

original: rang gis dam bcas pa thams cad mi nyams bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: rang gis dam bcas pa thams cad mi nyams bar bya ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: to prevent all of their own vows from being damaged.🔽Then, by the lunar mansions and moments,

original: de nas rgyu skar dang yud tsam gyis ni zhes pa ni rgyu skar rnams yud tsam gyis ni mkha' la 'gro ste /
analyzed: de nas rgyu skar dang yud tsam gyis ni zhes pa ni rgyu skar rnams yud tsam gyis ni mkha' la 'gro ste /
translated: the lunar mansions move through the sky in moments.

original: de yang yud tsam gyi tshad las ni zhag tsam du brtsi zhing zhag la rgyu skar gyi rlung ded pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: de yang yud tsam gyi tshad las ni zhag tsam du brtsi zhing zhag la rgyu skar gyi rlung ded pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: Moreover, the measure of a moment is calculated as a day, and since the day is carried by the wind of the lunar mansions, it is mentioned.

original: skad cig dang / thang cig @201b dang ; dus dang zla tshigs dang zhes pa ni yud tsam gyi tshad las skad cig brtsi ste /
analyzed: skad cig dang / thang cig @201b dang ; dus dang zla tshigs dang zhes pa ni yud tsam gyi tshad las skad cig brtsi ste /
translated: Instant, second, time, year, and season are calculated as an instant from the measure of a moment.

original: yud tsam ni bud med bal 'khal ba skyen bul ran pas mo rang gi lag pa gang nar gyis drangs nas bkal te 'phang la bgos pa'i tshad ni yud tsam mo //🔽yud tsam nyi shu ni skad cag go //
analyzed: yud tsam ni bud med bal 'khal ba skyen bul ran pas mo rang gi lag pa gang nar gyis drangs nas bkal te 'phang la bgos pa'i tshad ni yud tsam mo // yud tsam nyi shu ni skad cag go //
translated: A moment is the measure of a woman spinning wool, spinning it evenly with her own hand, drawing it out and spinning it.🔽Twenty moments is a second.

original: skad cig nyi shu ni thang gcig go //
analyzed: skad cig nyi shu ni thang gcig go //
translated: Twenty seconds is a minute.

original: thang gcig bcu drug ni nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: thang gcig bcu drug ni nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: Sixteen minutes is a day.

original: nyin zhag gcig la gza' dang rgyu skar rim par rgyu ba de'i nyin par de bsgrubs na 'grub par gsungs so //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig la gza' dang rgyu skar rim par rgyu ba de'i nyin par de bsgrubs na 'grub par gsungs so //
translated: It is said that if one accomplishes that during the day when the planets and lunar mansions move in sequence, it will be accomplished.

original: dus dang lo tshigs dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dus dang lo tshigs dang zhes pa ni /
translated: Time, year, and season are as follows.

original: dus nam zla dbyar dgun ston dpyid bzhi'o //
analyzed: dus nam zla dbyar dgun ston dpyid bzhi'o //
translated: Time is the four seasons: summer, winter, autumn, and spring.

original: de yang lo gcig la zla ba bcu gnyis la de yang rab 'bri nag gsum gsum du dbye'o //
analyzed: de yang lo gcig la zla ba bcu gnyis la de yang rab 'bri nag gsum gsum du dbye'o //
translated: the waxing, the waning, and the dark.

original: de re re la yang gza' dang rgyu skar gang rgyu bde shes par bya ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: de re re la yang gza' dang rgyu skar gang rgyu bde shes par bya ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: In order to know which planets and stars move in which period, they are mentioned.

original: sbyor ba dang khyim dang dus sbyor dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang khyim dang dus sbyor dang zhes pa ni /
translated: The conjunctions, houses, and periods are as follows:

original: sbyor ba ni skar ma dang gza' sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni skar ma dang gza' sbyor ba'o //
translated: A conjunction is the conjunction of a star and a planet.

original: dus tshod dang tshes grangs su sbyor ba dang / nam zla re re la rgyu skar re re la rgyug rim du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dus tshod dang tshes grangs su sbyor ba dang / nam zla re re la rgyu skar re re la rgyug rim du sbyor ba'o //
translated: A period is the conjunction of a time and a lunar day, and the conjunction of a star with a period in each season.

original: khyim ni gnas te rgyu skar rim par rgyu ba'i gnas te /🔽de'i dus yu yang rang gi khyim du yang rgyu rnams rim pas bsgrub cing gnas par bya ba'i phyir dus ni nam zla dus bzhi'am /
analyzed: khyim ni gnas te rgyu skar rim par rgyu ba'i gnas te / de'i dus yu yang rang gi khyim du yang rgyu rnams rim pas bsgrub cing gnas par bya ba'i phyir dus ni nam zla dus bzhi'am /
translated: A house is a place, the place where the stars move in sequence.

original: zhag gi grangs kyi dus su rgyu skar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: zhag gi grangs kyi dus su rgyu skar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The time is the four seasons or the time of the number of days in which the stars are accomplished in their own houses.

original: 'jug phod la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha gang du 'jug pa de smos so //
analyzed: 'jug phod la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha gang du 'jug pa de smos so //
translated: The entry, etc., are the entry into the mandala of which deity is mentioned.

original: phyi ma ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The latter is easy, so it is not mentioned.

original: gza' brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gza' brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the summary of the Rāhu maṇḍala has been explained.

original: da ni klu chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor bshad de /
analyzed: da ni klu chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor bshad de /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala of the great nāga Rāhu is explained.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sems can klu gdon gyis zin pa rnams thar par bya ba'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sems can klu gdon gyis zin pa rnams thar par bya ba'i phyir smos so //
translated: That is mentioned in order to liberate worldly sentient beings who are afflicted by nāga grahas.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas klu chen po brgyang kyis phud ces bya ba'i sgras ni zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas klu chen po brgyang kyis phud ces bya ba'i sgras ni zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the great nāga Rāhu, with the sound of “phut,”

original: de nas ni skabs kyi de ma thag pa ste gza' brgyang kyi rting thogs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs kyi de ma thag pa ste gza' brgyang kyi rting thogs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: then means immediately after the context, that is, it occurs after the Rāhu maṇḍala.

original: klu chen po brgyud ni mtha' yas dang rigs ldan gnyis bram ze'i rigs me las byung ba ste /
analyzed: klu chen po brgyud ni mtha' yas dang rigs ldan gnyis bram ze'i rigs me las byung ba ste /
translated: The great nāga Rāhu is born from the fire of the brahmin caste.

original: dkar po nor rgyas dang dung skyong gnyis rgyal rigs las byung ba ste mdog kyang ser /
analyzed: dkar po nor rgyas dang dung skyong gnyis rgyal rigs las byung ba ste mdog kyang ser /
translated: The white Vāsuki and Śaṅkhapāla are born from the kṣatriya caste and are also yellow.

original: 'jog po dang padma chen po gnyis rlung las byung bas rje'u'i rigs te mdog kyang dmar /
analyzed: 'jog po dang padma chen po gnyis rlung las byung bas rje'u'i rigs te mdog kyang dmar /
translated: Kapila and Mahāpadma are born from the wind, so they are of the vaiśya caste and are also red.

original: stobs kyi rgyud dang padma gnyis chu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi rgyud dang padma gnyis chu las byung ba ste /
translated: The nāga and lotus families arise from water.

original: dmangs rigs mdog nag po ni rigs bzhi'i gtso bo bzhi yin pas chen po'o //🔽phud @202a * //
analyzed: dmangs rigs mdog nag po ni rigs bzhi'i gtso bo bzhi yin pas chen po'o // phud @202a * //
translated: The dark-colored śūdra is the great one, since it is the chief of the four castes.

original: ces bya ba ni rang gi dam tshig sgyu med pa'i snying po ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang gi dam tshig sgyu med pa'i snying po ste /
translated: The “essence” is one’s own commitment, the essence of nondeceptive illusion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dper na nor gyi dam pa ni phud du bcad de bzhag pa dang / zas kyi dam pa ni phud snal bcad de gzhag ba lha mchod pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: dper na nor gyi dam pa ni phud du bcad de bzhag pa dang / zas kyi dam pa ni phud snal bcad de gzhag ba lha mchod pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: For example, the best of wealth is set aside as the essence, and the best of food is set aside as the essence, like offering to the gods.🔽One should understand that one’s own commitment is the sign of nondeceptive illusion.

original: bdag gi dam tshig sgyu med pa'i rtags yin par shes par bya ste rnam ba gcig tu phud ni mang po las nyung du na gcod pa dang 'dra bar klu'i snying po mang po zhig byung yang /
analyzed: bdag gi dam tshig sgyu med pa'i rtags yin par shes par bya ste rnam ba gcig tu phud ni mang po las nyung du na gcod pa dang 'dra bar klu'i snying po mang po zhig byung yang /
translated: In one aspect, the essence is like cutting many into few, and although many nāga essences occur,🔽when they are set out in few [lines], there is nothing other than the essence.

original: nyung du ba stan na phud ces bya ba las med pas na phud ni bsdus pa dang / 'dus pa'i phyir na sgras mnyam pa'i thabs su brjod do //
analyzed: nyung du ba stan na phud ces bya ba las med pas na phud ni bsdus pa dang / 'dus pa'i phyir na sgras mnyam pa'i thabs su brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the essence is said to be the method of equalizing through sound by means of gathering and collecting.

original: bcom ldan 'das la snying bo dbul bar zhub gsol ba dang / klu'i rgyal po la ngang ba dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' nas snying po brjod pa ni rab tu bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la snying bo dbul bar zhub gsol ba dang / klu'i rgyal po la ngang ba dang / klu'i rgyal po dga' nas snying po brjod pa ni rab tu bde ste ma smos so //
translated: and the king of nagas was delighted and expressed his heart, but it was not mentioned.

original: da ni klu chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don ston te /
analyzed: da ni klu chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the maṇḍala of the eight great nāgas is taught.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Moreover, why is that?

original: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nas de dag gi dkyil 'khor bshad de zhes smos so //
translated: Then, their maṇḍala is explained.

original: da nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
analyzed: da nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
translated: Now, it is the continuation of the context.

original: de dag ni glu chen po de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni glu chen po de dag go //
translated: Those are the eight great nāgas.

original: dkyil ni phyag na rdo rje klu'i rgyal po'i tshul du gnas so //
analyzed: dkyil ni phyag na rdo rje klu'i rgyal po'i tshul du gnas so //
translated: The center is Vajrapāṇi abiding in the form of the king of nāgas.

original: 'khor ni klu chen po brgyang do //
analyzed: 'khor ni klu chen po brgyang do //
translated: The retinue is the eight great nāgas.

original: bshad pa ni de'i don dang tshig ba stan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni de'i don dang tshig ba stan pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the teaching of their meaning and words.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Moreover, why is that?

original: padma chen po 'dab brgyad la //
analyzed: padma chen po 'dab brgyad la //
translated: On a great eight-petaled lotus,

original: kha dog dkar po bri bar bya //
analyzed: kha dog dkar po bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw a white color.

original: zhes gsungs te ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs te ;
translated: Thus it is said.

original: padma ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhir byas pa'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyang pa kha dog dkar por bris te /
analyzed: padma ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhir byas pa'i dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyang pa kha dog dkar por bris te /
translated: The lotus is drawn in the center of a square maṇḍala, with a white eight-petaled lotus.

original: dkyil 'khor sum gnyis las gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sum gnyis las gcad par bya'o //
translated: Two-thirds of the maṇḍala should be cut out.

original: phyi'i gru chad dang / shing rta'i snam bu la bang mig dang sgo dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi'i gru chad dang / shing rta'i snam bu la bang mig dang sgo dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: The outer section and the chariot platform should have a checkerboard pattern and doors.

original: dbus su phyag na rdo rje sprul mgo mtha' yas pa'i gdengs ka can klu'i rgyal po bsdigs pa'i tshul du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus su phyag na rdo rje sprul mgo mtha' yas pa'i gdengs ka can klu'i rgyal po bsdigs pa'i tshul du gnas par bya'o //
translated: In the center, Vajrapāṇi should be drawn with an infinite number of snake heads, in the manner of threatening the nāga kings.

original: padma'i 'dab ma la shar phyogs su mtha' yas phyag na autpala bsnams pa /🔽lhor 'jog po dgra sta /
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la shar phyogs su mtha' yas phyag na autpala bsnams pa / lhor 'jog po dgra sta /
translated: On the lotus petals, in the east, Ananta holds an utpala flower;🔽in the south, Takṣaka holds a sword;

original: nub tu stobs kyi rgyu sprul gyi gshol /🔽byang phyogs su dung skyong dung phor /
analyzed: nub tu stobs kyi rgyu sprul gyi gshol / byang phyogs su dung skyong dung phor /
translated: in the west, Vāsuki holds a plow;🔽in the north, Śaṅkhapāla holds a conch;

original: shar lhor nor rgyas bum pa /
analyzed: shar lhor nor rgyas bum pa /
translated: in the southeast, Vāruṇa holds a vase;

original: lho nub tu padma padma 'dab ma brgyang /
analyzed: lho nub tu padma padma 'dab ma brgyang /
translated: in the southwest, Padma holds an eight-petaled lotus;

original: nub byad du chu lha sprul zhags /
analyzed: nub byad du chu lha sprul zhags /
translated: in the northwest, Varuna holds a snake noose;

original: byang shar du rigs ldan rin chen rgyal bu rnams /
analyzed: byang shar du rigs ldan rin chen rgyal bu rnams /
translated: and in the northeast, Kulika holds a jewel.

original: bru chad la dus bzhi'i lha mo /
analyzed: bru chad la dus bzhi'i lha mo /
translated: The four goddesses of the four times are on the four corners.

original: shing rta'i bang mig la klu gnod sgor sgo ba rnams bri'o //
analyzed: shing rta'i bang mig la klu gnod sgor sgo ba rnams bri'o //
translated: The four gate-guardians are on the four corners of the chariot-wheels.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs bsdus pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs bsdus pa bshad zin to //
translated: The method of drawing the mandala is explained in brief.

original: mchod rdzas bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: mchod rdzas bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The offering substances are easy, so they are not mentioned.

original: @202b da ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ston te /
analyzed: @202b da ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ston te /
translated: Now, the entry into the mandala is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas rdo rje bdag nyid zhugs pa ni zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bdag nyid zhugs pa ni zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the entry of the vajra nature is then.

original: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs so //
translated: Then is the immediate sequence of the occasion.

original: rdo rje ni slob dpon sku gsung thugs rdo rjer bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni slob dpon sku gsung thugs rdo rjer bsgom pa'o //
translated: Vajra is the meditation on the vajra body, speech, and mind of the master.

original: bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor bdag nyid du gnas shing bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni dkyil 'khor bdag nyid du gnas shing bsgom pa'o //
translated: Nature is abiding and meditating as the nature of the mandala.

original: zhugs pa ni gnyis su med par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhugs pa ni gnyis su med par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Entry is the meaning of making nondual.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽The heads of the emanations summon those with emanation heads.

original: sprul mgos sprul mgo can rnams dgug / phud ces bya ba'i lhan cig tu /
analyzed: sprul mgos sprul mgo can rnams dgug / phud ces bya ba'i lhan cig tu /
translated: PHUD is together with

original: dza; h'um bam ho:zhes brjod cing //
analyzed: dza; h'um bam ho:zhes brjod cing //
translated: JUM BAM HO:

original: zhes gsungs / sprul mgos ni zhes pa ni bdag slob dpon las kyi bdag nyid phyag na rdo rjer bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs / sprul mgos ni zhes pa ni bdag slob dpon las kyi bdag nyid phyag na rdo rjer bsgom pa'o //
translated: The snake-headed means that one meditates on oneself as the master Vajrapāṇi.

original: sprul mgo can rnams ni klu rnam pa brgyang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul mgo can rnams ni klu rnam pa brgyang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The snake-headed ones are the eight nāgas, Ananta and so forth.

original: dgug pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gnyis su med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dgug pa ni dam tshig gi phyag rgyas gnyis su med par byas pa'o //
translated: The summoning is the nondual act with the pledge seal.

original: phud ni dam tshig gi mna'i snying po'o //
analyzed: phud ni dam tshig gi mna'i snying po'o //
translated: The offering is the essence of the pledge water.

original: lhan cig tu ni dam las mi 'da' bar bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhan cig tu ni dam las mi 'da' bar bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The together means the pledge not to transgress.

original: dza:ni lcags kyu /
analyzed: dza:ni lcags kyu /
translated: The jaḥ is the iron hook.

original: h'um ni zhags pa /
analyzed: h'um ni zhags pa /
