original: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa dang dngos grub kyi rtags mthong nas mchod pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas slob ma gzhug cing me tog dor ba dang / mig dbye ba @206a * //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa dang dngos grub kyi rtags mthong nas mchod pa dang / rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgyas slob ma gzhug cing me tog dor ba dang / mig dbye ba @206a * //
translated: Having entered the mandala and seen the signs of spiritual powers, make offerings, and with the mudra of Vajradhatviśvari, the disciple should enter, cast the flower, and have the eyes opened.

original: dag sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: dag sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas dbang bskur zhing /
translated: The initiation is conferred by the vase empowered by the mantra.

original: sngags kyis bsnyen pa'i tshad bsgrub pa'i gnas dang / lha 'ongs nas dngos grub ster zhing gsol ba gdab pa ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: sngags kyis bsnyen pa'i tshad bsgrub pa'i gnas dang / lha 'ongs nas dngos grub ster zhing gsol ba gdab pa ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The place for accomplishing the measure of the mantra repetition, and the deity coming and bestowing spiritual powers, and the supplication, are easy and so are not mentioned.

original: phyi ma lha chen po rnams kyis 'jig rten la phan par byed pa'i thabs sna tshogs 'byung ba ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: phyi ma lha chen po rnams kyis 'jig rten la phan par byed pa'i thabs sna tshogs 'byung ba ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The later various means of benefiting the world by the great gods are easy and so are not mentioned.

original: lha chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: lha chen po brgyang kyi dkyil 'khor gyi don bsdus pa bshad zin to //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the maṇḍala of the great gods is explained.

original: da ni tshe dpag med gshin rje 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: da ni tshe dpag med gshin rje 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala of Amitāyus, the conqueror of Yama, is taught.

original: de ni sems can dus ma yin par 'chi bas 'jigs pa'i gnyen por gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni sems can dus ma yin par 'chi bas 'jigs pa'i gnyen por gsungs te /
translated: That is taught as the antidote for the fear of untimely death of sentient beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis dkyil 'khor la kun du  gzigs nas 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang zhes pa ni thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes las skyes pa'i phyag na rdo rje nyid kyi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten pa'i 'khor sna tshogs
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje nyid kyis dkyil 'khor la kun du  gzigs nas 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang zhes pa ni thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes las skyes pa'i phyag na rdo rje nyid kyi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten pa'i 'khor sna tshogs
translated: Then, Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi himself, having looked all around the maṇḍala, smiled.

original: pa la tshe dpag med kyi dkyil 'khor bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: pa la tshe dpag med kyi dkyil 'khor bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: This means that Vajrapāṇi himself, born from the mind of perfect pristine consciousness, intending to explain the Amitāyus maṇḍala to the various worldly retinues,

original: glang po che'i lta stangs kyis kun du  gzigs nas /
analyzed: glang po che'i lta stangs kyis kun du  gzigs nas /
translated: looked all around with the gaze of an elephant.

original: zhal 'dzum pa gser gyi kha dog lta bu mdzad nas 'od kyis 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa gser gyi kha dog lta bu mdzad nas 'od kyis 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar mdzad do //
translated: Having smiled with a golden-colored face, he illuminated the world systems with light.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Moreover, why is that?

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag g-yos zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag g-yos zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “that maṇḍala of the retinue shook.”

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i 'khor ro //
translated: The maṇḍala of the retinue is the worldly retinue of Brahmā and so on.

original: g-yos pa ni drod de sngon gyi dge pa'i rtsa ba'i tshogs g-yos pa'o //
analyzed: g-yos pa ni drod de sngon gyi dge pa'i rtsa ba'i tshogs g-yos pa'o //
translated: Shaking is heat, the shaking of the accumulation of previously existing roots of virtue.

original: yang dag par g-yos pa ni rtse mo ste /
analyzed: yang dag par g-yos pa ni rtse mo ste /
translated: Correct shaking is the peak.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba'i rtse mo byung bas phyi gzung ba'i yul spangs pas yang dag par g-yos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel ba'i rtse mo byung bas phyi gzung ba'i yul spangs pas yang dag par g-yos so //
translated: The peak of the increase of the roots of virtue arises, and by abandoning the external objects to be grasped, it is perfectly shaken.

original: yang dag par 'gul ni bzod pa ste phyi gzung ba'i yul spangs pas na 'gul /
analyzed: yang dag par 'gul ni bzod pa ste phyi gzung ba'i yul spangs pas na 'gul /
translated: Patience is the perfect shaking, because by abandoning the external objects to be grasped, it shakes.

original: nang 'dzin pa'i sems spong ba la zhugs pas ni yang dag par 'gul to //
analyzed: nang 'dzin pa'i sems spong ba la zhugs pas ni yang dag par 'gul to //
translated: Engaging in abandoning the internal mind of grasping is the perfect shaking.

original: 'bar rab tu 'bar ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog ste nang 'dzin pa'i sems spong bas ni 'bar ro //
analyzed: 'bar rab tu 'bar ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog ste nang 'dzin pa'i sems spong bas ni 'bar ro //
translated: The supreme worldly dharmas are the blazing and perfect blazing, because by abandoning the internal mind of grasping, it blazes.

original: sa dang por bden pa mthong bas ni rab tu 'bar ro //
analyzed: sa dang por bden pa mthong bas ni rab tu 'bar ro //
translated: Seeing the truth on the first ground is the perfect blazing.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'bar zhing sa dang po bden pa mthong ba'i lam ste 'jig rten pa'i mtshan ma rab tu 'joms pas yang dag par rab tu 'bar ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'bar zhing sa dang po bden pa mthong ba'i lam ste 'jig rten pa'i mtshan ma rab tu 'joms pas yang dag par rab tu 'bar ro //
translated: The path of seeing the truth on the first ground is the perfect blazing, because it completely conquers the worldly signs.

original: dgod rab tu yang dag par rab tu dgod ni ye shes ni @206b dgod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgod rab tu yang dag par rab tu dgod ni ye shes ni @206b dgod par byed pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that causes the establishment and perfect establishment of the branches of enlightenment is the establishment.

original: grogs byang chub kyi yan lag gis ni rab tu dgod par byed do //
analyzed: grogs byang chub kyi yan lag gis ni rab tu dgod par byed do //
translated: The branches of enlightenment cause the perfect establishment.

original: spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par rab tu dgod do //
analyzed: spyod pa pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par rab tu dgod do //
translated: He is the one who perfectly establishes beings in the perfections of conduct.

original: brtse rab tu brtse yang dag par rab tu brtse zhes pa ni sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin thob pas ni brtse'o //
analyzed: brtse rab tu brtse yang dag par rab tu brtse zhes pa ni sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin thob pas ni brtse'o //
translated: He is the one who is most compassionate, perfectly compassionate, because he is compassionate through attaining the tenth bhumi, Cloud of Dharma.🔽He is the one who is perfectly compassionate, because he causes the fruition of buddhahood.🔽He is the one who is the most amazing, because he is the most amazing of all amazing things.

original: 'bras bu sangs rgyas par byed pas ni yang dag par rab tu brtse zhing zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'bras bu sangs rgyas par byed pas ni yang dag par rab tu brtse zhing zhes smos so //
translated: He is the one who is the most wondrous, because he is the most wondrous of all wondrous things.🔽He is the one who is the most marvelous, because he is the most marvelous of all marvelous things.🔽He is the one who is the most astonishing, because he is the most astonishing of all astonishing things.

original: rmad kyi ya mtshan du ma 'jig rten du snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: rmad kyi ya mtshan du ma 'jig rten du snang bar gyur to //
translated: He is the one who is the most incredible, because he is the most incredible of all incredible things.🔽He is the one who is the most supreme, because he is the most supreme of all supreme things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most excellent, because he is the most excellent of all excellent things.🔽He is the one who is the most sublime, because he is the most sublime of all sublime things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.

original: dga' ldan gnas nas 'jig rten mi yul du babs te mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyi tshul du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dga' ldan gnas nas 'jig rten mi yul du babs te mdzad pa bcu gnyis kyi tshul du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.🔽He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'khor dam par 'gyur ram 'dzum pa'i don ba stan par zhu ba gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dpag tu med pa'i 'chi bdag bcom pa'i don thos sam zhes pa dang / 'khor rnams dga' nas zhu ba gsol ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'khor dam par 'gyur ram 'dzum pa'i don ba stan par zhu ba gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dpag tu med pa'i 'chi bdag bcom pa'i don thos sam zhes pa dang / 'khor rnams dga' nas zhu ba gsol ba dang /
translated: He is the one who is the most exalted, because he is the most exalted of all exalted things.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yig 'bru bshad pa ni rab tu bde ste brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yig 'bru bshad pa ni rab tu bde ste brda phrad sla'o //
translated: The explanation of the syllables of the root mantra is very easy, as it is easy to understand.

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs dang / sngags mkhan bdag nyid zhugs nas lha spyan drang ba dang / bdag nyid dbang bskur zhing spyan ras gzigs bsgrubs na dngos grub kyi rtags sems nyams dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i thabs dang / sngags mkhan bdag nyid zhugs nas lha spyan drang ba dang / bdag nyid dbang bskur zhing spyan ras gzigs bsgrubs na dngos grub kyi rtags sems nyams dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / rdo rje 'dzin ma'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: The method of drawing the maṇḍala, the mantra practitioner himself entering, inviting the deity, the consecration of oneself, and if Avalokiteśvara is accomplished, the sign of spiritual powers is a joyful mind, and binding the mudrā of Vajradhātviśvarī,

original: slob ma gzhug cing me tog dor ba dang / phreng ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig 'bogs pa'i khyad par dang / dam nyams gsad ba'i las bya ba ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: slob ma gzhug cing me tog dor ba dang / phreng ba la sogs pas dbang bskur ba dang / dam tshig 'bogs pa'i khyad par dang / dam nyams gsad ba'i las bya ba ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: the disciple enters, casts a flower, is consecrated with a garland, and so on, the special bestowal of the pledge, and the rite of killing a vow violator is easy, so it is not mentioned.

original: sdig pa che ba med par bsgrub pa dang / dam tshig khyad par ba stan pa dang dbang bskur ba ni bde ste ma bshad do //
analyzed: sdig pa che ba med par bsgrub pa dang / dam tshig khyad par ba stan pa dang dbang bskur ba ni bde ste ma bshad do //
translated: Accomplishing without great sin, teaching the special pledge, and conferring consecration is easy, so it is not explained.

original: slob dpon mnyes pa'i yon dbul ba dang dngos grub gsol ba dang slob dpon gyis slob ma la dngos grub spyin pa ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon mnyes pa'i yon dbul ba dang dngos grub gsol ba dang slob dpon gyis slob ma la dngos grub spyin pa ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The pleasing gift to the master, the request for powers, and the master's bestowal of powers to the disciple are easy, so they are not mentioned.

original: da ni sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: Now the method of practice is taught.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽chos rnams thams cad dngos med par //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / chos rnams thams cad dngos med par //
translated: Why is that?

original: sems kyis bsgom par byas nas kyang //
analyzed: sems kyis bsgom par byas nas kyang //
translated: Having meditated with the mind that all phenomena are unreal,

original: zhes gsungs te dkyil 'khor drug po gang sgom yang gtso bo mngon byang lnga po 'dis bskyed do //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te dkyil 'khor drug po gang sgom yang gtso bo mngon byang lnga po 'dis bskyed do //
translated: Whatever the six maṇḍalas one meditates on, one generates the principal one with these five manifest enlightenments.

original: de la dang po stong pa la mngon par byang chub pa ni lag pa mnyam gzhag bya ste /🔽ngag tu aom sva bh'a ba shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shddjo& ham zhes brjod pas chos thams cad @207a * //
analyzed: de la dang po stong pa la mngon par byang chub pa ni lag pa mnyam gzhag bya ste / ngag tu aom sva bh'a ba shuddha:sarba dharm'a:sva bh'a ba shddjo& ham zhes brjod pas chos thams cad @207a * //
translated: Therein, the first, manifest enlightenment in emptiness, is the placement of the hands in equipoise.

original: stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting “oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ,” one should meditate on all phenomena as emptiness.

original: nge'i ngang las byang chub kyi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mngon par byang chub pa ni aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam /
analyzed: nge'i ngang las byang chub kyi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mngon par byang chub pa ni aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam /
translated: From that state, the manifest enlightenment of the moon maṇḍala of bodhicitta is the moon maṇḍala imagined from aṃ.

original: a'a li bcu drug las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bsam mo //
analyzed: a'a li bcu drug las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du bsam mo //
translated: From the sixteen vowels, imagine the moon maṇḍala.

original: de nas brtan pa'i snying po ni /
analyzed: de nas brtan pa'i snying po ni /
translated: Next, the essence of stability is

original: aom tsitta pra ti bedham ka ro mi zhes brjod pas rang gi sems rang gis rig pa'o //
analyzed: aom tsitta pra ti bedham ka ro mi zhes brjod pas rang gi sems rang gis rig pa'o //
translated: “oṃ citta-prativedhaṃ karo mi,” which means “my mind is aware of itself.”

original: rang gi sa bon de dbus su zhes so //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon de dbus su zhes so //
translated: “My seed” is in the center.

original: yang de'i steng du snying po bsam de'i mtha' na phar k'a li las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyis brtsegs su gyur par bsam /
analyzed: yang de'i steng du snying po bsam de'i mtha' na phar k'a li las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyis brtsegs su gyur par bsam /
translated: Again, above that, imagine the essence of the moon maṇḍala, which is stacked twice from the ka-through-ha-ṃ.

original: de brtan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de brtan par bya ba ni /
translated: To stabilize that,

original: aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da ya mi zhes brjod pas ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs so //
analyzed: aom bo dhi tsitta autp'a da ya mi zhes brjod pas ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs so //
translated: “oṃ bodhicitta utpādayā mi” means “the accumulation of gnosis is complete.”

original: yig 'bru las mngon par byang chub pa ni de'i steng du lha gang bsgom gyi snying po bsam /
analyzed: yig 'bru las mngon par byang chub pa ni de'i steng du lha gang bsgom gyi snying po bsam /
translated: “Enlightenment from the seed” is imagining the essence of the deity to be meditated upon above that.

original: de brtan pa'i snying po ni tishtha badzra zhes brjod pas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: de brtan pa'i snying po ni tishtha badzra zhes brjod pas brtan par bya'o //
translated: “The essence of stability” is “tiṣṭha vajra,” which means “stabilize.”

original: de las 'od 'phros 'dus pa las dam tshig gi phyag rgya la bsams nas dam tshig phyag rgya yang zhes so //
analyzed: de las 'od 'phros 'dus pa las dam tshig gi phyag rgya la bsams nas dam tshig phyag rgya yang zhes so //
translated: “Light shines from that, returns, and dissolves into the pledge seal,” which means that the pledge seal is imagined.

original: mngon par byang chub pa ni lha gang bsgo ma gyi phyag mtshan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa ni lha gang bsgo ma gyi phyag mtshan du gyur pa'o //
translated: The manifest enlightenment is the deity who becomes the hand implement.

original: de brtan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de brtan par bya ba ni /
translated: The stabilization is

original: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes pas brtan par gyur to //
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma ko& ham zhes pas brtan par gyur to //
translated: “Oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ.”

original: mtshan ma de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs da bag tu med par zhugs pa las ;
analyzed: mtshan ma de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs da bag tu med par zhugs pa las ;
translated: The sign is the form of the deity.

original: phyag rgya chen po mngon par byang chub pa ni dkyil 'khor gang bsgom gyi gtso bor gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po mngon par byang chub pa ni dkyil 'khor gang bsgom gyi gtso bor gyur ba'o //
translated: The great seal manifest enlightenment is the principal deity of the mandala that is being meditated on.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta t'a sta ham zhes brjod pas bcu gcig par sangs rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta t'a sta ham zhes brjod pas bcu gcig par sangs rgyas par gyur to //
translated: “Oṃ sarva tathāgata tāstha haṃ.”

original: de nas rang gis bon dang lha gang bsgom gyi sngags dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgyas sku phyag rgya chen po la gnas bzhir byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: de nas rang gis bon dang lha gang bsgom gyi sngags dang / dam tshig gi phyag rgyas sku phyag rgya chen po la gnas bzhir byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: Then, with one’s own seed and the mantra of the deity that is being meditated on, and the pledge seal, one consecrates the great seal body at the four places.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur zhes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur zhes so //
translated: “The buddhas confer empowerment.”

original: de nas rigs lnga'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de nas rigs lnga'i phyag rgyas dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, one is empowered with the seals of the five families.

original: aom buddha mu dra aa bhi shanytsa aom spyi bor /
analyzed: aom buddha mu dra aa bhi shanytsa aom spyi bor /
translated: Oṃ buddha-mudra-abhiṣiñca oṃ on the crown.

original: aom badzra mu dra aa bhe shinytsa h'um /
analyzed: aom badzra mu dra aa bhe shinytsa h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra-mudra-abhiṣiñca hūṃ🔽on the top of the head.

original: mtshog khar / aom ratna mu dra aa bhi shinytsa t'am /
analyzed: mtshog khar / aom ratna mu dra aa bhi shinytsa t'am /
translated: Oṃ ratna-mudra-abhiṣiñca trāṃ

original: ltag pa g-yas /
analyzed: ltag pa g-yas /
translated: to the right of the back of the head.

original: aom padma mu dra aa bhi shinytsa hr'i:/
analyzed: aom padma mu dra aa bhi shinytsa hr'i:/
translated: Oṃ padma-mudra-abhiṣiñca hriḥ

original: lhag pa ru /
analyzed: lhag pa ru /
translated: to the left of the back of the head.

original: aom karma mu dra aa bhi shitsnya a'a:/
analyzed: aom karma mu dra aa bhi shitsnya a'a:/
translated: Oṃ karma-mudra-abhiṣiñca āḥ

original: ltag pa g-yon du'o //
analyzed: ltag pa g-yon du'o //
translated: to the left of the back of the head.

original: de nas dar dpyad gi dbang ni /
analyzed: de nas dar dpyad gi dbang ni /
translated: Then, the empowerment of the silk ribbon:

original: aom badzra pa tam b'a lam bi ni aa bhi shinytsa hr'i: zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra pa tam b'a lam bi ni aa bhi shinytsa hr'i: zhes pa'o //
translated: Oṃ vajra-pāṭala-vinaya-abhiṣiñca hriḥ.

original: de las lha'i skur bskyed de /
analyzed: de las lha'i skur bskyed de /
translated: From that, generate the deity’s form.

original: bsgrubs na dngos grub thob ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgrubs na dngos grub thob ces gsungs so //
translated: If you practice, you will attain spiritual powers.

original: mandala du @207b zhugs pa'i phan yon zhu ba dang / bha ga b'an gyi bka' stsal pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i thabs ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: mandala du @207b zhugs pa'i phan yon zhu ba dang / bha ga b'an gyi bka' stsal pa dang / dbang bskur ba'i thabs ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The benefits of entering the maṇḍala, the Bhagavān’s reply, and the method of empowerment are easy and not mentioned.

original: tshe dpag med gshin rje 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshe dpag med gshin rje 'joms pa'i dkyil 'khor bshad zin to //
translated: The maṇḍala of Amitāyus, the conqueror of the Lord of Death, has been explained.

original: da ni zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gi las ston te /
analyzed: da ni zhi ba'i sbyin sreg gi las ston te /
translated: Now, the rite of peaceful fire offering is taught.

original: spyin pa ni bde ba la /
analyzed: spyin pa ni bde ba la /
translated: Giving is for happiness.

original: sreg pa ni nyon mongs pa'o ;
analyzed: sreg pa ni nyon mongs pa'o ;
translated: The burning is the afflictions.

original: / de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: lha'i bu rnams zhi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams zhi zhes gsungs te /
translated: The sons of the gods are pacified.

original: lha'i bu zhes smos pa ni khyab pa spyir la gtang ba'i phyir ram lha'i bu gzhon nu rnams g-yeng ba che bas /
analyzed: lha'i bu zhes smos pa ni khyab pa spyir la gtang ba'i phyir ram lha'i bu gzhon nu rnams g-yeng ba che bas /
translated: The mention of sons of the gods is a general reference to pervasion, or else the young sons of the gods are very distracted,

original: nyan cing mdun du 'dug pa'i phyir ming ni ma smos te lha'i bu rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan cing mdun du 'dug pa'i phyir ming ni ma smos te lha'i bu rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so their names are not mentioned, and they are called sons of the gods.

original: zhi ba ni thugs rang bzhin gyis zhi bas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma zhi bar byed pa'i tha tshig ste de'i thabs ni 'di ltar yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni thugs rang bzhin gyis zhi bas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan ma zhi bar byed pa'i tha tshig ste de'i thabs ni 'di ltar yin te /
translated: Pacified means that the mind is pacified by nature, and the pacification of the signs of afflictions is the meaning of pacified. The method of that is as follows:

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?🔽The medium and inferior fire pits are one cubit and two cubits,

original: hom khung bar ma tha ma mchog / khru gang khru do khru bzhi pa //
analyzed: hom khung bar ma tha ma mchog / khru gang khru do khru bzhi pa //
translated: and the supreme one is four cubits.

original: zlum po nyid du byas nas ni //🔽zhes gsungs te /🔽thab khung bar ma ni khru do ;🔽tha ma khru gang /
analyzed: zlum po nyid du byas nas ni // zhes gsungs te / thab khung bar ma ni khru do ; tha ma khru gang /
translated: Having made them round,🔽the medium fire pit is two cubits.🔽The inferior one is one cubit.

original: mchog ni khru bzhi yin te gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis spangs pas ni khru gang du ba stan la /
analyzed: mchog ni khru bzhi yin te gzung 'dzin rnam pa gnyis spangs pas ni khru gang du ba stan la /
translated: The supreme one is four cubits.

original: thabs dang shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i rtags su khru do'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i rtags su khru do'o //
translated: The sign of possessing both method and wisdom is a height of one cubit and four finger-widths.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i rtags khru bzhir ba stan la /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i rtags khru bzhir ba stan la /
translated: The sign of possessing the four immeasurables is a width of four cubits.

original: dngos po'i mtha' spangs pa'i rtags su ni phyi rol zlum por bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtha' spangs pa'i rtags su ni phyi rol zlum por bya ste /
translated: The sign of abandoning the extreme of entities is the outer [area] is made round.

original: thab khung rab 'bri nag gi tshad las lha dgod pa'i rim pa yang che chung du bri'o //
analyzed: thab khung rab 'bri nag gi tshad las lha dgod pa'i rim pa yang che chung du bri'o //
translated: The size of the hearth should be drawn according to the size of the deities.

original: thab khung gi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyang dkar po cig bri /🔽thab kyi kha khyer la mu ran btang /
analyzed: thab khung gi dbus su 'khor lo rtsibs brgyang dkar po cig bri / thab kyi kha khyer la mu ran btang /
translated: In the center of the hearth, draw a white wheel with eight spokes.🔽On the lip of the hearth, make a border.

original: mu ran la me ri btang /
analyzed: mu ran la me ri btang /
translated: On the border, make a ring of fire.

original: kha khyer la rdo rje'i ra btang /
analyzed: kha khyer la rdo rje'i ra btang /
translated: On the lip, make a vajra fence.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi bang rim gcig la rigs rnam pa bzhi'i phyag rgya rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang rgya gram rnams bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi bang rim gcig la rigs rnam pa bzhi'i phyag rgya rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / padma dang rgya gram rnams bri /
translated: On the first outer step, draw the four types of family seals: vajra, jewel, lotus, and sword.

original: de'i phyi rol la sems dpa' bcu drug bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol la sems dpa' bcu drug bri /
translated: Outside of that, draw the sixteen sattvas.

original: de'i phyi rol snam bu la phyogs skyong bcu dang lha chen po brgyang bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol snam bu la phyogs skyong bcu dang lha chen po brgyang bri /
translated: Outside of that, on the wall, draw the ten direction protectors and the eight great gods.

original: de'i phyi rol du gza' chen po brgyang dang rgyu skar gyi mtshan ma'am thig le bri /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du gza' chen po brgyang dang rgyu skar gyi mtshan ma'am thig le bri /
translated: Outside of that, draw the signs of the twenty-eight lunar mansions and the asterisms, or bindus.

original: de nas gdod sgo ba bzhi bri //
analyzed: de nas gdod sgo ba bzhi bri //
translated: Then, finally, draw the four gate-keepers.

original: da ni las bya ba'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: da ni las bya ba'i thabs ston te /
translated: Now, the method of performing the rite is taught.

original: de yi ming yang yungs kar gyis /
analyzed: de yi ming yang yungs kar gyis /
translated: Also, with the name of that [deceased],🔽mixed with mustard seeds,

original: brgya phrag stong du bsres byas na //
analyzed: brgya phrag stong du bsres byas na //
translated: one hundred thousand times,

original: ngan song kun las rnam par thar //
analyzed: ngan song kun las rnam par thar //
translated: one is completely liberated from all evil destinies.

original: zhes gsungs te de ni sems can shi ba'o //🔽ming ni gdags pa'i @208a * //
analyzed: zhes gsungs te de ni sems can shi ba'o // ming ni gdags pa'i @208a * //
translated: That is for the deceased sentient being.

original: gzhi ste yungs kar dang bsres la so so'i sngags dang ming spel mar spyin sreg bya /
analyzed: gzhi ste yungs kar dang bsres la so so'i sngags dang ming spel mar spyin sreg bya /
translated: The name is the basis of designation. Mix it with mustard seeds, and do the homa alternating the mantra with the name.

original: rnam pa gcig tu ni sha dang rus pa dang rkang dang skra dang gos la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / ro bsregs pa'i thal ba la sogs pa dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dang / 'bras chan dang ; la du la sogs pa dang bsres nas las byas na ngan song las thar bar gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu ni sha dang rus pa dang rkang dang skra dang gos la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / ro bsregs pa'i thal ba la sogs pa dang / gur gum dang / tsandan dang / 'bras chan dang ; la du la sogs pa dang bsres nas las byas na ngan song las thar bar gsungs so //
translated: In one way, it is said that one is liberated from the evil destinies if one performs the rite mixing with the signs of flesh, bones, marrow, hair, clothes, and so forth, with the ashes of the burnt corpse, and with saffron, sandalwood, boiled rice, sesame seeds, and so forth.

original: bri ba'i thabs bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: bri ba'i thabs bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The method of drawing is easy, so it is not mentioned.

original: da ni mchod pa'i khyad par ston te /
analyzed: da ni mchod pa'i khyad par ston te /
translated: Now, the special offerings are taught.🔽The bird, the vase, and the filling,

original: bya dang bum pa dgang ba dang // zhes pa ni dngul gyi bya pho dang / gser gyi bum pa spos chus bkang ba dang / gtor ma dang lha bshos la sogs pa dkar por byas la gzhag pa dang / mar dang / 'o ma dang /
analyzed: bya dang bum pa dgang ba dang // zhes pa ni dngul gyi bya pho dang / gser gyi bum pa spos chus bkang ba dang / gtor ma dang lha bshos la sogs pa dkar por byas la gzhag pa dang / mar dang / 'o ma dang /
translated: means that a silver cock, a golden vase filled with scented water, and a torma and bali offering, etc., are made white and set out.🔽Butter, milk,

original: sbrang rtsi dang / spos dang / yungs kar rnams kyang mchod rdzas su gzhag ste de ni mchod pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang / spos dang / yungs kar rnams kyang mchod rdzas su gzhag ste de ni mchod pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: honey, incense, and white mustard seeds are also set out as offering substances. This is the special offering.

original: da ni gos ba stan te /
analyzed: da ni gos ba stan te /
translated: Now, the clothing is taught.

original: dkar po'i gos ni gon nas kyang //
analyzed: dkar po'i gos ni gon nas kyang //
translated: Having put on white clothing,

original: zhes pa ni sngags mkhan gyis dpal gyi gos dkar po gon pa dang / srad bu dkar po se ral du thogs shing las gong nas 'byung ba bzhin byas na 'grub par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags mkhan gyis dpal gyi gos dkar po gon pa dang / srad bu dkar po se ral du thogs shing las gong nas 'byung ba bzhin byas na 'grub par gsungs so //
translated: means that the mantra practitioner puts on glorious white clothing, wears a white thread as an earring, and performs the rite as it occurs above. It is said that if one does it that way, one will be successful.

original: da ni rgyas pa'i las ston te /
analyzed: da ni rgyas pa'i las ston te /
translated: Now, the increasing rite is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mkhas pas rgyas pa bya dgos te //
analyzed: mkhas pas rgyas pa bya dgos te //
translated: The wise one must do the increasing.

original: zhes pa ni mkhas pa ni sgrub pa po cho ga dang las kyi bye brag la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mkhas pa ni sgrub pa po cho ga dang las kyi bye brag la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the adept who is skilled in the rites and the particulars of the actions.

original: rgyas pa ni dpal dang gzi brjid 'phel zhing rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa ni dpal dang gzi brjid 'phel zhing rgyas pa'o //
translated: Prosperity is the increase and expansion of glory and splendor.

original: de ni sems can phongs pa rnams bde bar bya ba'i phyir smos te /
analyzed: de ni sems can phongs pa rnams bde bar bya ba'i phyir smos te /
translated: This is mentioned for the sake of bringing happiness to destitute sentient beings.

original: khru do pa'am khru bzhi pa //
analyzed: khru do pa'am khru bzhi pa //
translated: Two cubits or four cubits,

original: de ltar mchog ni khru brgyang pa //
analyzed: de ltar mchog ni khru brgyang pa //
translated: thus the best is one cubit.

original: byas nas thab khung grub zhi pa'i //
analyzed: byas nas thab khung grub zhi pa'i //
translated: Having made it, the hearth is well-pacified.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: khru do ni thab khung gi tha tshig go //
analyzed: khru do ni thab khung gi tha tshig go //
translated: Two cubits is the measure of the hearth.

original: khru bzhi ni bang rim bzhi yod pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khru bzhi ni bang rim bzhi yod pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Four cubits is the measure of having four steps.

original: khru brgyang ni phyi'i tshad do //
analyzed: khru brgyang ni phyi'i tshad do //
translated: One cubit is the outer measure.

original: thab khung yang khru bzhi par brkos la /🔽mu ran yang btang /
analyzed: thab khung yang khru bzhi par brkos la / mu ran yang btang /
translated: Also dig the hearth four cubits,🔽and set the border.

original: mu ran la chu skyes kyang btang /
analyzed: mu ran la chu skyes kyang btang /
translated: Also set the lotus on the border.

original: kha khyer la rin po che'i phreng bas bskor dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyang bris la padma'i lte bar rin po che 'bar ba'i 'od zer ser po can bri /
analyzed: kha khyer la rin po che'i phreng bas bskor dbus su padma 'dab ma brgyang bris la padma'i lte bar rin po che 'bar ba'i 'od zer ser po can bri /
translated: Surround the edge with a garland of jewels. In the center, draw a lotus with eight petals. In the center of the lotus, draw a blazing jewel with yellow light rays.

original: bang rim dang po la rigs rnam pa lnga bri /
analyzed: bang rim dang po la rigs rnam pa lnga bri /
translated: On the first terrace, one should draw the five types of clans.

original: gnyis pa la rigs kyi sems dpa' bri'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la rigs kyi sems dpa' bri'o //
translated: On the second, one should draw the clans’ bodhisattvas.

original: gsum pa la phyogs skyong dang bkra shis bri'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la phyogs skyong dang bkra shis bri'o //
translated: On the third, one should draw the directional guardians and the auspicious ones.

original: bzhi ba la sgo gdod /
analyzed: bzhi ba la sgo gdod /
translated: On the fourth, one should draw the door guardians.

original: sngags @208b mkhan gos ser po gon nas las tshul ba zhin du byas nas /
analyzed: sngags @208b mkhan gos ser po gon nas las tshul ba zhin du byas nas /
translated: The mantrin, dressed in yellow garments, should perform the rite in accordance with the rite.

original: lus can gyi tshe dang dpal dang ga zi brjid dang bde ba'i longs spyod 'phel lo //
analyzed: lus can gyi tshe dang dpal dang ga zi brjid dang bde ba'i longs spyod 'phel lo //
translated: The enjoyments of life, glory, splendor, and happiness of embodied beings will increase.

original: rgyas pa'i don bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i don bshad zin to //
translated: The rite of increase has been explained.

original: da ni dbang gi las ston te /
analyzed: da ni dbang gi las ston te /
translated: Now, the rite of power is taught.

original: de ni ma rungs pa dbang du bsdu pa'i phyir smos te /
analyzed: de ni ma rungs pa dbang du bsdu pa'i phyir smos te /
translated: That is mentioned for the purpose of subduing the wicked.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de nas phan phyir nges pa yang //
analyzed: de nas phan phyir nges pa yang //
translated: Then, for the sake of benefit,

original: dbang du bya ba'i las bya ste //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i las bya ste //
translated: one should perform the rite of subjugation.

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de nas ni rgyas pa'i rting thogs su 'byung pas so //
analyzed: de nas ni rgyas pa'i rting thogs su 'byung pas so //
translated: “Then” means that it occurs after the rite of increase.

original: phan phyir ni sems can 'dod chags can dang nyon mongs pas nyen pa la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan phyir ni sems can 'dod chags can dang nyon mongs pas nyen pa la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “For the sake of benefit” is for the sake of benefiting passionate sentient beings afflicted by afflictions.

original: dbang du bya ba ni de rnams chags pa'i tshul gyis dbang du bsdu zhing theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba ni de rnams chags pa'i tshul gyis dbang du bsdu zhing theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The subjugation is the subjugation of those by the method of passion, which is the same as the generation of the thought of enlightenment in the Great Vehicle.

original: de'i thabs ni ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i thabs ni ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: What is the method for that?

original: thab khung gsung yi dbyibs 'dra ba //
analyzed: thab khung gsung yi dbyibs 'dra ba //
translated: The hearth is like the shape of a bow.

original: khru gang dam ni khru dob //🔽gru bzhir byas pa de dbus su //
analyzed: khru gang dam ni khru dob // gru bzhir byas pa de dbus su //
translated: One cubit, or two cubits, or four cubits,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: in the middle of that,

original: hom gyi thab khung yang gzhu'i dbyibs ltar brko bar bya ste /
analyzed: hom gyi thab khung yang gzhu'i dbyibs ltar brko bar bya ste /
translated: The hearth of the homa is also to be dug out like the shape of a bow.

original: thab khung tham khru gang 'bri nag khru do rab khru bzhi pa byas la /
analyzed: thab khung tham khru gang 'bri nag khru do rab khru bzhi pa byas la /
translated: The hearth is one cubit, the pit is two cubits, and the best is four cubits.

original: thab khung gi dbus su padma dmar po bris la /
analyzed: thab khung gi dbus su padma dmar po bris la /
translated: In the middle of the hearth, draw a red lotus.

original: padma'i lte ba la mda' dang gzhu bcas pa yang bri /
analyzed: padma'i lte ba la mda' dang gzhu bcas pa yang bri /
translated: In the center of the lotus, draw an arrow and a bow.

original: kha khyer la yang mda' dang gzhu dmar po yang bri /
analyzed: kha khyer la yang mda' dang gzhu dmar po yang bri /
translated: Draw red arrows and a bow on the lip as well.

original: phyi rol du yang bar rim btod la bang rim dang po la rigs lnga /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang bar rim btod la bang rim dang po la rigs lnga /
translated: Also, outside, make a series of platforms. On the first platform, draw the five clans.

original: gnyis pa la rigs kyi sems dpa'/
analyzed: gnyis pa la rigs kyi sems dpa'/
translated: On the second, draw the clans' spiritual heroes.

original: de'i phyi rol du sgo gdod /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du sgo gdod /
translated: Outside of that, make a door.

original: sngags mkhan yang chas gos dmar bo gon /
analyzed: sngags mkhan yang chas gos dmar bo gon /
translated: The mantra practitioner also wears red clothes.

original: mchod rdzas kyang me tog dmar po dang / sran ma dang / bu ram dang / shing thog dmar po dang / mar dang gur gum bsres pa dang / tsandan dmar po'i phye ma la sogs bsreg rdzas mchod rdzas dang bsres te spyin sreg byas na thams cad de'i mod la dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod rdzas kyang me tog dmar po dang / sran ma dang / bu ram dang / shing thog dmar po dang / mar dang gur gum bsres pa dang / tsandan dmar po'i phye ma la sogs bsreg rdzas mchod rdzas dang bsres te spyin sreg byas na thams cad de'i mod la dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers red flowers, beans, molasses, red fruits, ghee mixed with saffron, red sandalwood powder, and so forth, mixed with the burnt offerings, all will be under one's control at that very moment.

original: thab khung gzhu'i dbyibs 'dra bar byas pa ni zhi gnas gzhu 'dra ba dang lhag mthong mda' 'dra bas thams cad dbang du sdud pa'i rtags so //
analyzed: thab khung gzhu'i dbyibs 'dra bar byas pa ni zhi gnas gzhu 'dra ba dang lhag mthong mda' 'dra bas thams cad dbang du sdud pa'i rtags so //
translated: The hearth made in the shape of a bow is a sign of subduing everything by means of calm abiding resembling a bow and special insight resembling an arrow.

original: dbang gi las ba stan zin to //
analyzed: dbang gi las ba stan zin to //
translated: The rite of power has been completed.

original: drag po'i las ni 'dir ma gsungs so //
analyzed: drag po'i las ni 'dir ma gsungs so //
translated: The rite of wrath is not taught here.

original: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas smos ci 'tshal zhes pa'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa la sogs pa zhes pa nas smos ci 'tshal zhes pa'i bar gyis ni /
translated: Then, from Brahma and so forth... up to ...what need is there to mention...

original: 'khor srung bar dam bcas pa ston /
analyzed: 'khor srung bar dam bcas pa ston /
translated: shows the assembly's promise to protect.

original: gang zhig cho ga zhib mo zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa legs @209a * //
analyzed: gang zhig cho ga zhib mo zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa legs @209a * //
translated: From Whoever... up to the Tathagata...

original: par 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes pa'i bar gyis ni cho ga zhib mo 'di gang na spyod pa bkur bar ba stan /
analyzed: par 'tshal bar bgyi'o zhes pa'i bar gyis ni cho ga zhib mo 'di gang na spyod pa bkur bar ba stan /
translated: The passage from I will explain up to I will teach indicates the praise of the practice of this detailed rite.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas legs par sgrubs shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni legs par sgrubs shig pa ba stan to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas legs par sgrubs shig ces bya ba'i bar gyis ni legs par sgrubs shig pa ba stan to //
translated: Then, the passage from Then the Blessed One up to you should accomplish it well indicates the accomplishment.

original: de yan chad ni cho ga'i phan yon no //
analyzed: de yan chad ni cho ga'i phan yon no //
translated: From here on is the benefit of the rite.

original: da ni rigs bzhi 'khor los sgyur ba'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
analyzed: da ni rigs bzhi 'khor los sgyur ba'i dkyil 'khor ston te /
translated: Now, the wheel-turning maṇḍala of the four families is taught.

original: de la rigs bzhi ni rdo rje'i rigs dang rin po che'i rigs dang padma dang las kyi rigs so //
analyzed: de la rigs bzhi ni rdo rje'i rigs dang rin po che'i rigs dang padma dang las kyi rigs so //
translated: Among them, the four families are the vajra family, the jewel family, the lotus, and the action family.

original: 'khor lo ni bskor du btub pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni bskor du btub pa'o //
translated: The wheel is what can be turned.

original: sgyur ba ni des khams gsum sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgyur ba ni des khams gsum sgyur ba'o //
translated: Turning is the transformation of the three realms by that.

original: dkyil ni chos nyid la 'khor ni phrin las so ;
analyzed: dkyil ni chos nyid la 'khor ni phrin las so ;
translated: The center is reality, and the retinue is activity.

original: / de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Moreover, why is that?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsang sngags dang rig sngags dang snying po thams cad brtan par bya ba'i phyir nyid kyi snying po 'di bshad de zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes gsang sngags dang rig sngags dang snying po thams cad brtan par bya ba'i phyir nyid kyi snying po 'di bshad de zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, Vajrapani, in order to stabilize all the secret mantras, knowledge mantras, and essence mantras, explained this essence mantra.

original: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs su 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de nas ni skabs kyi rting thogs su 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Then means it occurs immediately after the context.

original: bcom pa ni nyes pa'i skyon bcom pa yin la /
analyzed: bcom pa ni nyes pa'i skyon bcom pa yin la /
translated: The Blessed One is the one who has destroyed the faults of faults.

original: ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dregs pa can 'dul ba'i legs pa'i yon tan dang ldan la /🔽'das pa ni shes pas srid ba la mi gnas /
analyzed: ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i dregs pa can 'dul ba'i legs pa'i yon tan dang ldan la / 'das pa ni shes pas srid ba la mi gnas /
translated: The one who is endowed is endowed with the good qualities of subduing the arrogant ones of the world.

original: thugs rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pas 'das pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rjes zhi ba la mi gnas pas 'das pa'o //
translated: The transcendent one is transcendent because of not abiding in existence due to knowledge, and not abiding in peace due to compassion.

original: phyag na rdo rje ni thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rtags rdo rje bsnams bas so ;
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje ni thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi rtags rdo rje bsnams bas so ;

analyzed: snying po ni byang chub kyi sems la thams cad ni der thams cad 'dus pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: badzra ni phyag na rdo rje'o //

original: byang phyogs su mon dre dang / mon gru dang / khrums stod dang / khrums smad dang / nam gru dang / tha skar dang / bra nye rnams ni autpala she dag bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su mon dre dang / mon gru dang / khrums stod dang / khrums smad dang / nam gru dang / tha skar dang / bra nye rnams ni autpala she dag bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the north, the asterisms Pūrvābhādrapadā, Uttarābhādrapadā, Revatī, Aśvinī, Bharaṇī, and Kṛttikā hold utpala flowers.

original: da ni rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams ston te /
analyzed: da ni rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams ston te /
translated: Now the four great kings are taught.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams ni //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams ni //
translated: The four great kings

original: zhes pa ni /🔽shar du yul 'khor srung pi wang /
analyzed: zhes pa ni / shar du yul 'khor srung pi wang /
translated: are taught.🔽In the east, Dhṛtarāṣṭra holds a vīṇā.

original: lhor 'phags skyes po ral gri /
analyzed: lhor 'phags skyes po ral gri /
translated: In the south, Virūḍhaka holds a sword.

original: nub tu mig mi bzang sprul zhags /
analyzed: nub tu mig mi bzang sprul zhags /
translated: In the west, Virūpākṣa holds a snake-knot.

original: byang du rnam thos sras ba dan bsnams pa ste /
analyzed: byang du rnam thos sras ba dan bsnams pa ste /
translated: In the north, Vaiśravaṇa holds a banner.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i lha bzhi bcu ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i lha bzhi bcu ste /
translated: Thus, there are forty worldly deities.

original: brgya drug cu rtsa gsum mo ;
analyzed: brgya drug cu rtsa gsum mo ;
translated: There are one hundred and sixty-three.

original: / da ni de'i phyi rol gyi snam bu ston te /
analyzed: / da ni de'i phyi rol gyi snam bu ston te /
translated: Now, the outer ledges are taught.

original: phyogs skyong 'jig rten skyong ba rnams //
analyzed: phyogs skyong 'jig rten skyong ba rnams //
translated: The directional guardians and world guardians

original: zhes pa ni phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyang na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyang na /
translated: are in the four directions and eight subdirections.

original: 'jig rten skyong bas phyogs skyong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong bas phyogs skyong ngo //
translated: The world guardians are the directional guardians.

original: brgya byin rdo rje /🔽gshin rje thod dbyug / chu lha sprul zhags /🔽gnod spyin pe con /
analyzed: brgya byin rdo rje / gshin rje thod dbyug / chu lha sprul zhags / gnod spyin pe con /
translated: Indra holds a vajra.🔽Yama holds a club with a skull on top.🔽Kubera holds a mongoose.

original: me lha bgrang phreng /
analyzed: me lha bgrang phreng /
translated: Agni holds a rosary.

original: bden bral ral gri /🔽rlung lha ba dan /
analyzed: bden bral ral gri / rlung lha ba dan /
translated: Nirṛti holds a sword.🔽Vāyu holds a banner.

original: dbang ldan rtse gsum /🔽sa bdag mche zhags /
analyzed: dbang ldan rtse gsum / sa bdag mche zhags /
translated: Īśāna holds a trident.🔽Bhūpati holds a plow.

original: sa'i lha mo bum pa /
analyzed: sa'i lha mo bum pa /
translated: Pṛthivī holds a vase.

original: nyi ma padma /
analyzed: nyi ma padma /
translated: Sūrya holds a lotus.

original: zla ba ku mu ta ste /
analyzed: zla ba ku mu ta ste /
translated: Candra holds a kumuda.

original: de ltar na brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: de ltar na brgya bdun cu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: Thus, there are one hundred and seventy-five.

original: de ni gza' dang rgyu skar gyi snam bu dang bsre'o //
analyzed: de ni gza' dang rgyu skar gyi snam bu dang bsre'o //
translated: This is mixed with the ledge of the planets and stars.

original: da ni phyi rol gyi snam bu'i ngan song gsum gyi don ston te /
analyzed: da ni phyi rol gyi snam bu'i ngan song gsum gyi don ston te /
translated: Now, the meaning of the three lower realms on the outer ledge is taught.

original: de yi phyi rol dmyal ba kun //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de yi phyi rol dmyal ba kun //🔽zhes pa ni /
translated: Outside of that are all the hells.

original: dmyal ba yang mdor bsdu na tsha grang gnyis /
analyzed: dmyal ba yang mdor bsdu na tsha grang gnyis /
translated: The hells are summarized as hot and cold.

original: nyi tshe ba dang kha 'khor ba dang gsum mo //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba dang kha 'khor ba dang gsum mo //
translated: There are three: the occasional, the surrounding and the neighboring.

original: tsha ba'i brgyang ni yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / du 'bod dang / du 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa dang brgyang do //🔽grang ba'i brgyang ni /
analyzed: tsha ba'i brgyang ni yang sos dang / thig nag dang / bsdus 'joms dang / du 'bod dang / du 'bod chen po dang / tsha ba dang / rab tu tsha ba dang / mnar med pa dang brgyang do // grang ba'i brgyang ni /
translated: The eight hot hells are the Reviving, the Black Line, the Crushing, the Howling, the Great Howling, the Hot, the Extremely Hot and the Unrelenting.🔽The eight cold hells are the Blistering, the Bursting Blister, the Chattering Teeth, the Lamenting, the Aaaaargh!

original: chu bur dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa chu zer ba dang / autpala ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa chen po ste brgyang do //
analyzed: chu bur dang / chu bur rdol ba dang / so thams thams pa dang / kyi hud zer ba dang / aa chu zer ba dang / autpala ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa dang / padma ltar gas pa chen po ste brgyang do //
translated: , the Splitting Like a Blue Lotus, the Splitting Like a Lotus and the Splitting Like a Great Lotus.

original: nyi tshe ba dang / kha 'khor gnyis te bco brgyang do //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba dang / kha 'khor gnyis te bco brgyang do //
translated: The occasional and the surrounding make eighteen.🔽They are named, or designated, or written with a dot.

original: ming ngam brda'am thig ler bris te gzhag /'dod chags la sogs byol song 'dra //
analyzed: ming ngam brda'am thig ler bris te gzhag /'dod chags la sogs byol song 'dra //
translated: Attachment and so forth are like animals.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod chags phug ron dang / gti mug phag dang / zhe sdang sprul dang / nga rgyal rtsangs @213a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod chags phug ron dang / gti mug phag dang / zhe sdang sprul dang / nga rgyal rtsangs @213a * //
translated: The pigeon is attachment, the pig is stupidity, the snake is anger, and the lizard is pride.🔽

original: pa la sogs pa bri ste /
analyzed: pa la sogs pa bri ste /
translated: This means that one should draw a pigeon for passion, a pig for stupidity, a snake for hatred, a lizard for pride, and so on.

original: de ltar nyi shu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar nyi shu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Thus there are twenty-two,

original: spyir brgya dgu bcu rtsa bdun yod do //
analyzed: spyir brgya dgu bcu rtsa bdun yod do //
translated: and in general there are one hundred and ninety-seven.

original: sgo sgor gsungs pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: sgo sgor gsungs pa de bzhin du //
translated: As it is said for each door,

original: zhes pa ni gong du sgo bzhi rim du gsungs ba de rnams la bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du sgo bzhi rim du gsungs ba de rnams la bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: this means that the four doors mentioned above are to be done.

original: mchod pa'i bye brag ni bde ste ma smos so //
analyzed: mchod pa'i bye brag ni bde ste ma smos so //
translated: The varieties of offerings are easy to understand, so they are not mentioned.

original: da ni sngags mkhan dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i don ston te /
analyzed: da ni sngags mkhan dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i don ston te /
translated: Now the meaning of the mantra practitioner entering the maṇḍala is taught:

original: de nas sngags mkhan nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: de nas sngags mkhan nyid kyis ni //
translated: Then the mantra practitioner

original: spyan drangs bdag nyid 'jug par bya //
analyzed: spyan drangs bdag nyid 'jug par bya //
translated: should invite and enter himself.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means:

original: de nas ni gong gi rting thogs so //
analyzed: de nas ni gong gi rting thogs so //
translated: Then is immediately after the above.

original: sngags mkhan ni slob dpon te /
analyzed: sngags mkhan ni slob dpon te /
translated: The mantra practitioner is the master,

original: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / cho ga dang / thabs kyi bye brag la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags dang / phyag rgya dang / cho ga dang / thabs kyi bye brag la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skilled in the distinctions of mantra, mudrā, ritual, and method.

original: spyan drangs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis 'phags pa rnams spyan drangs nas gzugs brnyan la phab ste /🔽bdag nyid kyang dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs pa rnams rang bzhin gyis 'phags pa rnams spyan drangs nas gzugs brnyan la phab ste / bdag nyid kyang dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having invited the naturally exalted ones, they are caused to descend into the images.🔽And one should enter the mandala oneself.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni dbang bskur la //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni dbang bskur la // zhes pa ni /
translated: One should confer initiation on oneself.

original: bdag nyid ni slob dpon no ;
analyzed: bdag nyid ni slob dpon no ;
translated: One means the master.

original: / dbang bskur ni slob ma de'i 'og tu dbang bskur ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / dbang bskur ni slob ma de'i 'og tu dbang bskur ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Initiation means the initiation of the disciple, which is to be performed after the master has entered the mandala.

original: da ni slob dpon de'i yon tan ston te /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon de'i yon tan ston te /
translated: Now the qualities of that master are taught.

original: sdom gnas dam tshig ldan pa dang // zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sdom gnas dam tshig ldan pa dang // zhes pa ni /
translated: One who abides in the vow, who is endowed with the pledge,

original: sdom pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: Vow is the vow of the bodhisattva.

original: dam tshig ni yo ga'i dam tshig lnga'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni yo ga'i dam tshig lnga'o //
translated: Pledge is the five pledges of Yoga.
